title: CrossCountry Trains
location: Cannon House, 18 The Priory Queensway Birmingham B4 6BS GB

items.title: Why can’t you give 0 stars!
items.review_text:
Why can’t you give 0 stars!

Trains always packed, never have enough carriages seriously they go from se England to Scotland and often only 4-5 carriages. Never any seats. If you book there is always someone in it and never any staff around. Very Expensive, overly busy,  dirty, crap service. Seriously it’s always been this way and nothing is ever done! You can pay in excess of £200 for some of their longer journeys and not even get a seat! Hire a car and avoid like the plague if you can.

items.title: 0 stars
items.review_text:
0 stars

Spent an hour on a train at a stop because of technical issues. They called an engineer and tried to fix it. Hour later, ohh we cancelled the train. Appalling and very shizz train company

items.title: Train was cancelled
items.review_text: Train was cancelled. Then next train stick more then 1hour on the track. Then going back to departing station for another train to come

items.title: The overcrowding is getting worse!
items.review_text:
Shocking! Avoid at all costs! 
I use this service every week. I wish I had an alternative. Cross Country trains don’t deserve their licence to operate. I truly hope the government step in and take over. 
There are people passing out because the have to stand up for 4 hours at a time. The technology for seat reservations is always off. The toilets are never cleaned. There’s no catering option. They need station security to marshall arrivals at stations because so many people are trying to get  on and off. Their advertising should be taken down as it’s completely false!

items.title: Sold me a ticket just to refuse me…
items.review_text: Sold me a ticket just to refuse me entry 2 minutes later due to train being full. People were packed like sardines or like this is a Bombay train service, not Oxford. Absolute joke of a company.

items.title: Awful greedy company there trains are…
items.review_text: Awful greedy company there trains are so vile and out dated over priced fairs and a extremely unorganised establishment

items.title: Good stuff
items.review_text: 1st time user found polite helpfully staff clean train traveled sat 4 may to birmingham from chesterfield pleasant experience surprised how cheap and fast train was will use ongoing thanks for the ease of your service it worked out brilliant for me  ,pat

items.title: It's now over a year since my first…
items.review_text: It's now over a year since my first review. The prices have gone up yet again and still the same terrible service journey after journey. I wish there were other options but there just aren't. Today's train is on time, but overcrowded to the point of danger, the carriage is dirty and the toilet smells. There are no staff to be seen. How cross country can still have a licence to operate this service is beyond me

items.title: I had a previous journey on Crisd…
items.review_text: I had a previous journey on Cross Country where I was threatened and verbally abused which was so serious the police charged the vile  men. I am so anxious about travelling again and asked if they would upgrade me to first class as I don’t feel safe. They refused as they obviously don’t care that I was put through this ordeal. It’s cost enough for regular class. I’m not bothered about the benefits of first class I just want to be safe where there are staff.

items.title: A first class rip off
items.review_text: Imagine paying 2x the price for a first class ticket to find alcoholic drinks not included, onboard food to be utterly disgusting. Will never pay the extra money again. Terrible service.

items.title: First Class Experience
items.review_text:
Despite what some people say, CrossCountry can be good.

Yesterday was my first time travelling with them on their ‘Voyagers’ in First Class. On the way there, no complimentary trolley. Standard class was overcrowded too. Everything else was decent except some rattling. On the way back, complimentary trolley with the kindest lady came, and everything was great except the interior being worn down with gaps in seats and tears in carpet. We arrived on time to our destinations, and it was a nice return journey. Both trains were clean, and I enjoyed the journeys, the ticket was surprisingly inexpensive also for the part I travelled :)

Overall, whilst there are flaws, XC can still be great!

items.title: Cross-Countries trains exploitation of…
items.review_text:
Cross-Countries trains exploitation of young student workerforce by elites is despicable. It's sickening. 
Employees dedicate their entire day to assigned shifts, only to find out the train has been cancelled after a grueling hour-long journey to the depot. 
This recurring cruelty is appalling, and it's outrageous that they continue to get away with it.

items.title: Second time I have used this operator
items.review_text: Second time I have used this operator. 1st time booked 1st class andvanc .Only 4 coaches from Manchester to Basingstoke (train goes all the way to the south coast). So many people crammed in they de-classified 1st class. Today Basingstoke to Manchester. Even worse. 4 carriages. 2 1st class carriages . No declassification this time. People could take up their reserved seats. Stood all the way. Was going to do this while stood up but rubbish wi-go. 🙄

items.title: Being late was the least of the problems…
items.review_text: Being late due to a landslide was the least of the worries. Two carriages for a trip starting at Cardiff and ending in Nottingham is an utter disgrace. Standing room only for a huge amount of people and this is normal as I am unfortunately forced to use your "service" regularly. Where is the health and safety here? If this train had come of the rails, many people would die. I truly hate your feckless company, running trains on a shoestring, compromising safety with total contempt for your customers. In addition, no tickets are ever checked. And add having to turf people out of seats that belong to you, because you bothered to reserve your seat, it happens on every single journey with CrossCountry. As for access to toilets, forget it, it is impossible due to the lines of people standing in the aisles. What about disabled people and wheelchairs users? Again, impossible to travel or get assistance. No chance to get refreshments either. Your company is a sick joke and should be reported. You couldn't run a sweet shop, let alone a rail company. I assume the chief executive got his/her big bonus again this year. A truly pathetic excuse for a company, epitomising the state of the rail industry. The sooner nationalisation happens the better.

items.title: Unfortunate to say but an absolute…
items.review_text: Unfortunate to say but an absolute disgrace. Lovely staff who do their best. But so few carriages packed all the way from Birmingham to York stood all the way tried different carriages inside the train going round the outside of the train. Please take away the franchise, the owners are making so much money £160 return with 4 carriages for a journey hundreds of miles long at peak times. No room even in the existing seats. Worst of all the train providers unfortunately.

items.title: How Cross Country Trains hates its customers
items.review_text: I was on a Cross Country train which was delayed by 2.5 hours between Bristol Parkway and Cheltenham. When I submitted my delay repay claim they immediately forwarded it to West Midlands Railway.  Cross Country despises its customers and will not consider helping them.  They advise us to claim on delay repay after a hold up fully knowing that we do not have a cat in hell's chance of getting any recompense.  They really enjoy rubbing our noses in it.  They are the only train operator which does not offer delay repay after 15 minutes delay.

items.title: Total Uselessness.
items.review_text: Aslef have announced strikes on May 6th to 9th May 2024 and an overtime ban on 10th and 11th May. Previous overtime bans have seriously affected services. I have 3 journeys booked on May 11th, the final journey being on Cross Country from Reading to Derby at 5.45pm. I have been advised by East Midlands Trains and GWR of dates on which I can find out if the overtime ban would affect my booked tickets and of alternative arrangements I can make. I today contacted Cross Country to ask the same 2 questions. When will I be able to find out if my train is affected and what alternative service can I use if it is. The gentleman I spoke to asked me 3 times what service etc and 3 times I told him ,3 times I asked him would I be able to use an alternative service,3 times he said hold on I will seek advice. He came back and said he could not tell me. Very poor service.

items.title: Avoid using this company’s train service
items.review_text: This company is a joke, even more so about their strikes. I wish I didn’t have to use this company everyday for work, I can’t stand it. I had to spend so much money on Ubers to get to work because of these selfish people. I was told that I would be reimbursed for this by 2 of their different members of staff over the phone, only to find out after weeks of chasing them up that I would no longer be reimbursed. Disgusting, it’s not the working classes people problem that your staff strike!!! They’re often rude as-well on the trains and snobby. Cross Country’s trains are late most of the time, because of constant delays, unreliable, I’ve had my train be cancelled many times which just messes up your day so much. The only nice member of staff is a middle aged man who pushes the snack/drinks trolley on the 7:19 train to Nottingham, always nice, friendly, professional and helpful, I wish I knew his name but he can do better than cross country. Imagine I pay £172.80 a month for this season pass and it’s so expensive and awful, they said I’d get £8 compensation for the strike days …, that’s like a cup of coffee nowadays, like I said at the start for this review what an absolute joke.

items.title: Needs more carriages
items.review_text: I have used this company for about 3 return journeys a year over the last few years, mainly Oxford to Manchester or Birmingham Int to Oxford. Used to be a great service, however in the last year or so the coaches have been cut from around 11 to merely 4 or 5, for a popular route travelling from Bournemouth to Manchester Piccadilly. Yesterday there was only four coaches, and I had to stand packed in tightly next to the toilet for about an hour, with some people standing like that for far longer. Not the most relaxing journey, and very unfair considering I'd booked a seat.

items.title: Operators not deserving of franchise
items.review_text: Travelling today from Banbury to Southampton. Reminded why this train operator has awful reviews. Horribly overcrowded. Standing in carriages. Too few coaches. Old coaches that originate from the bearded wonderboy/Virgin era when it was thought that we would like the experience of a bucket airline. Horribly claustrophobic seats with little legroom. No PowerPoints, at least where I was sitting. Strip the operator of its franchise and give to a decent company. Chiltern railways could do a much better job.

items.title: Terrible service no refreshments on…
items.review_text: Terrible service no refreshments on train from Manchester to Bristol 2 weeks in a row shocking disregard for customers.Still manage to check tickets twice on journey. Should be sacked

items.title: You would get there quicker walking…
items.review_text: You would get there quicker walking than relying on this bunch of cowboys .The train in the rockies in Canada is more reliable than these and thats 48 hours late at times

items.title: 4 carriages at rush hour from…
items.review_text:
4 carriages at rush hour from Birmingham to Bournemouth.  Despite booking seats - I had to stand for my return journey.  £234 for a return trip!   

WiFi doesn’t work 

Over crowded, filthy and barely fit for purpose

items.title: Over crowded,  standing only for hours, hot and stinking train
items.review_text:
Well it is 16:20 and standing in an overcrowded stinking train by the toilets in . the corridor. 12 people in the vestibule.
Absolute disgrace only using 5 car train to go to Edinburgh. Appalling value for money.

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Awful. Delayed by 28 minutes, which overall impacted my journey by an hour because I missed my other train due to this delay. Then I requested compensation and they said no because it was only 28 minutes delay and it needs to be 30 minutes to give any kind of compensation. Not to add that I wasn’t even able to get into my seat because other people had that seat reserved??? Awful experience, shame on you cross country

items.title: Absolute disgrace!
items.review_text: Absolute disgrace!! Today's train to Penzance, packed on like cattle, couldn't even get in the doors! My son travelling 5 hours has had to stand the whole journey....you should be ashamed of yourselves. Clearly only bothered about the money and not the comfort or experience of the journey!!!!

items.title: What a shower of ess ayche eye tea
items.review_text:
What a shower of ess ayche eye tea. The train from Edinburgh to Plymouth was so overcrowded that the majority of the carriages were crammed with baggage, and the connecting passageways littered with people sat on the floor. 

Then our carriage was invaded by a drunken, clearly disturbed individual, with vomit inducing body odour, who proceeded to mutter threateningly under his breath between sips of Special Brew. 

Two seperate issues, really. The first could be solved by more carriages, the second by more attentive staff. This company is failign to provide the kind of standards or service that you expect when forking out £151.47 for a standard single journey!! 

First class was available at a cost of £431, however on passing through to find the train manager, to discuss the gibbering, beer soaked weirdo mentioned earlier; I found first class to be rammed full of very p**sed off people, who clearly were expecting a little more room for their money!

Crosscountry Trains, you are failing.

items.title: One hour journey took FIVE hours.
items.review_text:
One hour journey took FIVE hours.
Been complaining and sending delay repays since December and ALL were ignored (entitled to a full refund as per their own t&cs) 
Had to include MP / ombudsman / citizens advice to get a response after 5 months. 
Even then…
No explanation for the delay. No apology. No compensation for having to book a £60 Uber after they left me stranded at a random train station and wouldn’t book one for me then

Just asked for my bank details and that was that. I’m not even convinced I’m going to get that after showing this level of incompetence

items.title: These guys are at it.
items.review_text:
These guys are at it.
Train booked for £11.00, cancelled 10 mins later. Apply for refund then look for the next available train. Exactly the same time (almost definitely the same train), however, now the price is £28.00? 😅
Attempted to write a formal complaint on their website rather than leave a poor public review, complaints page not working. 
Standard.

items.title: 0942am service from Birmingham New…
items.review_text:
0942am service from Birmingham New Street to Weston super Mare on the 16.04.24.

Brilliant and polite service from Justin, the hospitality/ catering manager with the on board refreshment service.

Incredibly polite, well done!

items.title: Witnessing Barbaric exploitation of a…
items.review_text:
Witnessing Barbaric exploitation of a young staff member at Birmingham station is utterly heinous. 
The CrossCountry Trains employee endured a brutal assault by management, being slapped across the face simply for questioning the sudden cancellation of his shift after a long commute and canceled family outing. 
This egregious mistreatment of young workers is beyond reprehensible.

items.title: Absolutely appalling service.I could give it no stars I would
items.review_text: If I could give it no stars I would. We were shoved on the already packed train sat on the floor by a stinky toilet. Ticket over 100 pound to sit on the floor. Disgusting service they should be ashamed of themselves. Also health and safety terrible if there was a crash we would never be found. I am so appalled and disgusted.

items.title: Free WIFI?
items.review_text: Free WIFI?! It’s impossible to use or download anything ,hence impossible to work! For the price of tickets at least you would expect this to be provided! Also freezing cold on the train

items.title: How this co is allowed to operate beyond belief
items.review_text:
Absolutely joke of a train journey,  how this operator wins contracts  for the routes is beyond me.
Firstly travelling from Birmingham to Sheffield,  we was greeted by a disgusting train, overcrowded beyond belief, seats sold to 2 different people so there were arguments breaking out. To top it off the toilet broke, but because of the overcrowding you couldn't get through to the next carriage. 
People were going to toilets in bottles.

items.title: 13:03 Birmingham to Bournemouth.
items.review_text:
13:03 Birmingham to Bournemouth.
You consistently put on 4 carriages... and it is over crowded. Paid passengers with seat reservations cannot even navigate the sea of people down the aisles to get to their seats. Shocking service yet again.

items.title: Our first time on a train journey for…
items.review_text: Our first time on a train journey for 30+ years. We booked in advance for a journey from Scunthorpe to Birmingham. On joining CrossCountry at Sheffield we found the train packed and had to press the people sat in our seats to let us have them and they only did that due to the fact my wife and I are elderly and disabled.

items.title: Everything went smoothly
items.review_text: When I knew my journey was going to be a Cross Country train I was worried I would be delayed as I have experienced this with them before. However the train journey ran very smoothly. It was on time, not too packed out and cash payments were accepted for refreshments. This is better than other train companies who have moved to card only. I got caught out on my outward journey on a different train service that was card only, and the card machine wasn’t working. There was an announcement that there wouldn’t be any catering from Newcastle to Birmingham. Which I felt was a long journey for people without refreshments if people didn’t know there would be none. I would assume there had been an announcement in the train station to tell people.

items.title: Worst Rail Service in the Country
items.review_text:
At 1925, in possession of an original ticket, a conductor tried charging me a £108 upgrade for a 2hr 28mim journey to Banbury. No catering or anything just sit in the cab. £54 and hour for the same service as Avanti West Coast Premium with dilapidated surroundings.
I travel all over the country on the train and CrossCountry are the WORST

items.title: Expensive and grotty
items.review_text:
Expensive, dirty,slow no trolley service.
3 carriages from Stansted Airport to Brum so always crowded.
Actual physical carriage much narrower than average, tapers inwards so seats small 
Armrests a hazard and in any case broken.
My return trip via GWR was a dream and fast!

items.title: XTC not repaying for delay in the appropriate time.
items.review_text:
Terrible refund service after a delay for over an hour.
Initially i was advised id get a refund within 10 days ( I think this is the legal requirement), I responded to say I'm glad it was resolved..however..I'm now being told, 10 days later, that my response has some how halted the process. Their system thinks my email back needs resolving so the refund was placed on hold??
Apparently the process will start again today now.
Seems like a scam to keep hold of customers money for longer to me

items.title: I had the most horrible experience
items.review_text: I had the most horrible experience . This train line need to change their staff. They’re extremely rude and arrogant . They put my child’s life in jeopardy by stopping me in between the platform and the train . Tried to communicate calmly with her however no response was received nicely from her. I would never travel with them again I would stop anyone from travelling with with as well . They need to be shut down whole load of f***** they have in there

items.title: They allow fraud on their trains
items.review_text: Awful train company in first class get no proper meal. Wi fi on train never works. Few times guards doesn't check tickets and allows people sit in first class with standard tickets this is fraud and a crime. Guard had a go at me for going on different service as mine was cancelled very rude and aggressive attitude you can't treat people like this. Never enough coaches on the train. Have to pay for alcohol in first class.

items.title: Better off Walking
items.review_text: Well where to begin…. These trains are the single most unreliable , uncomfortable and down right unpleasant to travel on anywhere in the UK. How they can charge 80 quid for a ticket when half the trains are rammed and the other half cancel on the day (this happens regularly) is beyond me.

items.title: What an absolute shower of a company
items.review_text: What an absolute shower of a company, trains not enough seats, many standing even thou first class carriages are deserted. Trains running late, staff on train i was on utterly rude and unhelpful.  Not once was tickets checked on my journey probably down to unable to walk through carriages due to overcrowding.  Its just a shame if and when they lose the franchise nothing will change as it will still be same staff.

items.title: Worst trains ever
items.review_text: Travelled from Durham to Bristol parkway. Train was overcrowded, luggage rack full to overflowing and overhead shelf to narrow to fit suitcase. Someone was sat in my booked seat who refused to move and when someone eventually came around to check my ticket he was uninterested when I informed him. Temperature of the carriage was very variable. Later in the journey a family of four joined the train who had booked last minute and their seats which should have been reserved, weren’t. ( just as well as I had sat in their seat due to someone sitting in mine!)

items.title: Had a nightmare journey from Manchester…
items.review_text:
Had a nightmare journey from Manchester to Reading this week. As a disabled person, I booked a seat and ended up on a 4 car Manchester to Bournemouth service which was packed out. Near my journey end I was asked to get up because I hadn't booked a seat and someone else had. Showed my seat booking but that wasn't enough.
My return journey was just as bad, packed out and most seats had obscured windows.
I will make sure I never travel by this company again, I can't see how a company can provide a service where the product makes you unwell

items.title: It's not common I leave a review
items.review_text:
It's not common I leave a review, but, given the ticket price and the fact that every single time these trains are late, dirty, over crowded, have no food on board and broken toilets, I felt it appropriate to. Why oh why can't they get it right? Not even a little bit. I have to go regularly to Birmingham for work and actually I'm now forced to be unenvironmentally friendly because the service is just too unreliable.

Someone, somewhere, stand up and be accountable. If countries can charge an eight of the price and get it right 99% of the time - what is going on?

items.title: Nil stars actually. Unsafe to be on the train
items.review_text: Nil stars actually, Shocking. I don't travel much by train and after yesterday, I know why. 4 coaches Plymouth to Edinburgh. 1 was First class and half empty, The others were totally rammed, hardly anywhere to stand. My seat reservation wasn't showing on the screen and someone sat there, no wonder. This train was not safe to be on. Reservation cock up again on my return journey some peoples seats triple booked. Train Manager and buffet service hiding in First Class. Bring back British rail. I will be taking the car next time. Shockingly bad service.

items.title: Worst U.K. rail operator
items.review_text: Trains too short. Dangerously overcrowded. Staff useless. Seats are cramped and uncomfortable. First class WILDLY expensive (£284 for a two hour journey, booked three months in advance). If an alternative route is available, use it.

items.title: How Does Cross-Country Still Hold A Licence
items.review_text: Travelling on the Derby - Edinburgh train today, spent most of the journey sitting o the floor! More over-crowed than a Tube train at rush hour. Why? Because of only four carriages. One of which was first class.Surely in holding a train licence there is a duty of care to passengers. Given the large number of complaints on here, I don't see any duty of care from CC. In the same way that Virgin Media are being investigated because of the huge number of complaints ti the ombudsman, we should do the same to Cross Country.

items.title: Shockingly bad train service
items.review_text: Shocking! Only 4 carriages for a 4 hour trip  from Manchester to Southampton. People standing up in the isles and vestibules for most of the Journey.  Couldn’t get near the seat I had booked. Had to stand for ages then literally fight for a seat!  No ticket inspector/guard on the train!  £75 a ticket one way!!!  Travelled 10/3/24 at 12.25. Absolutely disgusting! Shame on you Cross Country.

items.title: This rail company is the worst I have…
items.review_text: This rail company is the worst I have ever travelled with, I have to travel to Dawlish regularly to see my elderly mum. The rail service is totally abysmal, the train made up of 4 coaches, 1st class one coach (empty) next two reserved and lastly half a coach without reservations, passengers standing and the prices you charge..to many expletives, change of Franchise needed. Can not fault train managers having to to take the flack from irrate customers.

items.title: Exceptional service
items.review_text:
Our train from Reading cancelled at last minute so had to travel from Bristol on 6/12//23 @14.00 and the retail service manager Josh made our journey a very special one making sure we were happy with the service.
He was exceptional and a credit to Cross Country trains.

items.title: I have been getting first class for a…
items.review_text:
I have been getting first class for a year and have never seen as much of a temperamental service; especially for the post 8pm and pre 8am train between Manchester and Birmingham.

Majority of the time there’s no food or drink and be lucky if there’s an attendant. Not sure why you'd be first class!

items.title: Sicky
items.review_text:
My mom was 91 the day before. Advance booked tickets. Travelling with my 2 dogs who keep me sane. Reserved seats. BUT. Train Birmingham - Cardiff cancelled and reported 20 mins before expected departure date. EXCUSE either sick staff member/train fault.
RESULT horrendous journey back, uncertain ticket accepted, changing trains, nearly losing dogs between track and train.
This was one of the BETTER train companies. Suggest they buy books on contingency planning as they do not have PLAN A let alone plans B or C. Pathetic.

items.title: Passed from Pillar to Post
items.review_text: Received an email telling me trains had been cancelled due to line works. When I called them they could not give me any information of another route home or any information on whether trains were running from different stations. Told me to ring GWR, which I did, and they told me because I bought the tickets through Cross Country, they had to take the responsibility. Passed from pillar to post and Xross Country didn't want to own the problem. Appalling.

items.title: Worst train journey ride I have ever…
items.review_text: Worst train journey ride I have ever been on. Considering how busy it is this company should be ashamed of themselves to have only 4 carriages and no health and safety measures. After this I had to switch to another Cross Country train and could not get on as it was too crowded. If you are looking for a good train company do not use Cross Country Trains as they do not deserve your money.

items.title: One star is too much for the disaster…
items.review_text: One star is too much for the disaster that is crosscountry trains. Pathetic, dirty, delayed, cancelled, overcrowded, overpriced and unreliable. How these people still have jobs is ridiculous. Disgusting

items.title: A terrible journey today (2nd January)…made better by Luke
items.review_text: A terrible journey today (2nd January) due to flooding but made easier by 'Luke' the member of staff on board the train. He would get a 5 star rating from me.  He had to put up with so much even someone being arrested  when we had to stop at Worcestershire Parkway. Thanks Luke for all your help and for keeping us all sane!

items.title: Poor service again in issuing refund
items.review_text:
Submitted train claim in Dec 23 still waiting to be refunded phoned them up twice and promised claim looked at in next day or so weeks later still no refund issued.

Quick to take the money often without being able to get a seat slow to give it back to you when things go wrong.

items.title: Took the 11.22 bath to Exeter train…
items.review_text: Took the 11.22 bath to Exeter train today. 28.3.24. First class Bristol to Exeter journey. Very clean. On time. Staff really helpful and friendly. Good selection of beverages and food. Thank you 😊

items.title: I regularly commute between Nuneaton…
items.review_text: I regularly commute between Nuneaton and Leicester as a University student, trains are ALWAYS late!! Very rarely on time, no communication as to why and this is a regular occurrence - cannot plan around whatsoever and am regularly late or miss lectures, tickets can also be really expensive when they don’t run on time and when claiming back for a refund due to the lateness can take forever. Worse railway service. Been going along this route for almost 4 years now and just gets worse and worse. Can’t wait to finish my masters and never have to bother with them again! AWFUL company.

items.title: Rip Off
items.review_text:
How this train operator even manages to average 1.5 stars is beyond me. 

Where to start? Overcrowded. No food service (even though advertised as having one). Dirty, battered old carriages. Dirty toilets. Broken seat reservation system. Horrible, claustrophobic, poorly designed cramped carriages. 

It’s not as if this quality of service comes at a bargain price. So, so expensive. Absolute rip off for what you get.

items.title: Journey
items.review_text:
With exceptional circumstances today with floods I have to say the 12 42 on platform 2 cross country to temple meads was under pressure 
But  one of your work force pick me out along with a few orther travelling people to go frist glass,this made my journey. More comfortable as I was also suffering with bad anxiety ,Thanks for a pleasant journey along with a drink and a peace of cake

items.title: Cross Country "experience"
items.review_text: Every time I've used the Cross Country Plymouth to Edinburgh line recently there's been 4 carriages - one first class, 3 second or cattle-class. Aisles and corridors full, luggage everywhere, impossible to get to the loo or for a drinks trolley to get through. This for potentially a 8.5hr journey. So glad I've only had to endure 5hrs of it. No alternative as it's the only service to the South West! Add to it the regularity of lines flooding, rail replacement buses and strikes, and Megabus is looking a better bet. Shame, as I want to travel by train!

items.title: Extortion in plain site
items.review_text: Greedy company who hike train fares constantly and provide a terrible service. Always cancelling and delaying trains, always over crowded and will only put 1 train on per hour. It’s costs me £15.60 a day! Please can the somebody compete with this company? The working public deserve better

items.title: Too short trains
items.review_text:
Too short trains , previous TWO cancelled . Also I couldn't actually board. I noticed when filling in the delay repay form that there was nowhere to submit my original itinerary  .

UPDATE: Putting all the photos into paint and typing my original itinerary there worked as my delay repay for this arrived earlier today - not just for the XC ticket but my Chiltern train too!

items.title: Ah yes, another abomination of a journey from Cross Country
items.review_text:
Ah yes, another abomination of a journey from Cross Country (18.13 from B’ham Intl [airport] to Oxford on 11/02/24). The train arrived into B’ham Intl, ‘standing and full’ so I naturally wasn’t able to get on it. Abandoned at B’ham Intl. Announcements indicated all Cross Country trains were similar today. This is third-world or worse. Cross Country is an abomination. 
I think this will be my last journey with them. I would rather pay an extra £100/month to do my monthly visit to Belfast by going via LHR than to use the third-world ‘service’ offered (but not provided) by Cross Country to B’ham.
I do hope Cross Country will soon be bust or lose their franchise. It’s a disgrace, and needs to be killed off to allow something enormously better to arise.

items.title: Lack of safety & care of customers
items.review_text: Very expensive travel cost. App messed up requested reserved seats. Extremely over crowded train, 3 1/2 hours standing journey. No safety measures in  place for their passengers due to overcrowding of trains. Total lack of customer care.

items.title: Worst company ever, doesn't even deserve to be called a rail operator
items.review_text: Worst company ever, poor customer service, overpriced tickets which are not regulated. Crammed tiny trains that can barely fit anyone in. This company has a monopoly and it knows it, they have got rid of all there saver tickets they charge a standard fare all the time and your paying to hope you will get on the train or if it turns up. Shame on you arriva, you should be stripped of running this route.

items.title: Cattle class!
items.review_text:
Cattle class!
It’s half term and you’d want to have your kids enjoy a wonderful time and build adventures and memories. Well we have memories alright!

We wanted to take our kids on the train to York! It’s different and should be fun…
No it was awful! 4 carriages for a train that has gone from Plymouth to Edinburgh. You couldn’t even make it to your reserved seats because you couldn’t even make down the aisle. It was rammed. No one would let kids sit down and saw kids looking terrified at being smushed in and unable to sit down. We have two kids with autism and they were panicked! Utter waste of money. But to add to insult they cancel further trains forcing other people onto the already overcrowded train. Not one meme we of staff saying this isn’t safe. Not one person checked our tickets because at no stage could you even get to one side to the other of the train let alone go to the toilet. What happened to the trolley service? Oh cancelled because of the over crowding! How is this safe??? Disgusting!

items.title: Went to lemighton spa with cross…
items.review_text: Went to lemighton spa with cross country today first class they and back £38.00 but got a decent deal free drinks and friendly staff cross country is better then northwestern trains with more respectful staff on trains and platforms will be using cross country trains again in the near future

items.title: abusive company abusive customer services
items.review_text:
Overcrowded due to previous cancellations. Couldn't move. Had to stand . No air circulating. Close to passing out and being sick for over an hour. Finally finished the journey, sat down. After 10 felt better. 
Contracted customer service. Their response. Next time if you don't like it. Get off. In other words fk off. Disgusting company. Disgusting customer service. the only bright part. The driver couldnt stop apologising. Otherwise I'm not travelling any distance again on a train. From notts to birm. Or further. Well done for pushing me back into my car. Awful people

items.title: I wonder if the company actually reads…
items.review_text:
I wonder if the company actually reads these reviews.
I caught Tamworth to York train yesterday delayed 50 minutes...apology is not good enough,even partial refund.
Today the train is on time, but hardly a plesant experience.
People have meetings to attend , this level of dusruption is unacceptable.  If you can offer a reliable service do not offer it. 
Luggage and seat reservations total chaos. People with heavy luggage enter both ends of carriages....result chaos. Then you have to find your seat and remove the person in it.
The luggage racks are too small. If you look at the airlines the overhead bins are large, not so o  trsins.
Working is a challenge. The "airline" seats are narrow , lack support, uncomfortable. Ryanair is about the same The free wifi appears to be non existant. Mobile signals (mine EE is rubbish)
Very frustrating.

items.title: Shaun retail manager great customer service
items.review_text: Shaun , the retail manager selling snacks etc on the train was amazing, friendly, advised me perfectly with the contents of the items I was buying as I can't eat pork , he had great little conversation whist serving me and great price , he also advised me perfectly for my route of my journey, really appreciated it thank you

items.title: Awful company
items.review_text: Awful company, would never travel with them again! We recently travelled first class Southampton to Stockport the guard had no control. From Coventry onwards we had five people in the first class carriage who definitely did not have first class tickets one person who was supposed to be on a previous train with another company shouting at the guard for a first class seat. There was another family who got on and one of the family members had words with the guard begging for first class seats at no extra cost. People sat in your reserved seat without a care in the world. First class service does not exist apart from a drink and a snack on a long train journey. You see the staff serving sat for most of the journey. Lots of people standing in first class without first class tickets. It is frustrating for those that pay the extra for first class yet get extremely poor service. They only send a four or five carriage train causing severe overcrowding. They don't believe in refunds if you change your ticket.

items.title: Excellent staff. Very friendly!
items.review_text: Unfortunately the train was quite badly delayed for various reasons at no fault of the train service. I was traveling from Newcastle to Oxford with a transfer at Birmingham, the last train of the day and I was close to missing it. The guard was very helpful offering a number of solutions in case I missed my transfer, including a taxi to my destination. They were very friendly and really helped with quite a stressful situation. Thankfully the train arrived in enough time to catch my transfer after a quick sprint across the station. Can't thank them enough, especially with the hard time the government and train companies are giving their workers.

items.title: Travelled from Reading to Stockport and…
items.review_text: Travelled from Reading to Stockport and back. Coaches too crowded to get to reserved seats, very poor service. Need to use more coaches on this service. Avoid.

items.title: One star because on time but another…
items.review_text: One star because on time but another unpleasant journey from Leamington Spa to Winchester. Not as crowded as on our way up but dirty toilet, no refreshments available.

items.title: Delay Repay .Witholding payment..
items.review_text: After cancelling 3 trains in a row on Monday morning from Cardiff to Birmingham and leaving me stranded with only £18 in my pocket..I had to get the National Express which got me to work in Birmingham..Then have to wait over a month to get your money back through delay repay..Their staff are Rude,Clueless and unhelpful at times of crisis.And the company is run by a bunch of crooks .Who withold peoples hard earned money..

items.title: Filthy and overcrowded
items.review_text: Filthy and overcrowded.  People have booked seats but everything is showing “available”, this is causing confusion, anxiety and a thoroughly stressful experience as some (rightfully) demand their seats and others have to reluctantly seat hop for their whole journey.  Can’t fault staff but as a company you’re a disgrace.  Everytime we travel with you it’s never any better.  Plus out of order toilet, not that I’d chance using one on your trains if your standard carriages are anything to go by.

items.title: Cross Country Dumpster Fire of Operators
items.review_text: Where to begin! As a regular train user in the UK I’ve come to expect poor service. Trains will be late, some dirty, some with fewer carriages than necessary. But Cross Country go further. Their trains are ancient, routinely overcrowded and always massively delayed or cancelled. Cross Country saw Southern rail as a challenge and now it’s a challenge they’ve overcome. So, congratulations Cross Country in a sector whose emblem should be a burning bin of used adult nappies, you are truly the worst operator. Well done!

items.title: Delay repay..... delayed and NOT repaid
items.review_text: Traveled on 25 Oct back from Cheltenham to Bristol TM 'First Class' with my son. The train was late so I claimed for my son's ticket and my adult ticket on two claims as they specify. My sons ticket was paid within 24 hours, but the adult one still hasn't been paid or acknowledged. I've tried emailing 3 times explaining, but no one has the courtesy to reply.

items.title: Disgracefully overcrambed once again
items.review_text: Disgracefully overcrambed once again. How hard is it to not oversell tickets or ad a couple of carriages onto the train? Do not travel with cross country unless it is absolutely necessary.

items.title: A sick joke of a train
items.review_text: Filthy, smelly, no AC, overcrowded. Don’t understand why the train goes so slowly. I think I could walk faster with one leg. It also has a strange shaking feeling. Outrageously expensive. Horrific. The embarrassing state of broken Britain in action. Do better cross country. Staff try hard to deal with clearly sub standard working conditions.

items.title: Another one star
items.review_text: Another one star. Journey from Edinburgh to Cheltenham Spa on Saturday afternoon. Main complaint is only five carriages!!! Anyone with half a brain would know that five carriages was not enough to deal with Xmas shopping, days out, football fans. People standing most of the way. Two out of three toilets out of action. Wi-Fi rubbish. Glad to get off and will do my best never to travel on a long journey with them again whatever the cost of alternatives.

items.title: Is there a worse train company?
items.review_text:
Is there a worse train company?
No stars for Cross-country.
3 carriages + 1 first class going from Reading to York pre Xmas. Treating people like animals.
Returning virtually all trains on this route cancelled. Hence extreme overcrowding on alternatives. 
Trying to get onto a train at Birmingham New Street there were so many people trying to board because there had been so many cancellations it was extremely dangerous. I was nearly crushed and pushed over and I still couldn’t board the train as it was dangerously overfull.
This is not a train service. They should lose the franchise unless they can provide trains.

items.title: Awful service - ZERO stars
items.review_text: Awful service and been scammed with a fine after pre paying in advance ! Threatening letters asking for over £500 sent to the wrong address and we pre paid for tickets in advance !!!

items.title: Shockingly bad service
items.review_text: Dirty, overcrowded, littered and dated trains. Unpleasant experience. A company which has no interest in investing in its rolling stock or giving its passengers a satisfactory experience. To make matters worse we boarded the train at Manchester Piccadilly only to be told it was out of service. Then there was no communication as to what to do next. We finally boarded a different train on a different platform which left 20 minutes late. We arrived in our destination (Southampton Central) 28 minutes late, so 2 minutes below the threshold where we would have got compensation. Worst of both worlds. Compensation should be paid out for shortly delays or there is no incentive for this company to improve. We will be avoiding this company like the plague in future even if it means having to change trains in London.

items.title: One of the worst experiences ever ,the…
items.review_text: One of the worst experiences ever ,the trains were busy as football matches were on but the trains were so oversold that people were packed into every space ,aisle ,toilets ,in between the carriages,old people families , ,and the reason im leaving the review is our train was towing 4 empty carriages while treating their customers like this ,and the reason they were locked was apparently they had no guard so   ,not safe ,?????but apparently its safe to cram people into every available space ,god forbid there was an accident ,how do these sort of train companies keep their licences

items.title: £10 admin fee for refund on a cancelled train
items.review_text:
My train was cancelled so I booked an earlier train and requested a refund on the original. The refund function would not work online so I called, to have them inform me that "we don't usually offer refunds, but because your train was cancelled we will give you a refund; minus a £10 admin fee".

Will not be using again.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text:
I complained about a particularly bad journey and was pleased to eventually get a response stating that I could have a free second class journey next time I travelled . I simply had to inform when and where I wished to travel. 
I submitted the details a few months later and received no response. Not even an acknowledgment of receiving the email. A few weeks later I repeated the exercise - still response. As time is running short I purchased the tickets myself and emailed them to ask for a refund for a journey they had promised to pay for. Still no response. Terrible service.

items.title: Unsafe and uncomfortable journey
items.review_text:
My complaint written over a week ago to the company has still not even been acknowledged. 
Leeds to Bristol Parkway 11/2/24 12.11 pm.
Small cases wouldn't fit in the overhead luggage racks ..the luggage storage at the end of the coaches was overflowing.  People and suitcases in the aisle. Seats double booked. Took 2 stops to reach and find  my seat and had to sit with luggage on my lap and under my feet all journey.
If there had been an emergency it would have been difficult to evacuate the train ..not at all safe.
I frequently travel all over the country by train and this was the worst journey I have ever had. Absolutely no reference or apology from staff to the chaotic and unsafe conditions making me think this happens frequently and is not unusual  . I have complained and hope to get some sort of apology and explanation.

items.title: Hopeless
items.review_text:
Because I have to, I use the service every week for a 3 hour journey. 
Cancellations are very very regular, reduction down to 4 carriages nearly always, getting a seat nearly impossible (combination of smaller trains and cancelled train passengers on the service), a constant debate as to who has priority over the seat (the person on the right train or those shoved off their planned train). And despite the appalling service 50% of the ticket people are ‘jobs worth’ 
And all of this is in 1st class. A joke

items.title: 💩 show for a 💩 service train
items.review_text:
💩 show for a 💩 service trains.  

Cross County are fully aware of their continuous mistakes but won't compensate customers that have been messes about or do anything about it. Now weva or not people are ballsy enough to have their say this 💩 show company needs to do something about the obvious problems they always have. You need new and better improvement staff aa well preferably thought better customer service skills..



Oh and if anyone sees Collin who works for cross country know this. 

He is arrogant,  rude abd racist! Oh a s a theif

items.title: Cancelled our train 10 mins before…
items.review_text: Cancelled our train 10 mins before departure and left us stranded at Oxford with no alternative to get to York for the Xmas market. Offered a full refund, but weekend ruined as we then had to pay extra for an alternative route and train company. Would never travel with them again as a result!

items.title: Very Poor Service
items.review_text:
On the long distance service from Edinburgh to Penzance. They only put 4 coaches on, one of which is 1st class only.
Due to this the train is massively overcrowded. Seat reservation is not working meaning some seats are double booked. Passengers are arguing over this in a cramped, dingy, dirty, smelly carriage where over 30 people are standing. Where's the health and safety with that Cross country?
Absolutely poor service and an absolute rip off ticket price. They should lose their franchise as they cannot clearly run any credible service........AVOID!!

items.title: Terrible journey had to stand from…
items.review_text: Terrible journey had to stand from Bristol to Derby overcrowded you know how many tickets you have sold so should have enough seats for all. Terrible very

items.title: I am sorry I can give this no stars
items.review_text: I am sorry I can give this no stars. I was asked to move on from vestibule of first class when I was wearing a face mask due to  clinically vulnerable to COVID. I will wait for southwest trains service next time as they at least they don't insist I stand near the toilet or pay extra

items.title: Rude staff
items.review_text:
My train cancelled on Wednesday to Birmingham 13:39.  I asked for help and support helpdesk staff who was wearing glass shrugged his shoulders and rolls his eyes and said to me take next train. I can’t do nothing.

Seriously, common whole train got cancelled and i have to stay in station for over hours.  My confirmed seats are gone which i book in advance.  Now i might need to stand all my journey but your selfish and rude staff have no sympathy.

items.title: Disgusting trains
items.review_text: Disgusting trains. Always filthy, cramped, never enough seats, toilets always blocked, floors and chairs covered in old food, WiFi doesn't work, plug sockets don't work, seat reservations don't work, nothing works. Expensive and always delayed.

items.title: Dreadful experience
items.review_text: Travelled with this awful operator December 2023 York - Totnes, booked first class thinking my wife and I would have a pleasant journey! No chance, first train stopped at Leeds - no driver to continue, boarded next train one hour later - in first class no seats, standing only and had to step over an 84 year old woman sat on the floor to get in! This train only got to Derby before we had to get off yet again to board the following working this only took us to Cheltenham and yes, we had to detrain again and get the following train eventually got to Totnes over three hours late. This is not the end of the story, we put in a claim within days, that was over three months ago and we have yet to receive a repayment, this was promised a month ago but they have lost it - you could not make it up we will never travel with them ever again.

items.title: Reduced carriage chaos
items.review_text: Trains that were once eight carriages long and reasonably full are now regularly reduced to four carriages. You only need to do the maths to realise the problems caused. Carriages packed…can’t get to the toilets, travelling in complete discomfort. Yet their prices continue to rise. A shambles of a company.

items.title: Great company who seem to take joy in…
items.review_text: Great company who seem to take joy in refusing people access onto trains, even while the doors are open so they can pretend to check an empty platform, leaving a young family to wait for another team. Good use of resource, hope they all get pay rises and keep more staff on trains than customers

items.title: Literal criminals
items.review_text:
Strike on my day of travel (as always), cancelled my train just a few hours before I was meant to board. 
I purchased a one way ticket, but couldn't collect due to the machines being down, also for some reason they couldn't accept digital tickets that day (all of this their fault). 
They send me a prosecution letter in the post afterwards, then avoid answering anything about it as it's "out of their hands", they're trying to charge me for a return journey over £100 more than the one I already paid for. They refused to take a complaint from me too. They're literally criminal scum, I'd rather walk the length of the country in bare feet than get on one of their overbooked overpriced pi$$ smelling trains ever again.

items.title: Dangerously overcrowded
items.review_text: I have just been on the most dangerously overcrowded train i have experienced in a lifetime. The 17:30 birmingham new street to Cardiff central. 2 carriages with literally no standing space left with passengers not even being able to get on the train. No wonder people wont use public transport. Absolute disgrace.

items.title: Not so memorable 4 hrs trip in 1st class
items.review_text:
4 hrs trip from Middlesbrough to Reading. £200 in 1st class at off peak hours, when changing trains at Doncaster, announcement made that 1st class coach was in the front, after boarding  had to walk through the train to the back, where the 1st class coach actually was, the air throughout in all coaches was musty and was offered only tea/coffee and a a pack if 2 cookies with an excuse that something went wrong with the catering delivery. Seems like a take it ir leave it service. Which is a shame.
The train was on time.

items.title: FIRST CLASS TICKETS COSTING 590 pounds
items.review_text:
FIRST CLASS TICKETS COSTING 590 pounds

Exeter St Davids to Durham - 6 hours - offered tea/coffee, biscuits but had to request a sandwich - very pathetic tuna sandwich offered. VERY PATHETIC

Durham to Exeter St Davids - 7 hours - offered 2 drinks, a biscuit or a pack of crisps. NO other food. NOTHING OFFERED PAST DERBY - 4 hours with nothing! 
NO access to the toilet for most of the 7 hours due to a very overcrowded train with people jammed in corridor sitting on floor.

Friends traveling LNER on the same days received a hot dinner, free alcohol etc. DO NOT TRAVEL Crosscountry. THE WORST TRAIN SERVICE!

items.title: No drink on 125 miles journey
items.review_text:
Cross country trains are outdated and need proper refurbishment. 

The train departure was 3mins late, don't know why.

No food or drink served on Bristol-Plymouth route. That's very bad, can't have a warm drink. 

Only plus that in that route can get some cheap tickets with not much of notice

items.title: Delays...
items.review_text: Managed to get an affordable rate on an advanced single ticket but the journey was a poor experience. Repeated delays meant I missed a connection and the bike storage space is really poor. Didn't like hanging my bike up with fully loaded panniers - it's not good for the wheels.

items.title: I had 2 journeys from hell
items.review_text: I had 2 journeys from hell, travelling on Cross Country between Sheffield and Birmingham. On Saturday on the way down it was packed, and people were standing. I couldn't get to my reserved seat but it was already occupied. No working toilet, and no catering. No sign of a guard. On the way back on 19 March, it was even worse as there were only 4 carriages. Totally packed. I had to fight my way through standing people to get off the train. By the time I got to my suitcase people were trying to get on. I said in a loud voice 'please can I get off before you get on?' and one standing passenger said 'you'll be lucky to get off with so many people in the way'. I eventually got off and more people were trying to get on. It was crammed. A very unpleasant trip.

items.title: Probably the world's worst train company.
items.review_text: Got up a stupid O'Clock to get an early Cross Country rail train to Winchester, paid £240.00 first class return, believing their web-site BS that there were complementary drinks and snacks on the train.  Ticket inspector tells me there is no catering on the train not even stuff to buy.  I've now got to spend over 2 hours on this god foresaken train hungry and thirsty.  I know Cross Country trains have the type of terrible staff that will read this review and laugh.

items.title: TERRIBLE
items.review_text:
First class journey to Bristol,about 3.5 hours with delays
Only offered hot and cold drinks in paper cups,a biscuit and a few sandwich options
Carriage was dated looking and not particularly clean
Wouldn't travel first class again with crosscountrytrains and wouldn't recommend

items.title: The trains are always late arriving at…
items.review_text:
The trains are always late arriving at Winchester station ! I have had to rearrange many trips  due to missing connections because the Cross Country train being late again ! 
Yesterday I was stuck on a freezing cold station , because 1 Cross Country train was a hour late and the next train was nowhere to be seen.

items.title: Old  trains
items.review_text:
Olsd trains 
Always something happened and trains terminated where it shouldn’t be
Cancellation 
Toilets are not working

items.title: I cannot STAND THIS COMPANY
items.review_text: I cannot STAND THIS COMPANY. Stinking, filthy and ancient trains that have had zero investment in decades - where on earth are our extortionate fares going. Cramped seating. Delays on nearly every single journey I take with them. Disgusting!!!

items.title: Breach of health & safety will be reported to regulator
items.review_text: Where is the guidance on the safe no of passengers to carry on a train. I’m a lawyer and you have breached health and safety with the no of passengers on a train from Birmingham to Derby. I want to know as the service was completely unacceptable and unsafe. I’m livid

items.title: Poor British customer service standard!!!
items.review_text: We were on 15:39 service from Oxford to Banbury on 5th of November 2023. Train was packed and we were pushed to stand in first class coach. A disregard and rude lady (not sure how she can serve 1st class) asked my 74-year-old mother to stand but did not help to find her a seat. An extremely awful experience today as we have never met this kind of situation before. Some staffs were very helpful and kind but not the one that we've seen on that coach today.  Poor British standard!!! Those people deserve job cut as they do not do any help to customers (just go around checking tickets) and may show discrimination as well. Some train services may be bad but Cross Country is particularly awful.

items.title: Suddenly GWR are amazing
items.review_text: Suddenly GWR are amazing! Cross country set a new low with their train service, too few carriages  send the ones there are dirty, old and cramped. There is no seat reservation system trusting people will vacate when asked. The carriages are small, I'm not tall send I had my legs again the seat I front. Shocking trains, at expensive prices.

items.title: You’ll regret it
items.review_text:
You will be disappointed (unless you have extremely low expectations) if you schedule a ride with Cross Country.

Our train from Manchester to Bournemouth had only four compartments and was extremely crowded. There are insufficient seats and storage space for baggage, so they are left in the walkway.
This may not sound terrible, but it was my worst travel experience ever. 

They save money by using four carriages when this train requires a minimum of eight.

Invest additional funds and take a taxi. You will regret scheduling a cross-country train journey. Avoid using this company, or you’ll be leaving a one-star review to this site after. 

Already booked? You will regret your decision. Cancel NOW.

items.title: Old dirty train not worth money toilets…
items.review_text: Old dirty train not worth money toilets looked like the worst hygiene I could have ever seen one charging plug between 2 seats had to take turns using seats are like lying on bricks if can avoid

items.title: Remember when trains were not a hellish nightmare?
items.review_text:
My last memory of a Cross Country train that didn’t involve everyone standing packed - nose to armpit - in every aisle, and every vestibule, spilling into 1st class… is fading into the past.

When I watch people getting onto these trains, when I’m getting a GWR, I feel genuine remorse and sadness. No one should have to experience such hell.

The stench of overflowing toilets, the lack of oxygen, the sweat... and the discomfort of people who've been on their feet for hours.

What an absolute disaster this train company is. It is very hard to imagine any reason for this besides corruption: a pirate company with a friendly-sounding names ratcheting up prices whilst cutting carriages, wages and staff, all to enrich politicians and their mates.

Virgin trains were great. LNER is still great. So is GWR. There is no good reason for this train company to be this bad whilst tickets are so expensive.

items.title: Train randomly cancelled while we were on it with no explanations
items.review_text: We were forced to get off our train in a random city after spending a fortune on tickets and were given no information as to what was going on. When we were finally told there was a new train for us to get on it was very warm and smelled awful the wifi doesn’t work in any of the trains the only positive thing thing about the service is the staff were very friendly and polite.

items.title: Expensive
items.review_text: Expensive, incredibly expensive for the distance travelled, to sit on mucky seats, dirty floor and non-existent catering. I used GWR to get to Bristol Parkway from Liskeard and that was cheaper than the Bristol PW to Birmingham New Street Section. Appears that they cant cope with demand and are using price as a filter. Shambolic and disgraceful.

items.title: I gave it a 1star because there isnt a…
items.review_text: I gave it a 1star because there isnt a minus -6 , Disgraceful filthy over crowded people sitting on suitcases in the carriage. 19 people standing. Im fed up with complaining to Cross Country they are absolutely useless. Sent in a complaint not happy with the response.

items.title: Absolutely disgraceful
items.review_text:
Booked on noon departure from Leeds to Exeter, so crowded I couldn’t board
Squeezed on to 1.11 departure, been standing squashed against toilet for over 5 hours
Should not be allowed operator licence

items.title: A truly awful experience
items.review_text:
A truly awful experience, by far the worst in the entire country. The regional trains are awful, loud and cramped, and fares are ridiculously overpriced. 
A Coventry-Cambridge train costs £40+ and takes over 3 hours. This is simply ridiculous- you can go via London for £25 and it will be faster as well. 
They are terrible when it comes to bikes- either you reserve a space or are threatened with not being allowed to board even if you have an advance ticket (despite the train having more than enough space for a lot of bikes, way more than 3), at one point I even had to pay for an extra ticket to get home because of that. 
I'm never travelling with this company again.

items.title: Absolutely shocking overcrowding
items.review_text: This is the worst train service I've ever seen. First time travelling with them from Birmingham to Southampton Airport. Totally overcrowded rammed up to the windows with people standing. Wouldn't be surprised if there were people sat on the roof. My luggage had to be placed in another coach where I can't keep an eye on it. Can't get up to check that no one walks off with it at each stop because there's so many people standing up blocking the walkways. Rip off prices for the most abysmal service I have ever seen. Avoid at all costs, even if you have to pay a little bit more!

items.title: Standing all the way, like every time.
items.review_text: So I wait for the 12:31 train at Derby to Birmingham. The train is travelling from York to Plymouth in its entirety. So it pulls up, same old nonsense, a first class carriage and only 3 normal ones. Train is packed so get to standl, squashed between people and luggage. Absolutely disgraceful service. Why not just put a couple of extra carriages on. Surely someone must read these reviews and do something about this as everyone says the same. Think this will be that time I will use this service.

items.title: Crosscountry Trains - Arriva’s Shame
items.review_text:
Crosscountry Trains is owned by Arriva, so no one should be surprised by its appalling service. We have just had what will be our last trip with this cowboy outfit from Exeter to Leeds (for Harrogate) and vv; next time we’ll go via London to avoid the hell that is Crosscountry Trains. The rolling stock is, I believe, old and tired HSTs or similar. It is totally unsuitable for long journeys especially as the seat pitch is about the same as Ryanair; but unlike Ryanair journey times can be up to 8 hours or so; DVT is a real possibility. Lack of baggage stowage leads to blockage in the aisle making it impossible for the ridiculous trolley “service” to operate. Seats are hard, uncomfortable, tired and worn out. Running 4 or 5 car trains leads to overcrowding and unsafe conditions. Why do they do it? The reservation system simply doesn’t work with double-bookings leading to fearsome arguments. All this for eye-watering fares which are clearly set to extract as much cash as the market will bear for Arriva’s Directors and shareholders without any investment in new long-distance rolling stock (apart from new carpets promised last year), decent IT, decent catering and proper staff training (eg why it’s a bad idea to use the PA to shout “there’s no need to sit in the floor” at people who’ve given up fighting their way through overcrowded carriages to find the last remaining seat on the train and are sitting on the floor.
In short this company is a national disgrace and the franchise should be terminated NOW.

items.title: Trains knackered
items.review_text:
Seat numbering very confusing.  Seats and carriage in poor condition. 
Pleasant staff saving grace.
Owned by German company. Doubt if Germans would put up with such rubbish

items.title: Shockingly bad service
items.review_text:
Shockingly bad service. Cancelled both trains booked in advance and didn't even let us know. Had to then book a taxi on the way back to get us back to our car as there wasn't a train going to the station we had booked. 
When I tried to get a refund on the app it would let me, so I emailed them and eventually received a reply saying they couldn't refund me £26.80 because that was the full price of the ticket?? I complained and said I wanted it escalated. Another long wait before being told I'd be refunded in full. 
Two weeks later received an email saying that it has been escalated and they could not provide any compensation, so I responded saying I'd been told that I would be getting a refund. Response within a few hours confirming refund will be with me tomorrow! The refund will have taken 2.5 months! They couldn't run a bath.
I was at the train station this week and as I was arriving there was an announcement that a Cross Country train was cancelled (fortunately not mine). I would avoid at all costs, they can't get you cross county never kind Cross Country. Absolute shambles, they haven't a clue what they're doing.

items.title: If I could give zero stars I would
items.review_text: If I could give zero stars I would. Cross country gives railways a bad name and is undoubtedly encouraging more people to drive rather than use public transport. Avoid at all costs.

items.title: Not enough carriages.
items.review_text: Had to stand for entire journey. Not enough carriages and hundreds of people standing in all the aisles and all the areas between the carriages. We were squashed and unable to move. Extremely uncomfortable journey.

items.title: Do not use unless no choice
items.review_text: So on my way out every carriage was dominated by football fans who were drunk and drinking at 6.30 am. They got louder and louder, with bad language  and the single member of staff could do nothing about it. She did try once and them absented herself . They ignored her. I was travelling to a conference, and had hoped to do some reading. On the way back fewer football fans ( still some and still drunk) but the train was nearly an hour late and there were not enough seats..  What a disgrace this company is, taking our money for such a terrible travelling experience.

items.title: CrossCountry voyager train
items.review_text: Today I went on a XC voyager train from Birmingham new street to Bristol temple meads. Surprisingly it wasn’t that bad. The comfort was OKv as seats didn’t have any plush in them but they were alright for the journey I was doing just being a thick coat or a cushion to put on your lower back. The coaches are old and battered but had working power sockets and small tray tables. It’s not really worth the price that I paid for a child’s return which was originally £50.00 but luckily with splitsave I was able to get it for £30 something. Bike spaces were a bit weird as you had to HANG your bike from the front wheel on a hook which I refused to do as my bike is too heavy and large for that. But bike space was decent unlike the Turbostar train. This service is a overpriced service but it was the only direct service from Birmingham.

items.title: Dreadful service
items.review_text: Dreadful service. Dirty grafitti ridden train. Rude guard when asked a simple polite question. Train dangerously overcrowded. Suggest get a coach - much better. Or go by car.

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: My wife and I travelled from Darlington to Exeter return 4th/11th Sept 23. I felt sorry for the staff, they tried so hard to be helpful and friendly. What was appalling was the rolling stock. The seats were rock hard with no leg room (Ryanair's are better and that's saying something) and looked like they were from a 1950s aircraft. There were so crammed together only 1 side of each carriage had luggage space which meant most people were forced to travel up and down the train until you found a space. Air-con didn't work which as it was 30 degree C made 5.5 hour journey pretty awful.

items.title: Ruined a 60th birthday celebration weekend
items.review_text: We planned a 60th birthday celebration and travelled from Bristol to York and had a great ideal as a TREAT to travel by train so no one would need to drive and it would be RELAXING, how wrong was I. I haven't travelled that distance before on a train so had no ideal how bad it had become. We had a picnic lunch planned with wine and food for our 4 hour journey to York. I was a bit apprehensive as when booking the tickets we could not reserve the seats. We chose a time off peak times as we thought it would be quiet. We spent 4 hours playing musical chairs & standing in a doorway, the relaxing picnic was a disaster, why should this be the case, they know how many people have bought tickets so surely there should be enough seats for everyone on board. Because of the horrid journey we then had to cut short the last day of the break and catch a train 5 hours earlier as we were dreading the return journey. We got to the station early and gradually the platform filled up. There was then a mad rush to get a seat as I'm sure everyone knew how bad it gets. We started off with 9 carriages at York and gradually at each station people were hunting for a seat. When we reached Birmingham they decided to half the train carriages to 4. The consequences were horrific with people sat on the floor in the aisles. If you were claustrophobic, suffered from Anxiety, had a bladder problem or were disabled you had no chance. If there was a fire you would die or get trampled on. How is this allowed when Health & safety is so prominent within a business environment. I asked the ticket lady about it and she said I feel for you, I get paid to do this, you have paid for this service.  My advice save your cash, we paid £277.00 for this awful service.

items.title: Disgusting train service
items.review_text: I paid £178 for a train ticket and they expected me to stand up for my 2.5 hour journey becuase they did not have enogh standrd class seats. I sat in first class, their staff then charged me to upgrade without even telling me how much I was being charged. Absolutely Disgusting.

items.title: First class passenger
items.review_text:
First class customer, overcrowded train and an extremely ageist and rude member of staff who made me feel like a lying piece of cattle.

10:59 Banbury to Manchester Piccadilly train 28th December. Coach A (rear train)

I understand Cross Country like to utilise people as cattle by having such few carriages through the year and not just the Christmas period. And with my anxiety on trains and travel sickness when standing up I had to get first class. Decent marketing strategy. But when I pay at all, especially extra for first class don’t expect any member of staff to treat me with such disrespect. Especially when it’s clear he done so because I’m younger than them. This company is a farce, I feel sorry for the actual genuine good staff that has to deal with this horrible company daily. But there are clearly some staff here think it’s okay to be rude and condescending to paying passengers, it smells of an attitude that thinks this company is doing a favour. 

This company needs either changing or the government intervening for this company. The genuine kind staff deserve better.

I’ll be submitting a formal complaint as a certain member of staff should actually consider the reasons why instead of their age.

items.title: Delayed train and then cancelled whilst…
items.review_text: Delayed train and then cancelled whilst on the train, left a single female stranded at 1am after promise of a taxi. Still waiting refund for ticket and an acknowledgement

items.title: Endless cancellations on dundee to…
items.review_text: Endless cancellations on dundee to aberdeen 6.42 service. Which presumably leads to cancellation of Aberdeen to Penzance train. Given up on refunds, cross country refer me to scotrail for some bizarre reason. Switching allegiance to scotrail after new year as they provide a far better service.

items.title: Massive overcrowding and it is deliberate…
items.review_text: Massive overcrowding and it is deliberate the train from Manchester to Oxford only has four carriages so the train company can pay share holders excessive profits and minimise costs. They are an absolute disgrace and the prices for a crap service are astronomical. They should loose their franchise but the government is not interested in how they treat passengers

items.title: Train from Peterborough to Stansted…
items.review_text: Train from Peterborough to Stansted Airport.  Announcements for one and half hour saying delayed and then cancelled without warning meaning we missed our flights.

items.title: Train from Birmingham to Cheltenham was…
items.review_text: Train from Birmingham to Cheltenham was awful as always. 3 carriages and 1 was first class so 2 carriages for everyone. We were squeezed in in the aisles arm to arm, horrendous to pay for a seat and have to be squeezed in like that. Needed at a minimum an extra 2 carriages!

items.title: The worst rail company I have ever…
items.review_text: The worst rail company I have ever dealth with - should be stripped of their franchise.  Tried to call them to resolve an error with my booking on their website.  Was on hold for 45 minutes only to be connected to a guy who thought I was a ScotRail customer, and couldn't retrieve my booking.  What a shower!

items.title: Cancelled and left disabled mum to fend for herself
items.review_text:
This is an email I still have not had a response to for 10 days......
I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to address the recent incident regarding the booking made for April 15th, originating from Bristol at 11:35 am, destined for Grimsby via Sheffield.

My mother, who is disabled due to a previous stroke and experiences apprehension when traveling alone, had arranged for passenger assistance for the entirety of her journey. This decision was made to alleviate her concerns and ensure a stress-free experience with the aid of the passenger assistance services.

On the 15th, I personally accompanied my mother to the station and awaited the arrival of the Passenger Assist personnel. However, shortly after boarding the train and an hour wait onboard, it was unexpectedly canceled, initiating a chain of distressing events.

Upon cancellation and no passenger assistance to be see my mother found herself struggling to disembark the train without any assistance. She was compelled to seek help from fellow passengers to handle her luggage and navigate to the platform. Despite her efforts to seek assistance from station staff, she was met with inadequate support and was essentially left to fend for herself amidst the chaos of the station.

As a result of the cancellations and lack of assistance, my mother, who suffers from high blood pressure, was left feeling abandoned, anxious, and vulnerable. The absence of support not only compromised her well-being but also subjected her to unnecessary embarrassment and discomfort, particularly during the futile attempt to secure a seat on another fully booked train.

Regrettably, the ordeal continued as subsequent trains were also cancelled, exacerbating my mother's predicament and leading to a considerable delay in her journey. Faced with the unacceptable circumstances and realising the detrimental impact on my mother's health, I made the decision to intervene and arrange for her prompt retrieval from the station which meant my husband had to leave work to collect her.

Upon contacting Cross Country trains, I was advised to rebook tickets for the following day, April 16th, with the assurance of receiving a refund for the unused tickets. However, upon attempting to obtain said refund at the station, I was met with contradictory information, further adding to the frustration and inconvenience caused by this ordeal.

Ultimately, my mother's return home was significantly delayed, resulting in the unfortunate cancellation of an important medical appointment and leaving her with a profound sense of disillusionment towards National Rail services. Her health and wellbeing was compromised and there was no duty of care for my mum who is disabled and was discriminated against by being left alone and unattended on the station. 

In light of these circumstances, I am deeply disappointed by the treatment my mother and other disabled passengers endured.
