Therefore, I urge for a comprehensive resolution to this matter, including a full refund of the ticket expenses amounting to £141.90, as well as appropriate compensation for the distress, inconvenience, and disregard for duty of care exhibited.

Attached, please find the tickets for April 16th, alongside those originally purchased for April 15th. I trust that swift action will be taken to address this distressing situation and prevent its recurrence in the future.
I eagerly await your prompt response and resolution to this matter.

Sincerely,

Jodie Yang-Cooper

items.title: Nightmare journey
items.review_text:
The main Plymouth to Glasgow train comprised of just 5 carriages. We discovered soon into the journey that the previous two scheduled trains had been cancelled, apparently a regular occurrence.

By the time the train reached Bristol the train was packed with people standing in the aisles, sitting on the floor between carriages, in the toilets and anywhere else there was space. Suitcases and other luggage littered the floor causing further difficulty and obstructed passages.

Together with cheap, nasty and uncomfortable seats and effectively being unable to move for long periods of time, the whole experience was appalling.

I can't speak for the standard of staff since we didn't see anyone. Indeed we could quite easily have travelled without a ticket since no-one checked ours, or could have got down the aisle to do so.

Had their been an emergency on the train or it was required to make a sudden stop, there would have been very serious injuries to many customers.

It's time Cross Country took the comfort and safety of their passengers more seriously before there is a serious accident.

items.title: Overcrowded and dangerous train journey
items.review_text: I travelled on the 10.08 am train from Stoke on Trent to Birmingham International on Sunday 11th February. The journey was the worst journey I have ever had on a train. Firstly at Stoke Train Station the tickets did not need to be checked at the train ticket validation machine, you could just walk onto the platform. The Train arrived and it was packed, even though I had pre booked a seat I could not get on the correct carriage number as the entrance was blocked with people standing in the way. I got on a different carriage and stood for the whole journey to Birmingham International. There was definitely a health and safety issue on this train. I could not see any member of staff on the train, no one to raise my concerns with. I discovered that there was a football match on that day and a lot of the passengers got off at Birmingham New Street. People were allowed to get on the train at each station apart from one station when I saw a member of the rail staff telling someone the train was full.  I do not understand why there were not more carriages on the train, why were there not more trains arranged ? The rail network would have been aware of this match taking place. It was an absolute disgrace, it felt like I was travelling in a third world country. When I tried to complain by email yesterday and today I got a message to say the General enquires form is currently unavailable. I wonder why !

items.title: Liars!
items.review_text: Train was delayed by about 40 minutes and they LIED about the delay time and refused compensation despite showing them proof of the time I ordered a taxi/got home. They continued to lie and were rude. The train itself was really dirty and old.

items.title: Vastly overcrowded train from Coventry…
items.review_text: Vastly overcrowded train from Coventry (17.15) to go to Birmingham. Only four carriages. Packed in like sardines. Booked seat but couldn't get to it. Terrible service. Never again!

items.title: First class rip off
items.review_text: I have to use this train frequently for business journeys. It is not by choice. If it was I would never step foot onto a cross country train. What a shambles. I have to get a business first class ticket in order to get a seat… without that it’s a free for all and I can end up standing up 3 hours without one and the value you get is pathetic for the extra money. Typical example board the train at Plymouth for a 6 hour journey to Leeds…. Asking for a sandwich or hot snack, not available until after Birmingham.. here have a biscuit! Ridiculous service for the money. You really are paying for the seat on this franchise. It’s time there was a review and a change. Trains are now aging and noisy and still stink of sewage since they did from day one of being brought into service! Please, someone rescue them and rescue your customers!!

items.title: Don’t waste your money on a first class ticket
items.review_text: Travelled first class from Sheffield to Leeds. None of the tables had been cleared of previous people’s rubbish and I was not offered and beverages or food. Eventually I asked and was given a bottle of water.

items.title: I caught the Penzance to Bristol…
items.review_text: I caught the Penzance to Bristol Parkway train on Saturday 2 December at 8.30 am. It was an uncomfortable journey as there were only 4 carriages which caused severe overcrowding. A few of the earlier trains travelling to London from Penzance had also been cancelled so more and more people tried to squeeze onto the train at each stop. It was dangerous with all the aisles of the train full of people having to stand up. I eventually got to Bristol and the train was half an hour late. A lot of people were connecting to another train to try to get to London and they were very anxious and worried about being able to get there during the trip. An elderly lady had to beg someone to give up their seat for her and eventually a passenger on crutches was able to get to a seat to sit down through all the queues of people standing throughout the carriage. It was a worrying, scary and altogether unpleasant journey for most people and no official on that train came along to speak to the passengers just a useless garbled message which you could hardly hear sent over the tannoy to announce where the refreshments could be found! No one could move through the train to get to them! The toilets were blocked if you could even get near them. It was hell!

items.title: Terrible experience, never again.…
items.review_text: Went from Leicester to Birmingham and had to stand the whole way. Train was late and literally twice as many people on each of the only 3! Carriages as they are designed to seat. If they carried livestock in the same way cross country would be up in court!!

items.title: No room to board train
items.review_text:
Bought a ticket in advance to watch a play in Nottingham.
Train arrived and was so crammed I, and two others could not get on. Missed the play, and spent money on a train ticket I could not use. Would not recommend this company at all. Will try coach next time

items.title: Reading to Oxford & return
items.review_text:
Reading to Oxford & return 
Absolute joke no seats either way 
Standing throughout  this dangerous
Avoid at all costs

items.title: Uncomfortable, late, under-resourced
items.review_text:
The greediest, most unprofessional rail company in the uk. GWR provide ample numbers of carriages - I'll undoubtedly get a seat/table as they'll run 9-12 carriages between Exeter and London. Cross Country will run 3 carriages between Exeter and Bristol, same to Birmingham with triple the passengers. I'm aware possessing the IQ of a glass of water is a prerequisite to qualify for senior management within the National Rail service but clearly Cross Country's 'senior team' delve below those standards. I regularly carry extra tissues to mop up their drool if I'm ever in the unfortunate circumstance of being forced on one of their tired, disgusting trains. 

I will add that this diatribe pertains only to network managers - The staff on the train and station were absolutely superb (despite being overworked and underpaid) .

items.title: An unfunny joke
items.review_text: Only 4 carriages on a busy Saturday afternoon. I thought SWR was bad, but all these train operators are all the same. I should stick to my golden rule, never travel by train on a weekend.

items.title: Should be 0 stars
items.review_text: Should be 0 stars. Exeter St David’s to Birmingham. Couldn’t even board the train it was SO packed. I had stood all the way down when travelling the other way due to sardine like conditions.

items.title: overcrowded
items.review_text: overcrowded, the train clearly did not have enough coaches. Stood from Taunton to Derby as there was no space. Internet did not work and there was no information on delays. Never using this service again I will take the car next time!

items.title: Overcrowded and filthy
items.review_text: Overcrowded and filthy, never seen so many people crammed onto trains, people always sat in your seat, awful experience

items.title: Thank God the train had a floor.
items.review_text:
I travelled from Gloucester to Leeds on the Friday, and returned on the Sunday.  On both trips the train was hopelessly full.  I'm in my sixties and spent much of my time sat on the floor.  I know they don't guarantee seats but even so!  I paid about a hundred pounds for this.

Absolutely deplorable.

items.title: Only plus is it’s moving
items.review_text: Dirty smelly overcrowded miserable trains with not enough luggage space for journeys between Edinburgh to Plymouth when everyone doing any part of it has luggage

items.title: Have to use this company to get to work…
items.review_text: Have to use this company to get to work (no other options available). Trains are dirty, always late, often cancelled. Worst TOC in the UK.

items.title: BAD train
items.review_text: I don't have anything to say. One off, the nasty train in Uk bloody always delays i travel so many time i never surprised i hope they closed this dirty train 👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎

items.title: Greed before customer service
items.review_text: Maybe all of the fat cats of this company should be forced to travel on the Manchester piccadilly train and not in  first class!! but standing shoulder to shoulder the whole journey or sitting on the filthy floor when you can stand no longer due to your advancing years and arthritas then maybe they would put customer needs before their greed another journey from hell but no surprise there god forbid they should put a larger train on to allow customers a safe and comfortable experience

items.title: The worst Railway Operator in the UK, I wish I could give zero stars!
items.review_text: Absolutely unbelievable policies and customer service! I booked train tickets between Leeds and Sheffield, literally a 1 stop journey which is only 30 minutes. Due to unforeseen circumstances in relation to work, I needed to change the date of travel. Just the date. I called up customer services and I was told that because the admin fee to change the ticket date is greater than what I paid for the ticket, they are unable to change the date OR give me a refund on the ticket. She then put me through to the customer relations team, who I waited for over 30 minutes to answer the phone. They said there is absolutely nothing they can do about my situation, and they cannot change the date or anything. I then asked if they could give me an e voucher or something to use on the website instead of processing a refund. He said they cannot do that as well. That is absolutely unacceptable and ridiculous. The fact that I need to pay money to get my own money back is beyond ridiculous. These policies that are set, are idiotic. Now there is no way to get my money back and my complaint is with the Rail Ombudsman. Cross Country is by the worst Rail Operator in the country. The trains are always delayed, very unreliable, your absolutely rammed in their trains, yet  when I’ve previously travelled from Reading to Manchester Piccadilly, the tickets are in excess of £100 one way. They show no due care for their passengers, and the Government must strip them off their licence immediately. Yet the staff are always going on strike? The trains are always delayed or cancelled? They overbook their trains on purpose because they are a bunch of money grabbing snobs who do not care about anything. I’m reading many other reviews regarding their disgraceful service. £284 for a first class ticket? That is absolutely insane. I booked an all inclusive holiday in Greece for £230 per person, 4 star hotel. Avoid like the plague!

items.title: Mismanaged, Overpriced, Outdated, Poor Customer Service
items.review_text: Trains are just bad compared to what all other competitors offer and usually much more expensive, had a horrible experience recently where a full train of people squashed in was asked to leave the end half and all get in the front due to poor mismanagement, this resulted in people pushing and shoving and lots of passengers not being able to get on even though they had tickets. Won’t be using services again if I can help it.

items.title: plea to the powers that be
items.review_text:
can anyone with the power please do not renew the franchise of this terrible carrier.
It is out of order for people to have to stand on 4 coach trains blocking free movement.when doing away with 7 car H.S.T.s which gives people a chance of a seat.

items.title: This is the worst train I have ever…
items.review_text: This is the worst train I have ever travelled on people stashed in like a tin of sardines no where to sit no way to get to the loo. Cross country should lose its license.

items.title: terribly overcrowded trains
items.review_text:
wow truly rubbish service on these cross country trains.
booked first class as it was my wife 50th.
the train was so overcrowded we couldn't get in.
had to stand in the corridor, 
exactly the same on the way back .
i will never travel again this way . emailed them no response.

items.title: I travelled on a train from Derby today…
items.review_text: I travelled on a train from Derby today on the 1145, getting into Berwick at 3:20 pm. I had already upgraded to 1st class via Seatfrog and the seats were pretty comfortable. However, in terms of the catering that was on offer the service was very very poor. It was after about half an hour that we got a hot drink and about half an hour later the gentleman came up to me and took my rubbish and asked me whether I would like something else and I said perhaps another tea he did not mention the fact that food was being served as well. It was only when I heard the next table asked for food that I spoke to him and ask him if food was on offer and was told that he would get back to me. Thankfully there were only three people in front of me and their orders were taken and given. He was very blasé and I felt as if I was asking for something extra. Eventually he came back to me and most of the options for the food were no longer available and I was offered a sausage roll or a tuna salad roll which, although we’re not top of my list, I opted for the sausage roll as I was hungry. He then walked away before I said anything else, I then called him back and said that I would like a packet of crisp as well. He did not ask what flavour. He seemed quite annoyed that I was requesting this. Most times I have travelled to London with LNER 1st class and they have been great.  I will be travelling to Derby quite frequently and to be honest this experience has really put me off. I expect a bit of courtesy. I am disabled and was the only Asian person in that carriage (tongue in cheek) I sometimes begin to wonder whether this was the reason that I was being ignored or the fact they I had bid vis Seatfrog for an upgrade and was undeserving. I was very unhappy with the state of affairs.

items.title: By far the worst train service ever.
items.review_text:
By far the worst train service ever.
Dirty stinking carriages and today the drivers couldn't even be bothered to turn up to drive the train.
These the same drivers striking for a pay rise. Disgusting vile people.

items.title: Cross Country are total and utter disgrace and treat passengers with contempt.
items.review_text:
Cross Country trains had late delays from Coventry to Leamington spa at 4:26 for 3 consecutive days in a row on 1, 2 and 3 November and deliberately lied to the public. On 1 November, the excuse was Storm Cairan. The West Midlands was NOT affected by the storm as only the south coast was mostly affected. The excuse on Thursday was a disturbance on the train. I chatted to some passengers on the delayed train who had travelled for 2hrs or more and they confirmed that no such disturbance occurred. Friday's excuse was that there was a collision on the line. When I finally reached home, I spent some time researching accidents on that line and none were reported. On each announcement for those days, the excuses changed and were inconsistent, so Cross Country were obviously lying about the causes of the delays. In addition, passengers were forced into overcrowded unhygienic cramped conditions, reinforced by the atrocious design of Cross Country trains as opposed to normal trains, i.e. Avanti, Chilterns etc. On Cross Country trains, passengers are forced to stand on aisles and outside smelly toilets, constantly assaulted by automatic doors. It is obvious that these awful trains were designed to be uncomfortable. When I applied for a refund, Cross Country added insult to injury by offering only a fraction of the cost of my ticket in compensation.

I would strongly urge passengers to `always' claim compensation from Cross Country trains until they are finally sued or put out of business.

Cross Country trains are a total and utter disgrace and treat passengers with contempt.

items.title: There are never enough carriages so the…
items.review_text: There are never enough carriages so the trains are always jam packed. I hate travelling with them.

items.title: Nothing constructive or positive. Disgrace.
items.review_text:
There is nothing constructive or positive to say about Cross Country.
 I don’t think I’ve ever been on time on one of their services, and am perpetually horrified by the filth and squalid conditions of their trains. 
Perhaps of greater significance is their total reluctance to improve or to absorb criticism. Their customer service staff are rude, arrogant and oblivious to the reasonable needs of their customers.
I was especially horrified on a recent first class service to Wolverhampton. The train was overcrowded, and they had failed to provide the extra carriages necessary for the route. First class itself was dirty, and staff did nothing to prevent a prisoner on day release from using the carriage (despite not carrying a ticket) and harassing the customers. It is immoral to solicit (often) double the fare, and to completely neglect your customers in this way.
Nevertheless, X Country hold the monopoly on a number of major rail routes, and know that people will travel with them regardless of conditions. They are everything wrong with Public Transport in Britain, and it is absurd that the DfT has renewed their contract.

items.title: Cross-country by coach instead
items.review_text: Travelled from Bournemouth to Birmingham New Street. The train felt tired and dirty. There were people drinking and swearing on the train. The train was full of self entitled students from Reading onwards. It amazes me that they can afford festival tickets but not train tickets so they sat wherever they wanted. None of them were checked to see if they had tickets. They were rude. Why extra coaches were not allocated to the train service we were on is beyond me given how many people crammed themselves onto the train at Reading. Instead they open up first class to accommodate for the over crowding and announce partial refunds over the barely audible loudspeaker due to the noise of drunk festival goers. I paid all that extra money to avoid travelling by coach. Now I wish I'd gone by coach instead. I couldn't wait to get off the train at Birmingham New Street, as the train journey was unbearable. As I exited the train, one woman had to shield her young daughter in order to prevent her from being pushed around on the train due to a lack of seating. Your company need to invest in new cleaner trains that can accommodate for over crowding instead of wasting money on HS2. I feel sorry for your staff. It must be shamefully embarrassing for them to have to represent what was once a flagship train company. It's no wonder they still go on strike given the working conditions that they still have to suffer, not to mention some of the passengers. So thoughtless for other people travelling on your trains. Where are the British Transport Police and why aren't they on board these trains to stop these undesirables from ruining other people's journeys home from their holidays. Very dissapointing indeed.

items.title: Worst train company in the UK
items.review_text: Worst train company in the UK

items.title: Be a struggle to think how to make it worse
items.review_text:
Impressive to have achieved a 1.5* average rating, especially when 0 is not an option.  I’m afraid CrossCountry, my review isn’t about to improve the situation. 

Where do I start? I am fortunate that my job affords me the excitement of visiting places like Birmingham and Bristol on a periodic basis. The counter to this privilege is my journey from Leeds dictates I take a CrossCountry train.  

Let me try and give you a flavour of a typical journey:

As the train pulls into the platform and you eyeball a coupe of carriages,  the sinking feeling of the thing being absolutely rammed sets in.  You naively find your coach, try and overlook the raw sewage/ blocked toilet smell as you alight and then join a queue of commuters trying to navigate the frankly insane seat booking system as the carriage door repeatedly closes on your testes. 

You arrive at your seat and see a 93 year old woman sat in it, so without the coldness of heart to boot her out, you think ah I’ll find another seat. Once you’ve worked out what seats are reserved or aren’t, you sit in one that says “may be reserved later” to find yourself rudely ejected at Sheffield. 

In the short time you had a seat, you thought oh I’ll get a bit of work done. Firstly the fold down table is smaller than a cigarette packet, and has this kind of low friction edging which means your laptop flies off at any moderate change in acceleration. 

The “wifi” is near useless.  A man selling crisps and teas clouts your leg with a trolley. 

You now arrive at Derby. For some unknown reason the driver realises he’s got there ten mins early (silly sausage does this every time), so you wait for a solid 12 mins in a platform with neither Wi-Fi or mobile network coverage. 

You eventually get to Birmingham, and breath a sigh of diesel filled air as relief and get on with your day, feeling relaxed and ready to take on the world, having been relieved of £75 for the privilege.  

Cleanliness - 0
Efficiency - 1
Comfort - 0
Speed - 1
Overall - 0.

items.title: Overcrowded
items.review_text: Overcrowded, late, horrible lazy staff, dirty and delayed. Need putting out of business

items.title: The WORST service and trains IN THE WORLD
items.review_text: Cross country trains are the worst train line in the country. Disgusting, out of date, grubby and cramped seating, extortionate prices, and ALWAYS delayed service. But on top of that, the staff are absolute JOBSWORTHS. For context: myself and my partner had an open return return from Bath to Manchester for a weekend away. Unfortunately we missed our planned train home on a Saturday which was the last train that would get us back to bath that day a 6.30pm. We tried to book a last minute hotel in the city, but due to Halloween weekend all were full, so we managed to get across to York for a nice little stay  in a boutique hotel. The next day, we hopped on a train that would take us direct to Bristol then could change for bath, as it was a cross country train and our open returns stated 'all permitted routes' (which we had paid nearly £100 for), and there had been many cancellations and delays of most trains back to the south east and west that day, we presumed getting this train would be fine. Due to the cancellations, we couldn't even get a seat and stood in the carriage doorway for most of the route. Then, we were unfortunately met with a ticketing officer who all I'm going to say would have had a wonderful career following orders in 1940s Germany!! We explained our situation, including the delays and cancellations, and I stated that our return was a 'all permitted routes' open ticket, this was our only reasonable train to get on. He was having none of it, claiming we would need to spend an additional 80 pounds each to stay on the train or he would kick us off. A to-and-fro then ensued as I stated there are no clear rules online for what a 'permitted route' for a return ticket entails, and despite him calling it a grey area, he refused to keep us on board, instead, kicking us off, making us change at derby, then stoke on trent, then bristol, then bath, as this was the 'permitted route' this added four hours onto our already five hour long journey home on a Sunday. My partner is also type 1 diabetic, so being on the road for such a long time is really not ideal for her health. Overall I hope you are happy mr cross country See You Next Tuesday for making an already stressful weekend of travel particularly excruciating.

items.title: Worst train company
items.review_text: Worst train company, not enough carriages so left standing.

items.title: Doesn’t deserve one star
items.review_text: Doesn’t deserve one star! No hot drinks.. seats double booked.. no heating. Don’t bother!!!

items.title: If I could score less than one star, I would.
items.review_text:
This is by far the worst train journey (1st class, London Stansted to Birmingham New Street, Cross Country trains) I have ever experienced – and I've experienced a few.

We were kept sitting on a cold, windy platform until literally 5 minutes before departure while staff sat in 1st class chatting with their feet up. That attitude was also clear on the journey – they just don't care. Customer service is something they seem never to have heard of.

Train was late leaving by several minutes.

The train was filthy. Crumbs, broken glass and liquid on the floor. Seats dirty. Toilet dirty and stank. This is old stock and it shows. The company's money is going to shareholders, not customers.

Ads for 1st class say: "Reclining seats". Really? Absolutely not. These are old style, upright seats with no extra space and no extra leg room.  

Ads say: "...get stuck into some work." How? There is not even a plug at any of the seats – this is supposed to be 1st class! Internet is patchy at best, and incredibly slow.

Ads say: "Extra table space". My Macbook Air wouldn't even fit on the table. 

Ads say:

"You can make use of the quiet atmosphere by taking a nap or getting stuck into some work."

It is anything but quiet. People on phones, loud music through tinny headphones, people sharing their conversations with the world – and staff doing nothing to control it. I had to wear earphones not to listen to anything but to try to block out the noise.

"Complimentary food and drink"? There isn't any. Not even a drink. Not even to buy. When queried, the stock answer is "not available on every route". Then they should make that clear in their advertising.

Ads call it: "The ultimate way to travel for on-the-go work or an extra comfy journey. Kick back, relax and enjoy; it's well worth the upgrade."

It absolutely is NOT worth the upgrade. I paid a lot of money for a 1st class ticket when there was no difference between 1st class and the rest of the train. I spent a three hour journey hungry, thirsty, unable to concentrate and seriously fed up. I wish I had read reviews before I booked. I certainly won't be using this company again.

The information on the website is seriously misleading. There is no way anyone should be charged for 1st class when this experience is not even second class. It's absolutely outrageous. 

Avoid this company if you have any other alternative – and certainly DO NOT to pay extra for 1st class.

items.title: Terrible company

items.title: I was travelling from Telford to…
items.review_text: I was travelling from Telford to barking on the 3/12/2023 but due to train strikes my simple two change journey ended up being a 5hour 4 change journey, on the train from Wolverhampton to reading it was heaving with people you couldn’t even move your head, I ended up panicking and became stressed which resulted into me trying to leave the train however tori the train manager took me to the back with her and her team to calm me down and sat me there for the rest of the journey which really helped, if it wasn’t for her and her team I’m not sure I’d have got home as all the trains would have been the same, Tori and her team were amazing

Then on the Train, she got a backwards seat when she asked for forwards, then worst of all, the Train ran an HOUR late, and she missed half her work meeting she has to attend once a month, felt so sorry for her, I don't know how a Train company messes up that badly, i've noticed they can get so packed and hot and smell from the outside, anyway, after this incident, we can't trust this company anymore, please improve however you can Cross Country...

items.title: Very bad crosscountry trains  0 STARS
items.review_text:
My wife and myself booked a trip up to Edinburgh christmas market on 11th december, and after reading up on some of the advantages of going first class,  ( complimentory food,
drinks, ect ) we decided to upgrade to first class through seatfrog, we caught the cross country train at 9.17am we were well on our way when a stewardess walked past, my wife said excuse me would it be possible for us both to have a cuppa please to which her reply was,  i am sorry but we dont have any snacks or drinks in first class as they forgot to load them in Birmingham, i replied that that was unbelievable and not the  best thing i was told that i should contact the suplier if unhappy and ask for a refund,  we done this back in december and ive contacted them by phone andbhave still not recieved a reply ,,, i am totally shocked that we have not received anything back from them and find this is totally disgusting  and i am thinking of taking this further,,,   WOULD NEVER EVER RECOMMEND ANYONE TO USE CROSS COUNTRY AND TO REFRAIN FROM UPGRADING TO BE TREAT IN THIS MANNER          John Green    i have since had a reply from cross country saying there is nothing at all we can do as it stated that your first class  expectations are not always available so if that is true then they should not be allowed to advertise as such, and we have checked everything online about who we bought our upgrade from which was seatfrog and it does not mention anywhere that your first class drinks and snacks are subject to availability  i asked for address for ombudsman and have not been given it at all i tried to add picture but wasnt allowed that shows whats on offer

items.title: Worst service possible
items.review_text:
Worst service possible. 

It's the only line I can use to get home due to this being the only service otherwise I would go else where. 

Treated ourselves to a first class upgrade. 

Pro? I actually got a seat since cross country has decided all services must treat it's passengers like cattle and rarely allocates reservations. I've recently had a reservation which didn't even show on my allocated seat. 

Other than the train actually moving there are none. 

Cons:
No catering - for long haul journeys absolutely dreadful. Every other first class service I've used on other lines at least provides water. 
Filthy coach
Filthy bathroom 
Staff with poor attitudes
Barely anyone around to check tickets 
If you don't travel first class you may as well accept you will be likely to be standing or crushed with other people. 

I've contacted them in the past, always an excuse and never anything they can solve. Used to be a great service, needs overtaking and a new supplier. 0/10. 

Might try journeying to London and going north that way in the future.

items.title: Rubbish
items.review_text:
Had to give 1 star as couldn't give a zero. Booked a return 4 weeks ago
The Birmingham new street to Oxford train was cancelled so we had to get the next train. Of course we had prebooked tickets on cancelled train so had to stand in a crowded corridor with my son and luggage. Return journey today oxford to Wolverhampton couldn't get to prebooked seats as train overcrowded and had to stand up for 90mins. Thankfully avanti west coast saved the day as my train down from Preston to Birmingham and home from Wolverhampton to Preston we managed to get in our seats with no stress. Definitely profit before passengers

items.title: If I could give minus 5 stars I would
items.review_text: If I could give minus 5 stars I would!  Used Crosscountry twice lately. Completely rubbish!  Reserved seats and always someone else sat on them and others on the train had same problem. I had to ask the woman to move which she did. Carriages crowded, people sat in corridors between carriages.  I'll drive next time!

items.review_text: Their Wi-Fi is utterly useless. I have a 5h train ride from Birmingham to Edinburgh, won’t even load 1 page in those 5 hours. What a joke of a company

items.title: So my experience was full of horror
items.review_text: So my experience was full of horror. I thought why not travel first class and purchased ticket for £117 from new street to Stansted service. Upon boarding it was no where near what you would expect from 1st class coach. Seats were wider but hard and uncomfortable. Sides were dirty. Toilet in first class made me literally feel sick, no complimentary tea or coffee served. It was just absolute horror. I just hope that they will refund

items.title: Horrible
items.review_text:
Horrible. Crammed into vestibule with at least 20 other people.  The train was running with 3 empty carriages due to being short staffed meaning a crazy number of people were unnecessarily crammed into the only 4 coaches that were open , 3 if you discount first class. Approached them about it and typically they aren't interested and mention that unlike buses, trains are safe regardless of how many people pile on. Literally in other people's personal space as a result of how bad this was.
Had the nerve to perform a ticket check as well as if the service justified having been paid for. A company and an industry on its knees.

items.title: The Cross Country only strike on 19th…
items.review_text: The Cross Country only strike on 19th Aug was not widely publicised and cost me £27 for a taxi in addition to the cost of the ticket. Please help me get a refund or compensation. I am already losing hundreds on hotels/taxis due to strikes on the next two weekends.

items.title: Delay repay ongoing nightmare
items.review_text: My journey on a CrossCountry train was severely delayed. I claimed delay repay compensation. Almost 10 months later, I'm still waiting! Initially they said they were busy and dealing with a large volume of claims. Then they said they couldn't find my claim. I had to resubmit the details of my journey... and now they say that my resubmission date is more than 28 days after the original journey took place. What does it take to actually get compensation???

items.title: AWFUL TRAIN JOURNEYS. PLEASE AVOID
items.review_text:
On Monday I travelled on the 13.16 Departure from Leamington Spa to Newcastle.
 
The train was 24 minutes late in departing meaning I would miss my connection at Birmingham New Street .
It was two trains but tiny (4 carriages I think ). It was full of people returning North from a major Music Festival at Winchester. Surely they have a way of predicting this number of passengers due to the fact that thousands of people got off on Friday then back on again on Monday when it finished. They manage to increase prices based on demand so perhaps this technology might be shared with the “size of train department” and staff on the platform stopping people getting on when it’s full.
 
The train was packed. Not just no seats, no standing room either. Dangerous over loading but never mind. Birmingham New Street isn’t a long journey and the train manager was “stressed” but charming.
 
Not unexpectedly the connection was late too, so my journey was back on course.
 
I made Platform 10. At the last minute the announcer said “Change of Platform” So Platform 8 it was. Not far
 
The train arrived and left more packed than the first one but a much longer train. I eventually got a seat at Durham (10 minutes from Newcastle) after a 5 hour, 15 minute standing journey.
 
As the train was over one hour late yesterday  I tried to claim under the “Delay Repay” Service whilst on my return journey. I completed the form, downloaded the ticket then your internet failed and wiped the form. So, I called Customer Services and 15 minutes later when I did get through I lost the call and so far they haven’t called back (1 hour)
 
Its an incredible list of incompetence and only a slight improvement on the last time I travelled to Newcastle when the train broke down north of York, took 2 hours to be dragged back to York, where we were made to run to get on an LNER Service to reach Newcastle two hours late

I sent this to the CEO tom DOT joyner crosscountrytrains (co.uk) who so far has failed to respond
 
 
Ian Cassie
 
M 079 73 74 1122
No junk mail or pasted paragraphs from standard reports.

items.title: Customer Services
items.review_text: This relates to Customer Services and I would like to thank "Laura" over her handling of my concerns following a complaint  ( ref :  XC-230728-BDHZ) about an overcrowded train from York to Durham in the last week of July, after attending my Cousins funeral in Yorkshire.  She is putting forward my concerns to management and handled my concerns professionally. Many thanks to the customer services team at XC .

items.title: Why are our motorways blocked? Because trains are just unreliable
items.review_text:
Terrible. Drove from Barnsley to Leicester to get the train to Stansted. Get all the way there and 30min before they decide it doesn’t go all the way to the airport. Cancelled. No notice. I can get the next available train. Unfortunately that gets there after the plane leaves. 
Trains in the U.K.  - frustrating and immensely embarrassing as somebody who travels all over the world. I guess they will pay for the 2hr extra drive to stansted? Not.

items.title: A mode of transport of absolute last resort.
items.review_text:
The 11.27 train from Plymouth to Edinburgh had too few carriages. From Exeter to where I got off at York (6 hrs total), the train was so full the aisles and the end of carriage vestibules were completely crammed with people who could not get a seat. I had an aisle seat, but you end up being buffeted by standing customers for the entire trip. In amongst the chaos is the advent of split ticketing (cheaper apparently). Part way into the journey a lady turfed someone out of the seat beside me only to declare that two stops later she had to move because of a different seat reservation for the second half of her journey. This causes bad temperedness on top of the overall distressing experience. It simply cannot be safe to cram trains to this extent. These trains are uncomfortable without all this, you get less leg room than you would on a budget flight, there isn't enough luggage space because the overhead space is so narrow, and the luggage are at the end of carriage is virtually inaccessible because the aisles are blocked. I do not see how a company can act like this without sanction. As many other reviewers have said, I would not give them any stars if I could. 
My advice to people considering using cross-country is don't unless its for short hops between stations. This company is a compete disaster.

items.title: overbooking and refused capacity
items.review_text: They are consistently overbooking the trains while reducing the number of carriages. I have been informed that they will be firmer in reducing the service further in the future. The current government and the franchises that deal with them are not taking client change seriously as they work to discourage people from using public transport services unless they have no other option.

items.title: The service on cross country trains is…
items.review_text: The service on cross country trains is absolutely diabolical. The first class tickets are extortion and they often have no catering service. I had a 2 and a half hour journey from Bristol to chesterfield in a first class carriage. There were two elderly ladies whom had started their journey at Exeter and were travelling to Edinburgh. As an inspector walked past they asked if they could have a cup of tea, his response ‘there’s no catering on this train at the moment, but there will be at some point, I’ll find out when for you’ he got off the train at Birmingham and never returned to tell the ladies when they would be able to get their tea. The staff just don’t care. My journey down to Bristol the day before was delayed by 40 minutes at derby because a driver was late for work ! No concern at all that the 300 or so passengers had homes to go to, and were paying for the privilege of waiting on someone bothering to turn up for work. Cross country you’re a disgrace and don’t deserve any pay rises ! Sort your service out.

items.title: Absolute rubbish service
items.review_text: Absolute rubbish service, two cc trains broke down , I had to return home  no room on other cc trains , will get refund, never again on cc trains.

items.title: Totnes to Birmingham was beyond…
items.review_text: Totnes to Birmingham was beyond overcrowded, five coaches not enough. Freezing cold, dirty toilets.Birmingham to Leicester smells of urine, the whole trains inside smells like a blocked toilet. £140 for all this.

items.title: Do not travel on this Trainline unless you absolutely have to !!
items.review_text:
Do not travel on this Trainline unless you can help it.  I travel First Class so that I can work and the service is virtually non existent.  
Despite advertising food onboard there rarely is any - no sandwiches and limited snacks - and the coffee and tea offerings are terrible.  
Even the staff are fed up.  
The price of a first class ticket is extortionate and looking at the fact none of these appalling reviews have been answered - they really don't care about their customer service either.  
Its about time they lost the routes they have a monopoly on and a decent company like LNER picks them up

items.title: Would give them zero stars if I could
items.review_text: Would give them zero stars if I could. Absolute shambles of a company. Dangerously overcrowded trains, always late, ridiculously over priced and 99% of the time unable to get a seat. When I can get a seat, these are cramped, very uncomfortable, filthy and dated. Have no sympathy with any strike action they carry out, because of the substandard service they constantly supply. Unfortunately they have me tied down to them because I have no other way of getting to and from work. Lastly Ive seen cheaper airline tickets to new york that are cheaper than their first class tickets.

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text: Terrible. I've commuting on crosscountry for years and everything has got worse. I appreciate it's a tricky franchise to operate, but they're not even close to being up to the job. Will be horrified if they get a franchise extension.

items.title: Staff member lied to me saying she worked for transpennine
items.review_text:
Feel victimised and bullied by this company. Where do I even begin to start…. 
My and my mum who is aged 76 was travelling on 18th July 2023 to Carstairs in Scotland, via Carlisle from Keighley on the original route however there was a line closure even though we did not have tickets for the cross country service we was advised by staff we could use this service 12.08 Leeds to Edinburgh due to a fatality on the line on our original route. We explained going through different check points through Leeds station what had happened and everyone understood (we was advised to take this route) even got an intinary printed of the journey we got told to take. When we got on the cross country service from Leeds to Edinburgh the women conductor had an issue with this and would not allow us to explain. She was abrupt and dismissive and took our name and address. Well of course now we have both been issued a prosecution case and they cross country are pressuring us into paying this within 14 days! I’m absolutely disgusted! What this screams is do not listen or trust train staff and believe me I won’t be doing in the future! The fine is being appealed and I am seeking help from citizens advise about these manipulators. Not to mention this conductor kept mine and my mums original tickets probably in a bid to make out we had no tickets at all! Disgusted by this women’s lack of care and understanding and general customer service i asked where I should make a complaint to and she even lied to me and said transpennine express. So upset by events it was only the following day i realised she had lied. My advise is to avoid this company at all costs they clearly do not care about their customers only about their pockets! I seriously hope they take my complaint about the staff member seriously as she is an absolute embarrassment to the company! This is not over for me I will be seeking legal action and taking the matter to the ombudsman if need be. Push me far enough and I will even seek attention from the media on this matter!

items.title: This company is the worst one around…
items.review_text:
This company is the worst one around for trains and their customer service dept is even worse 

Made a reservation with sears for a journey 11 July 

No reserved seat in fact no available seat at all and had to stand for over an hour with MS !!! 

Return journey no reserved seat offered told to ask for passenger assistance WHICH WAS CANCELLED 

raised a complaint and they made every excuse they could think of from they couldn’t see the tickets as the image is too small to they can’t access the booking 

I’d rather get a bus than use these clowns again

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text:
Terrible service, overcrowded train. Gave feedback, received free first class tickets. Travelled again, first class was declassified...leading to terrible service and an overcrowded train. Pointless

Fool me once, shame on you...

items.title: Customer Service
items.review_text: the customer service that we received from Ashley on Cross Country was excellent. Despite our 08:03 train being cancelled (15/07/2023) going to Chesterfield, Ashley was very attentative. He reassured us and gave clear information on the delay repay procedure. Thanks Ashley.

items.title: Would not recomend First class.
items.review_text:
Would not recomend First class.

Travelled 11/07/23 from Chesterfield to Edinburgh.
Found first class quite disapointing, considering the tickets cost over £1000 for 2 people..

Website says complimentary food and drink (snacks sandwiches etc) upto wakefield we were offered just drinks and snacks, the tea and coffee were poor quality.

After around Wakefield, with a crew change, they did not bring the trolly out just asked, but it felt more of a burden to make the request if anything. They mentioned on the tannoy they would be making breakfast but then never did.

The return journey they came out with the trolly once.

The whole experience is not something id recomend, the seats are not much better than standard class, unclean and smelly.

previosuly travelled first class with virgin to London and this was 10x better experience than this.

items.title: I have given one star
items.review_text: I have given one star, I wouldn't give that had there been an option. Train from Derby to York 8/7/23 . Travel first class, what a joke! not even a cup of coffee, one female train conductor for the whole of the Train. The Train then arrived in Sheffield and approximately 500 Sheffield Wednesday fans then completely take over the train. The poor hostess then had to lock herself away for her own safety, no ticket checks! cross country you must be loosing money hand over fist.  The supporters were both noisy and intimidating. Having experienced a very unpleasant  and feeling very vulnerable journey to York we felt very relieved to get off the Train. However this didn't have a patch on our return journey home after a day of the supporters drinking, I have never felt so unsafe in all my life, they completely took over the whole of the Train, one man fell on top on my husband, it made me cry, again no tickets checked. ( don't blame the conductor) again locked themselves away for there safety. Railway Police came into our carriage to help calm them down. Cross Country Trains you should be ashamed of yourselves. HS2!! ? All this money being ploughed into a railway system to save 10min on a journey you really need to get your priorities right. Loan workers on a train surely this just sums you up completely, and how you treat your staff.

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Awful: late most of the time, don’t care about disabled passengers

items.title: After 43 years of train travel and…
items.review_text: After 43 years of train travel and endless broken promises of the great train services arriving soon. Ive pretty much given up.Its not just crosscountry ( to get a seat a working toilet and be on time together is a rare event on cc) the whole system is below par. After 43 years the biggest improvment I conclude is working air conditioning thats it.

items.title: Don't use if you're a wheelchair user!
items.review_text: Don't even bother trying to use CrossCountry trains if you're a wheelchair user! Boarded a train from Birmingham to go to Oxford to find the space that I was allocated for my small travel scooter, full of large suitcases! Despite being told through customer services via Twitter that the space was reserved! Luckily I kicked up a fuss and after about 5 minutes and another passenger, who's luggage was in the wheelchair space, getting funny with me. I finally got into the space. But whilst having to wait, I had people behind me waiting to get onto the train! Plus I'm not the first person this has happened to! So please if you need the wheelchair space, then avoid unless you have absolutely no alternative!

items.title: Unapologetically terrible
items.review_text:
Unapologetically terrible! It is a crime we have to pay to use this 'service'.

Tips to improve:
1. Cut the costs. It is hard not to feel robbed with the current quality of the service.
2. Clean the carriages. This should be a basic requirement, however, it turns out I have to state it.
3. Add more carriages. A no brainer really. It will mean that 50%of passengers won't be forced to stand.
4. Plan, plan, plan! A bit more effort and you won't always be late.

items.title: Most reviews here are post travel I…
items.review_text: Most reviews here are post travel I only wish I'd read them prior to booking with this outfit. Travelling with these is not a service it's a sentence. I'm a disabled pensioner I reserved seats from Bristol to Wakefield I could barely get on the train when it arrived never mind access my seat so I'd to travel for nearly four hours stood. The train stank of the smell from the toilets it was to add further injuries boiling hot and humid. My heart goes out to folk who've to use this for work.  Never ever again will I travel with them and my advice to others is avoid them at all cost. Obviously from reading here these events are not one off but the norm it's just how they roll pack em in jack get their money that's all they're interested in

items.title: Consistently delayed and blame everyone…
items.review_text: Consistently delayed and blame everyone from the Tory government for overcrowding and the “infrastructures”  for delays. Shabby and dirty and they don’t even apologise for delays  anymore either ???? As for their patronising marketing campaigns ???? Spend the money on tracks and trains and less on spin !!!

items.title: Absolute disgrace
items.review_text:
How the train drivers and associated staff have the damn cheek to ask for more money when they provide such a joke of a service.
Yet AGAIN, an evening service from Tamworth to Sheffield is going to arrive around 40 minutes late.
Cross Country and all t'other operators need to get their act together, provide a proper service THEN ask for more money!

items.title: This time, Cross-country got it really wrong!
items.review_text: Nobody can accuse me to have something personal with Cross-Country, because a previous review I left was absolutely great! However, recently I have experienced (and I am sure I am not alone in this) a big disappointment with the Company. Firstly, they sent me by email a 10% discount code to use in a future journey, only to find out that it did not work. I sent them an email asking for explanation, but the only action they took was to send a general (not specifically addressed to me) saying something like: "we got it wrong this time!". You sure did! Am I right to guess that you were overwhelmed by the response of your Customers trying to use that discount that you have decided to withdraw the offer? Well, let me tell you something; this has damaged your reputation very, very badly! I am also withdrawing any future train bookings with you, and choose a competitor.

items.title: Superb in all respects.
items.review_text: The train was punctual, clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable. In sum a very professional service that resulted in a pleasant, stress free journey.

items.title: Claustrophobic carriages with poor…
items.review_text: Claustrophobic carriages with poor views out Boked a table and window got a large wedge of solid wall zRuined an anticipated pleasant journey away from the car They may claim safety but reason is ill appreciation of customer needs and refusal to task suppliers or pay for the trains needed These trains may be ok for short distance but not across the country from sw to far north A miserable journey that should have been enjoyable Usual cheapskate british approach sadly

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text: Plymouth all the way into Scotland,  just 5 carriages. First class & I had to ask a passenger to vacate my reserved seat. Passengers standing when I caught the train at Sheffield even in the first class carriage. The heat on entering the carriage was like a sauna, I wouldn't be surprised if standing passengers were fainting.  Aisles & door ways blocked by passengers and luggage. YOU BROKE EVERY RULE IN THE HEALTH AND SAFETY BOOK.  SHAME ON YOU!! Oh, and forget about a complementary drink, the trolley couldn't get through the carriage & neither could anyone in an emergency! Thank God I only had to endure this living hell until alighting at York.

items.title: Crosscountry trains don’t care for their customers …
items.review_text:
Booked ticket to travel to Birmingham with my 83 year old mother. Train was over booked and there were no seats or corridor space to stand. We had to stand in the door well for a 2 hours train journey. Asked guard if my mother could sit in 1st class as there were seats in there. Explained she had problems standing and was refused. 
I have raised a complaint a week ago and they have failed to reply. Appears they don’t care about customer service or people health.

items.title: How can this company improve? First of all don't oversell tickets, so we don't have to travel like we travel in India, sitting on the floor.  No air-conditioning on a 30°C temperature day.....fix that
items.review_text: How can this company improve?

items.title: £200+ for a ticket many weeks/months in…
items.review_text: £200+ for a ticket many weeks/months in advance only to be absolutely rammed in stood nose to nose and back to back with other passengers for 3 hours. Never any seat allocation. Horrific and inhumane conditions, had it cost £20 I may put up with it but not for £212. It happens every single time so clearly standard practice. They are heading down the same road as Trans Pennine. Someone needs to step in and fix the issues.

items.title: Fantastic Service
items.review_text:
ROBERT On  11.56 from Banbury to Bournemouth on 22nd of June.
Went above and beyond the call of duty to help me to home. I'm a disabled person in a electric wheelchair ♿️. 
Sterling gent.

items.title: Disgraceful unreliable
items.review_text:
I’ve always said  I would never rely on the U.K. train system for an important event. A holiday flight for example. I’m starting my new job today and had no choice but to use your train service from Bournemouth to Oxford. When I booked I said I do not trust the system. Well you’ll never guess what happened this morning. Train cancelled. Not enough drivers. This country is going backwards. I’ll never use the train service again. Get your backsides back into work and do your jobs.
Not only was my train over an hour delayed the seats were triple booked. Also your claims form does not work either.

items.title: Paying £118 to sit on the floor for three hours
items.review_text:
Why do I pay £118 could have been (£180) to sit on the floor near a bin for 3 hours when the solution would be just to add an extra carriage? Rubbish old uncomfortable smelly trains, sick of forking out a tonne of money for trash. I understand it's not the staff on the ground, but management needs to change.

Train from Stoke on Trent to Oxford at 17:04

items.title: Good experience.
items.review_text: Always found Cross Country a less than punctual train company, however my latest journey with them was seamless. The staff as always with the train companies are the ones who make it and the staff on my journey where  no different.

items.title: Service is bad.mployees are rude.
items.review_text: Train is dirty but I dont mind. But the Service is bad and Employees are rude.

items.title: Always thought about writing a reveiw…
items.review_text: Always thought about writing a reveiw about cross country today trains was packed luggage on the floor  nearly coudnt get of the train long distance journey they had a 4 carriage on sat at the table felt like a sardine etc

items.title: Staff abnoxious and uncaring
items.review_text:
Staff abnoxious and uncaring. Treat you like 2nd class citizens because you've bought 'The cheap tickets' Don't expect any help if you need any. Am a women with mobility issues just suffered a fall difficult to walk or stand. Told by one member of staff that there were seats 4 coaches away but the
Tea coffee member of staff wouldn't allow us through. Overall experience awful and upsetting and a horrible end to a lovely few days away. Thank you Cross Country! Not

items.title: Still indefatigably useless…
items.review_text:
Still indefatigably useless after all these years. Top marks for consistency and refusal to improve in the face of overwhelming negative feedback

Just the usual, late, hugely overcrowded, no air con, no functional WiFi and with a train manager who surely can't actually be traveling on this train from his sunny disposition

items.title: Cross country trains are always unpleasant to travel in
items.review_text: The train I am taking from Birmingham Int to Reading is packed (plenty of people standing, only four carriages), hot and smells of toilets. This is normal for cross country though. These trains are always too small and cramped, frequently crowded and uncomfortably hot, usually smell of toilets, the ceiling is low, the overhead luggage rack is far too small, there isn't enough other luggage space. They are the worst carriages I know of on UK railways and they've been like this ever since they were introduced. Travelling with cross country is therefore an unpleasant experience, which is even worse when they are late as well, which is common (including the train I'm on).

items.title: The train was packed but the staff were…
items.review_text: The train was packed but the staff were giving out free bottles of water which I thought was very nice

items.title: Refused to add return ticket
items.review_text: So stupid. Just by accident bought single ticked on the app and they refused to add return ticked, told me to buy another sigle ticked to go back. Which is same price as both ways!!! Yes i know this is my mistake but costumer cervice is ridiculous!!! They do see all info on their system just refused to help.!!!

items.title: Uncomfortable, overcrowded and delayed
items.review_text: A return trip to from totnes to Sheffield. Coat over £150. Both ways the train was really overcrowded, with people having to stand in thr aisles and outside the toilets. On the way back the carriage was uncomfortably hot and therefore made the trip uncomfortable. No catering on offer between Sheffield and Birmingham. Trip was delayed in both directions.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: I use the Cross Country service between Birmingham and Leicester and a return at least once but more often twice a week. The delays which are regular and constant make it virtually impossible to plan a journey with any sense of timescale. Two major midlands cities less than 45 miles apart and yet it often can take 1:30 or longer to make the journey thanks to delays and cancellations. Utterly appalling device

items.title: It's quicker, more convenient, more reliable and cheaper for me to drive my 1978 VW T2 campervan
items.review_text:
As someone that wants to do good by the planet, I work for a sustainability company based in Leeds. I live in Leamington so need to change trains at Birmingham

My trip last month...
3.5 hours

My trip this month...
5 hours

This is just putting people off using the railway system. It's quicker, more convenient, more reliable and cheaper for me to drive my 1978 VW T2 campervan.

items.title: Utterly abysmal.
items.review_text: Having travelled extensively by rail, both in Europe and further afield, I can honestly say that Cross Country are, even by appalling British standards, one of the worst services I have ever used. Their trains are, from my experience, old, dirty, cramped, uncomfortable and, usually, overcrowded. If I could avoid them I would, unfortunately, on many routes there is no alternative. Furthermore, clearly, the staff and, no doubt, the management have a couldn't care less attitude.

items.title: Appalling service
items.review_text: When you pay a considerable amount for a service I think there is an expectation that you get value for money. Unfortunately this isn’t the case. I visit my elderly mother every month. I’m completely frustrated by the changes I have to make to travel plans due to the ongoing dispute. I’ve just been fobbed off by ‘customer relations’ who said that Great Western should be dealing with the delay in a journey I recently experienced. I never got on a Great Western Train! Sort yourselves out. We’re all struggling financially, and it doesn’t help when you’re having to pay over the odds for a substandard service that you can’t rely upon.

items.title: Crushed like sardines treated like…
items.review_text: Crushed like sardines treated like cattle very expensive must have known more carriages needed the journey made me sick and faint had to stand for over an hour with long term health condition.how can this be in 2023?Never again Cross country trains .

items.title: The Worst Company on the Planet…
items.review_text: On Saturday 27th May 2023, I travelled from Newcastle to Darlington on the 15:39 to Plymouth and rather surprisingly arrived into Darlington on time. That’s the only positive part of the trip. Cross-country are known for their voyagers and yes… they are terrible. They are smelly and a danger to our environment. Running on Diesel power right below overhead power lines (the better option), is a right joke. It’s Polluting for the environment especially when cross-country serve routes that overhead power lines are available and that they can’t connect their smelly trains to. When I boarded the train at Newcastle, it smelt of fresh human waste. The vestibule was sticky and hot, hardly any legroom, crammed as much seating as they can into one carriage. Worse for me as, the tray table was rattling for the 30 minute journey or so. During summer I’m planning a trip to Birmingham New Street and I have no intentions on going on a direct cross country service. I will take other train operators to avoid these deadly voyagers. In addition to this, some, not all staff are extremely disrespectful and clearly don’t like their job. Absolutely terrible attitudes towards customers and extremely overpriced catering combined with a train that is almost like it’s been taped together makes this a company that needs to: Buck their ideas up, sort themselves out, and not offer such terrible levels of customer service. I could give minus stars to this company. Zero stars is way beyond generous for the level I experienced.

items.title: Their rail replacement service from…
items.review_text: Their rail replacement service from Oxford is a fallacy. Be warned the buses either leave early, so you miss them or if you get the bus they recommend, it gets in at the same time the train leaves so you miss it …. Next train two hours later… and they make impossible to reclaim any tickets…

items.title: Rude catering staff
items.review_text: Terrible service from the man with the refreshment trolly. He got on in Newcastle and he had no sandwiches or hot water for teas and coffees. He had bellowed some stuff when he came through the door to the carriage but I couldn’t make out what he had said. When he got to me I said hello, excuse me and he just stared at me like I stopping was an inconvenience to him. I asked what sandwiches he had and he still just stared and didn’t say anything so I asked again what sandwiches he had and he snapped I’ve no sandwiches. I didn’t really know what to say. He made me feel so uncomfortable, he was being so rude. I was looking to see what els was on his trolly and he snapped do you want anything? If he doesn’t like the public he shouldn’t work in customer service. Cross country sort your catering staff out!

items.title: Don't use this train service
items.review_text:
Shocking experience 1st class is absolutely disgusting 
especially when you pay for seats and other people already sat in your seats it's a disgrace no drinks or food offered in 1st class  2nd time using this train service 1st experience people again sat in seats I have paid to sit in and rufuse to move not child friendly everyone is packed in like sardines 👎

items.title: Vile company AVOID at all costs
items.review_text: Vile company avoid at all costs , delays all time , claims submitted weeks later no replies !!! Refer these scammers to the ombudsman !!!!

items.title: Is it possible to give negative ratings…
items.review_text: Is it possible to give negative ratings if so I would give their service -5 stars. Not kid friendly services. Every single time I have had the misfortune to travel with my kid we have had horrible experience with the trains where even If u had reserved the seats there is simply no way getting to the seats because ppl are packed on like sardines in a tin...

items.title: Poor service to say the least
items.review_text: Poor service to say the least. My son had a season pass with a photo card. They used his title as his first initial. His pass got confiscated, even though he had all the proof of purchase and error. They then apologised and gave refund for the new season pass. Told that he won’t get a penalty as it was their fault. 1 month later received a penalty notice. Tried contacting them and no one gets back to you. They were happy taking £3000 for season ticket but not much service comes with that.

items.title: Cross Country I like your style.
items.review_text: 10/05/2023, A landslip between Basingstoke & Winchester meant there were no trains from Lodon Waterloo to Weymouth through Southampton Airport station, where I boarded. However a Cross Country service re-routed did get through. I was welcomed aboard First class carriage by train manager for First classsection Bogusia, even though I was on a Southwestern Trains ticket. Fed and watered by this delightful young lady. You do not even get a cup of hot drink on Southwestern's service. Bogushia &Cross Country you made my day.

items.title: Chaos!
items.review_text: Purchased my ticket online from Birmingham to Edinburgh approximately 3 months prior to departure. Easily done but could not reserve seats. Tried at several different times. Went to ticket agent at Birmingham New Street yesterday and was told we got the last 2 reservable seats. While not together very close. Took train today. Huge step up from platform to car. Ripped luggage as everyone pushing in. No attendents to help. Reserved seats were 6A and 9A ; however actual seats numbered 1,2,3, etc. No alpha. Wasn't only one confused. Resulted in people sitting anywhere and moving if a newer passenger demanded it. Insufficient luggage storage for international travellers. Overhead bins only handle small back packs and carryons. A real gong show! One positive - train arrived in Edinburgh earlier than scheduled.

items.title: This company should cease to exist
items.review_text:
I've had the misfortune to use Cross Country for quite a few years so I knew what to expect. Old, dilapidated and hugely noisy and polluting rolling stock with overpriced tickets and reliability and punctuality which is truly world leading for awfulness. 

Then I had the misfortune of using them to ferry my elderly Mum home. Her train was cancelled and she was put away onto another train requiring two changes, only it was the wrong train which was heading in entirely the wrong direction. Realising this too late she got of at the next station and attempted to head to Birmingham to change trains, but her train was late so she had to run to make her connection. Once on that train it stopped to unexpectedly detach half of its carriages forcing her to stand squashed together in what little remained of the train for hours. 

There are some companies which are so terrible as to be irredeemable.  Cross Country is one. It should be shuttered and renationalised.

items.title: Despicable joke of a rail company
items.review_text: Despicable joke of a rail company. May 1,we had booked months in advance, a direct train, Sheffield to Southampton. Two weeks prior to the journey, an email arrived saying that yhe train is no longer journeying to Southampton. No reason given. Two days later, our return train was no longer doing the full journey so we have today had the appalling situation of having to traipse Southampton to Gloucester, then a tedious, packed, bus to Birmingham New Street, because of engineering works at Cheltenham allegedly. Bus drivers contemptuous and rude, dropping everyone about a quarter mile from the railway station. Well, your company is going to pay for that, I will ensure it. Disgraceful mess.

items.title: I travel to Birmingham from Devon and…
items.review_text:
I travel to Birmingham from Devon and go via London usually, to avoid the pain that is always associated with the cross country voyager. Never enough seats, to small and cramped carriages, chemical toilet smell in the carriage, very uncomfortable seats, useless tables, noisy with the engine under every carriage.
Unfit for purpose, get rid of them all.

On another note, why do we have to endure such awful trains and delays in the UK, while every other European country is a pleasure to travel by train and a lot cheaper as well.

items.title: The CC 09.57 Banbury-Coventry train.
items.review_text:
The CC 09.57 Banbury-Coventry train.

It was reasonably full, but not too full. The seats are comfortable. The train was in good condition and had a nice decor.

items.title: Not fit for purpose
items.review_text: Old tatty trains, over-full with passengers due to too few carriages. 4 hour journey, no hot drinks available  due to trolley not coming to passengers & no paper bags to carry drinks. WiFi signal non-existent. And extortionate ticket prices. If I could drive I would avoid any West Coast trains, but they have non-drivers over a barrel with their terrible service.  Not fit for purpose, way over-priced & belongs back into public hands.

items.title: Crosscountry Trains - Strip them of their operating license
items.review_text: This company SHOULD be ashamed of the appalling way it treats its customers, the reason it is operating and generating a profit for its executives and shareholders, the people responsible for making the decisions that result in, without a doubt, the worst train service in the UK, and the same people who in all reality have scant regard for your posts on any review sites whilst it POSITIVELY impacts their remuneration packages, money generated from your hard earned wages, especially deplorable during these challenging economic times for the average person. Perhaps everyone would be better contacting and complaining directly to the executive board via other social media like LinkedIn, where Mr Tom Joyner (MD), Mr Mark Goodall (Service Delivery Director) and Ms Colette Casey can be found amongst their peer group? Shame on you and your board Mr Joyner for the blatant disregard you so obviously have for your passengers and their welfare!

items.title: The reality of travelling long distance…
items.review_text:
The reality of travelling long distance on a Cross Country Trains service (booked via LNER) .
Not enough carriages, lots of passengers standing. The aisle is blocked with luggage. I can't get to the loo. The 'at your seat' refreshments trolley can't get through. A blind chap has just been shouted at for knocking in to someone. The WiFi is hopeless. It's claustrophobic and I feel unsafe. I have paid £270 to travel from Alnwick to Cornwall 'cattle class'. Shame on you Cross Country and LNER. This is APPALLING!! This is also Cross Country's business model and it needs to change.

items.title: Absolute joke of a company
items.review_text: Absolute joke of a company, no idea how they are still allowed to operate. Got on a 1405 train from Edinburgh, doors were open and train was due to depart in 5 minutes but was in darkness. The guard had been telling people to get on. Once on the doors wouldn’t open between carriages and we were left standing until a rather rude employee came stomping up the train complaining that someone had left the doors open and we shouldn’t have been allowed to get on due to the train being unlikely to be going anywhere soon. Turns out there was an electrical fault. Eventually we were told to get off and onto the front carriages and they uncoupled three carriages which were causing the train to fault. Once aboard we were then told to get into our reserved seats even though some of the carriages were missing. We alll were shuffled about and it took over half an hour for the staff to get people into their right seats. We set off 35 minutes late. We were on the train for 3 hours but there was no buffet cart. Apparently they were short staffed and couldn’t staff the trolley or the buffet carriage. Arrived 25 minutes late to York and had missed my connection and had to wait a further 45 mins for another train. I arrived at my destination over an hour late but cant get any compensation as they managed to arrive within the 30 min period and my second train was a different company. So dirty train, rude staff, delayed and no refreshments. Might have been a one off? The return journey was on time but again the train was filthy and once seated we never saw a staff member for 1.5 hours. Again an announcement to say due to staff shortages there was no refreshment trolley or buffet carriage so another 3 hours unable to buy food or drink. A generally substandard service and it would have been cheaper to drive so next time I will.

items.title: Travelled direct from Leeds to St…
items.review_text:
Travelled direct from Leeds to St Austell in Cornwall yesterday. Just over 7 hours…
What a stressful, claustrophobic journey that was!
Where are health and safety regulations here?
I was allocated a seat but after stepping one foot on the train we could go no further for over 20 minutes! Trying to get down the centre of the carriage with a suitcase was almost impossible due to the volume of people already standing and numerous suitcases..
 it became apparent many seats were double, triple booked… I was asked to move twice as my seat was also allocated to 2 more people? Couldn’t get out of my seat to use the toilet, go buy a sandwich and no one came to collect any rubbish for 7 hours! Absolute disgusting mess… these are not tube trains where everyone crams in…but yesterday was just like that.
Not a safe pleasant journey on many levels!!!

items.title: Half the journey to Stansted cancelled
items.review_text: Half the journey on the Stansted line cancelled so had to spend an hour waiting in Leicester for the next train. Also the wifi doesn't work and there's no phone chargers. Please let LNER buy you out.

items.title: Terrible experience
items.review_text: I have a disabled railcard, due to having metal illness and learning difficulties. I was advised to travel via Birmingham recently due to a land slip/bridge collapse near Didcot, at the station I departed from. When I got on a Cross Country train to Reading, I was shouted at, by the ticket collector, even after offering to pay for an additional ticket.

items.title: Had a season ticket since 2013 to…
items.review_text:
Had a season ticket since 2013 to travel from Tewkesbury to University via the Cardiff Stansted train. The service is an utter joke 50/50 if trains run due to lack of drivers and main excuse for almost 4 years. Delay and repay take months to pay anything and you have to argue each time and contest  my salary sacrifice Swift  season ticket I’ve given up claiming. Been stranded in Birmingham on a number of occasions unable to get back to my young family after working 8-9 hours. Disgraceful company. You can’t even call it a service more pot luck. 
The amount of people I’ve seen miss flights who travel to Stansted is endless.

items.title: Takes the same time and is 60% cheaper…
items.review_text: Takes the same time and is 60% cheaper to get National Express from south west to Birmingham then switch to Northern to the north west. Plus guaranteed a seat! This train company is taking the Micky and just wants short term gain all the way to losing their license in the next round. Shame on all those concerned how we put up with this is beyond me. Choose national express guys! Support the company that has not raised prices during or post Covid. The rail system is a joke.

items.title: Disgusting
items.review_text: Amazing customer service online but….disgusting trains. Filthy, smelly, old, on need of huge face lift. Never using them again. GWR are amazing

items.title: reserve seating a joke !! doesnt exist
