items.review_text: After booking my tickets to find that I had pre-allocated seats sitting me at one end of the carriage and my child at the other, i managed to get that sorted, BUT.. train arrived on time and it was heaving.. and i mean heaving.. couldnt even get down the aisle without help, Someone was sat in our seats and refused to move as the seats didnt have a reserved sign.. and so myself and my child along with 2 large suitcase stood the entire journey of 2.5 hours along with many many others.. thought it must be a total fluke, until our journey home.. and guess what? someone was sat in our seats, no reserve sign, People stood the entire journey again, others getting annoyed that people were in their seats and people in seats were getting annoyed because as far as they were concerned these seats were not reserved.. it was a joke !!! I really will think again about booking a train journey with cross country.. It was expensive as well.. no drinks, nothing.. apparentley there was a trolley for drinks, but they couldnt get down any aisles so what was the point? cant comment on staff, never saw any, no-one to try and work out what was happening and why people were left stood with kids when they had pre-booked seats.. probably didnt want anything to do with the tension.. It would have been cheaper and far less stressful to have gone down to london and then back up to birmingham with LNER or virgin..awful journeys.

items.title: Poor communication and poor customer service - AVOID
items.review_text:
I bought a  ticket for a journey to London following good customer service in the past.

However the return journey was cancelled and no alternative was possible on that date. Crosscountry had told me a later train was possible and it was only when I contacted them that I found this was not the case. The customer service following this was poor and having had to book an alternative ticked elsewhere I am out of pocket. I will not use crosscountry to book tickets again and recommend you avoid where possible.

items.title: I get the 6:35pm Leeds train every week…
items.review_text: I get the 6:35pm Leeds train every week from Bristol Temple Meads to Cheltenham Spa. The train is unclean, the staff are rude, extremely overcrowded and rarely runs on time. This train service is extremely poor- I wouldn’t recommend anyone to use this service, certainly not to commute to work.

items.title: The 20.11 from Newcastle is ALWAYS…
items.review_text: The 20.11 from Newcastle is ALWAYS late. Total shambles of a service. If those jokers think going on strike will cause a problem, it is hardly noticeable with CrossCountry. Almost as poor as TPE.

items.title: Leeds to Edinburgh service
items.review_text: Leeds to Edinburgh service. Train late. Coaches externally dirty. Internally tired with worn carpets and flaking paint. First class seats bigger but not comfortable. Half way through journey and no sign of catering - not even a drink. Not  close to the service provided by LNER.  Will avoid in the future.

items.title: absolute robots.
items.review_text: Your train conductors are forgetting the human element of work. I accidentally got on a train 20 minutes early, going to the same destination, although I'd already paid for a ticket my options were either pay for a new one or recive a fine. My current ticket was already more expensive than the one i was forced into paying for, all for the sake of 20 minutes. Horrid.

items.title: Train not big enough for purpose
items.review_text: Train not big enough for purpose. Very stressful experience. No space for luggage anywhere. Train was supposed to have extra carriages. I booked a seat but that carriage didn't exist. Terrible service. Did not get what i paid for.

items.title: After months trying to get a reasonable…
items.review_text:
After months trying to get a reasonable refund for a £124 fare with reservation I was offered £15 which i refused.
I then went via the Rail Ombudsman who negotiated a £35 voucher which out of principle I have refused.
I will be avoiding this company in future they are a law unto themselves.

items.title: I boarded a Cross Country train this…
items.review_text:
I boarded a Cross Country train this morning approximately 9.36am, Newcastle to Birmingham New Street, arrival 1.06pm. I was expecting delays due to strikes for which I purchased a return open first class ticket in advance to assure as comfortable journey as possible due to tiredness. I have to say that the service I experienced with both Paul (until Leeds) and Alex (thereafter) was exceptional, the best to date.  A particularly rude passenger boarded who didn’t hold a valid ticket I thought that Alex dealt with the situation respectfully and impeccably. 
Alex understood the fact that first class is solely for those with valid tickets. 
Albeit my destination was Leamington Spa which was cancelled, the service I received until then was exceptional - Full credit to your team - wonderful service by very professional and friendly staff. Thank you

items.title: Worst train service ever used!
items.review_text:
Worst train service I have ever used!
I do not recommend this service try using another service which I have started doing. 
They cancel almost every single train from Cardiff to Nottingham, with no cancellation notice. If they do run the train they cancel the Worcestershire Parkway stop every single time.

items.title: Paying for food and drink in first class
items.review_text:
Not catering on train for an hour
Told at Newcastle that it would commence
Took another hour for trolly to come
In first class
No meals
No drinks
Only snack trolley that you had to pay for
Why travel first if you don’t get this service?
Was told catering trolly stopped in one hour so went to get a drink and was told no service anymore as it took and hour to pack up and count
Really deserves a -1 star review
Don’t travel with this company

items.title: Worst travel service in my life
items.review_text:
Worst travel service in my life. I wish there is zero star. I booked with them to travel to Wolverhampton from Manchester. They cancelled our 9.03 train. And told us that we can go with the second train supposed to depart at 9.25am. Now it is 9.42am and there is no driver for z train.
Avoid them at any cost.

items.title: Me and a friend were getting a train to…
items.review_text: Me and a friend were getting a train to Derby and it was her birthday the staff saw the balloon and gave us a first class upgrade, which was a lovely surprise for us! Lovely staff

items.title: So I got a train this morning the 10:51…
items.review_text: So I got a train this morning the 10:51 from Nuneaton to Peterborough the ticket I had was for the 12:51 however after receiving a phone call which was very sensitive after explaining to DAVID my situation he knew I was desperate to get home as have been. I was visiting my sister. The conductor DAVID showed great empathy and compassion as said not to worry and allowed me to travel on the train 2 hours before I was due to. His customer service was excellent and I can’t thank him enough he even told me where there was a seat and for me to get comfortable just shows there are nice people in this world DAVID you are a star thank you from the bottom of my heart

items.title: This is easily the worst train in the…
items.review_text: This is easily the worst train in the UK.  Its small, uncomfortable, you cannot get your laptop out and work, forget that idea.  Seats believe it or not are not easy to identify.  I travel.by train alot and generally they are great but this awful awful train I've had the misfortune to board 5 or 6 times now and it's the same everytime, simply the pits, honestly avoid at all costs, sadly easier said then done.

items.title: The train manager allowed me on the…
items.review_text: The train manager allowed me on the earlier train although I was booked 30 minutes later on a cold evening. Really appreciate it, thank you so much

items.title: Dangerously overcrowded and expensive
items.review_text:
Travelled on the Plymouth to Glasgow train (the train stopped short at Edinburgh because they didn't have enough staff).

The train was dangerously overcrowded. Only 5 carriages for a train travelling almost the entire length of the UK...

People were standing in the aisles and corridors and even sitting in the toilets. There is no aircon in the spaces between carriages and the temperature was intolerable. I knew it was going to be bad when the conductor apologised for the "SEVERE OVERCROWDING" as soon as we set off. Ending up standing for 2 hours of a 3 hour journey, some were not so lucky. 

Not to mention that even if you do get a seat, there is almost no legroom, the overhead storage is tiny, and the entire train stinks of chemical toilet. 

Paid £150 for the privilege. Never again.

Overcrowding is a long term problem for XC but they show no interest in fixing it or even taking ownership of the problem, all I got from staff were a list of excuses that we've all heard before. For starters they could require their staff to work Sundays so they can run a full schedule and stop treating their customers like cattle.

My advice is to avoid travelling by Cross Country at all costs. It's just as cheap to hire a car and the coach is cheaper still.

items.title: Awful service
items.review_text: Awful service.  Zero stars if I could.  Had a seat reservation on 1611 from Burton on Trent to Bristol.  Train 18 minutes late and absolutely rammed.  Why not chain two trains together?  Very uncomfortable stand to Birmingham. Almost fainted.

items.title: Disgraceful
items.review_text:
Disgraceful dirty, packed, standing room only and that’s first class!!
Rest of train even worse

items.title: Uncomfortable and expensive. Don’t travel without a seat reservation.
items.review_text:
I travelled from the Southwest to the Midlands on a Saturday morning. Fortunate I had a reservation but had to apologise to the woman whose child was in my seat. Fortunately she was only on for 2 stops. The train was packed, standing room only for most people without reservations.
The seats are uncomfortable and the carriage smells of the toilets.
Cost; about 2x the fuel in my car for the journey, and it took an hour longer than driving. If I had the family in tow it would be prohibitive even with a rail card. The economics makes little sense.
Ironically my 2 star review will improve the average score 😂

items.title: These trains are a disgrace
items.review_text: This company on a weekly basis crams as many costumers onto its trains with no seat to sit in dangerous if there ever was an emergency or a accident there would be carnage it’s a disgrace I travel to Plymouth from the northwest six hour journey and many many times I booked seats and never had printed seats on the ticket £189 for the pleasure at least dick Turpin wore a mask this and the other train companies rob you blind and a feel there giving a top rated service they are delusional not a good experience to be fair and been using trains for years same old same old because there’s so many cogs in this wheel they all pass the book on to each other just to frustrate and make it harder to claim GWR/ London northwestern  not much better and Trainline wow they offer insurance which is not worth a carrot the whole thing it is bent and stinks reduce you carbon footprint they say you’d be better buying a car cheers for the wonderful experience

items.title: Cross country are the worst train…
items.review_text: Cross country are the worst train company in the uk. If you can avoid them do so.  Pointless reserving a seat as they change things at the last minute every time.  Coaches are cramped ops and smelly.  A very unpleasant and uncomfortable experience.

items.title: Truly dreadful!
items.review_text:
Where do I begin? 

I abhor this company with every fibre of my body! Their trains are woefully cramped with not enough seats for the journeys that they make. Whoever thought it was a good idea to put a 5 carriage train on journeys that can go from Scotland to Plymouth deserves sacking! Their seats are uncomfortable, the interior is so dated and their voyager trains always have a funny smell to them also.

The pricing is purely extortionate. The audacity they have to charge you for such a pathetic service really gripes me. I travelled Newcastle to Birmingham and back cramped, stressed and with no signal for the duration of the journey but because they have monopoly of the route they know they can get away with such a tinpot service!

The alternative? There isn't one and that's the problem! If I want to visit family in the West Midlands from Newcastle I either go direct with them for an extortionate fee or I travel via Carlisle or London adding hours onto my journey! 

I would genuinely rather get a Megabus or National Express and save my money than travel with CrossCountry again. Literally not a single positive thing about them!

items.title: Don't waste your money
items.review_text: We thought we'd try getting a first class ticket to see if it would improve the experience. First off there is no difference between first and standard. Second it's so packed we ended up standing for the whole blood trip. So In essence they charge you triple for the same rubbish experience.

items.title: without a doubt the worst rail operator…
items.review_text: without a doubt the worst rail operator I have ever used. I have had the unfortunate luck to have to use this pathetic companies trains thrice in the last six months. the trains are cramped, showing highly visible signs of wear and tear. they treat people like cattle, each time I've used them there has been a maximum of five carriages on Newcastle to Cardiff, one of these is first class, three are for  reserved tickets leaving just one carriage for unreserved which gets packed. at two hundred pounds a ticket for this pathetic service it literally is being robbed, I would rather spend twelve hours in a jail cell than six on a cross country train if it could get me to my destination. if you have absolutely any other travel alternatives I implore you to use them

items.title: Worst UK train operator
items.review_text: As other reviews comment Cross Country seem to not be paying the delay repay compensation they are supposed to. Other operators are very efficient. My claim is from September 2022 and even with the ombudsman involved Cross Country are still not paying up - it’s the principle for me. Cross Country are clearly very poorly run and should lose their franchise.

items.title: Failure to pay compensation promised
items.review_text: Following a complicated and very delayed journey in September 2022, I made a successful compensation claim (confirmed by Cross Country Customer relations on 29.11.22), and supplied my bank account details in the online format requested. However we have never received the compensation. I have chased the refund twice. On the first occasion I was told again that it had been awarded and would be paid into my bank account. I never received a reply to my second reminder. Clearly a prompt refund within the 10 days promised in November 2022 would be appreciated.

items.title: I only want a booked seat!!!
items.review_text:
I booked my travel 27 Nov. I wanted to travel 3 January. I rang as I wanted a booked seat from Edi to Newcastle. As a disabled passenger I was told I should book assistance to be first on the train. I pointed out no point in being first if there are NO seats. I told them I was not prepared to tramp up and down the train looking for a seat dragging my tiny case behind me.  After sometime I held out and was given a code to activate at the station to claim my booked seat. (no plan B if this failed). Then a strike was announced for 3 jan.
So I emailed them, after 2 weeks they told me to book assist, I replied no! 

So I also, emailed Collette Casey CEO- still waiting of an acknowledgement noting as of 22 Dec 2022.

 I only want a seat! 19 Dec they email me with details of Assistance telling me to arrive 20 minutes before the train and I would be helped to a vacant seat. (if they are vacant then book me one?)
So I have changed my entire trip home as this is the second leg of my trip, I now have a seat booked by using LNER. How hard was that???
How are disabled people to live life to the full and when all they want is a booked seat but booked their ticket with another company as they find LNER easier to use.

items.title: First class is an absolute joke
items.review_text: First class is an absolute joke. There are never any drinks available or offered. The snacks are cheap and nasty and 1st isn’t 1st class at all. Awful service when you complain

items.title: Lower volume of announcements
items.review_text:
Lower volume of announcements. 
Make them succinct 
Make them less often
People want to read, listen to audio, have conversation, maybe even sleep; all without being interrupted by too many announcements.

items.title: Avoid
items.review_text:
Avoid using this train provider at all costs.
Trains are horribly overcrowded, reserving a seat is a waste of time, as its so busy with people and luggage on the floors you cannot reach your seat.
very dangerous if there was to ever be an emergency situation.
Always late.
Overpriced and a terrible level of customer service.

items.title: Probably the worst train I’ve ever…
items.review_text:
Probably the worst train I’ve ever travel with in Europe and South America.
Rarely on time, constantly cancelling trains, little to no previous warning, no replacement buses…
Horrible experience.

items.title: great communication
items.review_text:
I had not travelled back home in a while. I managed to get a direct train from Bristol, to Manchester - which is not usual.

It was the smoothest, most unproblematic train journey I've ever had. the people working where so helpful, continuously updating passenger's. There was a disruption at Wolverhampton and they made sure to repeat this several times. 

So thank you to the workers on the 2 o'clock train on the 6/12/2022.

items.title: Won't be using this company again
items.review_text: Travelled from Edinburgh to Derby recently.  Train was late, seats uncomfortable.  The seat back table was dirty and graffiti adorned the seats.  Not good enough.

items.title: web site is very poor
items.review_text:
web site is very poor
booking is a hassle
very unclear where to add railcard
very easy to loose info added

items.title: Couldn’t recommend
items.review_text: Couldn’t recommend - I tend to book 1st class on the route Peterborough-Birmingham as I’m coming up and down from London, but you can guarantee it’s the only part of the train full of thugs and no other discernible benefits - suggest anyone doing the same to book standard for this leg - and that’s if they really need to use the train and they’re unreliable and late at the best of times.

items.title: Awful train operator avoid
items.review_text:
In my opinion the worst train operator, trains are too small and falling apart. No staff to be seen on the trains for support ( trains are too packed anyway) and they have daily delays. Daily commuter in the Leicester to Loughborough line. 

I would recommend you avoid travel with this operator when possible, especially at peak times.

items.title: Clowns
items.review_text: Boarded the train recently and thought my ticket was digital but I should have collected it. Two girls on the train stopped me and I shown proof of purchase. “Sorry, computer says no, we have to issue you with a fine then you have to respond with proof of the ticket.” I was annoyed but decided I was talking to a brick wall so gave my details. Letter has just come through with £130 fine. Nowhere on the letter is there information on how to provide my details of the ticket I had already purchased. I am now chasing around trying to sort this out. It’s as if these rail franchises compete of who can be the worst. Absolutely ridiculous experience again.

items.title: Paid £626 for a return ticket from…
items.review_text: Paid £626 for a return ticket from Leeds to Bristol Temple Meads, food available was tea, coffee, soft drinks (coke) pastry or crisps, return journey the 1st class carriage was hijacked by passengers in Birmingham who just took over it, the train was absolutely rammed with people standing everywhere, carriage wasn’t cleared until derby when cheese & onion crisps were available again…..over priced & absolutely no control over anything thank goodness I don’t use them a lot…..

items.title: Why do these long distance trains run…
items.review_text: Why do these long distance trains run with 4 coaches. 1 of these was first class, so really only 3. People crammed in like sardines. Thank god there were no emergencies. GWR have 10 coaches!

items.title: Cross country now obviously not…
items.review_text: Cross country now obviously not answering emails. Delay Repay is a joke. Train from Cambridge to Birmingham was over an hour late which meant I missed connection to Perry Barr and my meeting. Had to reschedule for another day. After several months and emails I have not received a reply. The present email address for Cross Country is not recognised. If you have to claim it is essential you photocopy tickets before sending them, as they will say they haven't been received. Also lack of information at Birmingham New Street is useless. The arrival board is not up to date and staff never know when train will arrive and often tell you it has gone when it hasn't. In some cases even cancelled. There is plenty of staff at New Street walking around looking important with iPads. The new uniforms don't make for efficiency. Unfortunately, Cross Country have a monopoly of this particular route so there is no alternative.

items.title: Took a cattletruck from…
items.review_text: Took a cattletruck from tamworth-wakefield on Saturday,changed at derby,spent the rest of the trip standing crushed in by disabled toilet,if you pay for a seat,you should get a seat,absolute p##s take,start thinking about your passengers instead of shareholder's,you have to wear a seat belt to travel by coach,this is just a disaster waiting to happen,you should be sued to hell,plus you owe me a refund,as I paid twice for this dusgrace

items.title: Like Sardines in a Can
items.review_text: At least 24 of us packed into the space between 2 carriages on the 10:14 from Wolverhampton to Manchester on 19/11/2022. And this was repeated in EVERY section between carriages. Couldn't your company's planners have the foresight to predict high levels of demand GIVEN the planned industrial action the following weekend and therefore lay on extra carriages? Nine carriages only were provided and it was a Health and Safety disaster waiting to happen. The conditions were so bad that it was nearly impossible to access the toilets and some of my fellow travellers were actually struggling for oxygen. I've never seen the like.

items.title: Rude staff member
items.review_text: Rude staff member! The train door opened for us to get on and the lady started shouting at us to use a different door due to stock being left in the passage way. The lady then proceeded to talk to her colleague about us, communicating that we were stupid when the stock left on the floor couldn’t be seen until we stepped onto the train. I understand the need for safety, but at the same time there are polite and kind ways of communicating that make the customer not feel stupid. There are two services leading to where I need to go today, this is the quicker one; however considering this experience, I’d rather leave earlier and get the chiltern railway service instead.

items.title: Thanks for my efficient,stress free…
items.review_text:
Thanks for my efficient,stress free service from Penzance to Birmingham international via Bristol 
on 17/11/22
On the Plymouth to Birmingham New Street I was served tea by the associate Maxine . Maxine has impeccable customer service skills, polite ,approachable , efficient , amazing customer care skills.i thoroughly enjoyed my trip. Thank you

items.title: They cancelled my ticket because of…
items.review_text: They cancelled my ticket because of strike. Change job if you have problems. I don't care about you if you can't make your job on time and I have to change my plans because of it. No more trains. Good job train people. I hope they will fire 30%of you.

items.title: How can you expect normal people to afford this
items.review_text: Insanely expensive and I can't afford to go and visit my family when I need to. Youre expected to pay as if it was a luxury experience, but its just a slightly grubby train. Obviously only driven by squeezing the already beleagured public as much as possible to get big profits for the fat cats.

items.title: Had cancelled trains over the the…
items.review_text: Had cancelled trains over the the weekend they were striking. Was promised a refund and have not received. When I’ve chased it up they say that I’ve already had it! Almost £50 they owe me and haven’t received anything. Can’t provide a service and then refuse to refund.

items.title: Awful. How dare they strike.
items.review_text:
Awful. Late again! How dare these people strike, they should be paid less for delivering a budget service. 
Cross country rail? More like cross country FAIL.

items.title: Some problems
items.review_text: Caught the 12.15 from Southampton on 8th Nov. Only 4 carriages and jam packed, staff did apologise but couldn't resolve the problem. I upgraded to 1st class when I returned on the 11th. Staff were brilliant and it was a relaxing journey. I have often used this service and have always found the staff to be helpful.

items.title: Darren served us a tea on our Saturday…
items.review_text: Darren served us a tea on our Saturday evening with a smile. Thanks for working a Saturday evening Darren.

items.title: Awful train service
items.review_text: Writing a review from the small space in front of the out of service toilet on the train between Manchester and Reading using my 4G signal as the wifi doesn’t work. I can just about see outside past ten stacks of bags and suitcase. It’s now the 5th time I have caught this train and it is totally jam packed every time I catch it. The people on the train are in good spirits which makes up for the frankly abysmal service. Next time get the mega bus

items.title: A hopeless train company
items.review_text: A hopeless train company. No notifications when it cancels trains. The company is so hopeless that it can't even make reservations on its own trains.

items.title: No food or drink on train at peak time…
items.review_text: No food or drink on train at peak time (8.35am) between Newcastle and Birmingham (3 hours). Regular issue. GNER can manage to provide a trolley service from Edinburgh to London with few issues so why can't Cross Country on their route???

items.title: Only care about shareholders
items.review_text: I took the train from Nottingham to Birmingham New Street it was cancelled with no reason given probably because they didn't want to pay staff and would rather keep the money for the shareholders and run a terrible service so I had to get the train from Leicester which was also run by cross country that train was delayed and when I did arrive in Birmingham New Street it was almost an hour late so I missed my other train and had to get a later one keep asking passengers for more money but the service gets worse try putting some of that money back into the infrastructure you greedy pigs I am now waiting to see if I get a refund or not

items.title: Having spent the last few weeks using…
items.review_text: Having spent the last few weeks using the Railway service with different providers I can happily say the Cross Country are the worst ever. Cancellations left right and centre, 2 coach trains that are rammed beyond what can possibly be safe limits. The trains are old and tired. Have not managed to get on on single journey with them without issues, defiantly going back to driving everywhere. Should be shut down.

items.title: Always cancelled and never reimbursing costs.
items.review_text:
If there was less than 1 stars I would give it. Horrid experience, careless staff, never on time.

I had booked a train to the airport to see my family for the first time since covid a month before my flight. 40 minutes before the train departs it gets cancelled and I’m left to find my way with luggage with limited time until I reach the airport. The collateral damage cost me £89 and they did not reimburse a single penny.

When contacting them, their customer services was absolutely vile. Refusing to allow me to complete my sentence, cutting me off half way and not even entertaining what I was saying. I remain in correspondence with them via email for 2 months and still nothing.

Expect nothing from a company so horrible. Never book with them. Save your money this is daylight robbery.

items.title: Cross Country is the WORST
items.review_text: Cross Country is consistently the absolutely worst railway! I can't even begin to narrate my experience because they're not going to do anything about it. Just avoid Cross Country for your journeys.

items.title: Ten years: same story
items.review_text: Well it is not just my latest experience but accumulated experiences over the last 10 years in which I have spent thousands of pounds traveling on these services. The same inadequate, short and aging trains which are cramped,  insanitary and have poor ventilation. Buffet service is terrible. Punctuality is also poor. There are very few advance tickets so the fares are high. First class is three times the price so is always empty while the rest of us are forced into the remaining carriages. Cross-country is a disgrace to the rail industry and should give up for the sake of everyone who has the misfortune to have to use their services. The partner company Arriva is also known for running bus services and clearly wishes to drag their trains down to the same pitiful standard.

items.title: The Destination Unknown … as you probably will could die on route
items.review_text: Overcrowded trains, disgusting, unclean, heavily putting peoples lives as risk. Seems to be an issue on every service every day. Same excuse all carriages that XC trains have are in use already. Well if you have more services than carriages then clearly the company is very badly managed. People literary standing/sitting in toilets to allow others to get on. An average 4 carriages per train yet travelling south coast to Scotland stopping probably at 20 major stations in route. People are clinging on desperately to try and get onboard - something you expect to see in a third world nation. XC heavily failing their mandatory requirements as part of the franchise agreement with Dept of Transport. The agreement needs to be nullified before people die as lives are at risk literally on every service run by XC.

items.title: Worst train on planet Earth.
items.review_text: Where do i begin.. No matter the day these damn trains always be late, so you can be assured that you gonna end turning up to work late or your destination. The worst train company on planet Earth.

items.title: Another overcrowded train
items.review_text:
Too many people on the 1203 train from Birmingham New Street to Newcastle. People sat with young children in the sections between carriages, outside the toilets on wet floors (I dread to think why they were wet). This 'service' felt like we were cattle being shoved onto carriages for our final journey to the abattoir. At what point is this overcrowding considered unsafe?
I have a solution for Cross Country... buy a couple of extra carriages and hitch them onto your peak services. Give customers a seat reservation by default instead of this nonsense about having to message for a seat reservation - I know there will be no-shows but whatever percentage you are calculating this will be, it is way off. Then once all the tickets for a train are sold... stop selling any more tickets 😉
Then watch as your reviews massively improve and more people start using your trains because it's actually a bearable experience. 
If you need any more assistance let me know?
Trustpilot you have my permission to share my email address with Cross Country so they can hire me as their new CEO 😁

items.title: Delays, refunds & poor service
items.review_text:
Trains are consistently delayed meaning all connecting trains go out the window, and they offer a partial refund... of £3 and then take a £10 admin charge fee. 

What an absolute joke of a company, can't wait until I no longer have use for them. 

I have had to use taxis on more occasions than I can count on my hands to get to an appointment on time because of the unreliability of the train services, on top of what I have to spend on these train fares.

items.title: worst of all the train companies. improvement needed.
items.review_text:
4 carriages instead of 8 due to an "incident" so was cramped with screaming children constantly.
then had a signalling error so train was 22 minutes late meaning i missed my change and was late to work. Then was told i wasn't allowed a refund because it was over 30 minutes *Edit* review originally 1 star but they gave me the refund after i mentioned missing my next train

items.title: no response from my delay claim
items.review_text: Recently there were multiple strikes going on and a lot of train cancles, I submitted my delay claim but no response at all after more than 2 months. On 19/10 my train was cancelled again and tried to submit the delay claim, but was not allowed to submit, please tell me why?

items.title: Train from Cornwall to Endinburgh
items.review_text: Train from Cornwall to Endinburgh. Dirty, dusty, smelly. Doesn't have proper air filtration. I would rather the old trains with opening windows. Uncomfortable seats. WiFi says its 79 mbps but you can't even stream a film on it. So sat here listening to screaming kids instead. Plug sockets but no USB sockets. I feel really ill with the poor air quality on this train. No quiet carriage either.

items.title: Horrible experience
items.review_text:
We travelled from Gloucester to Birmingham and back.  We paid a massive premium for so-called first class.  The 1st class compartment was tiny: tired and uncomfortable and dirty. It was crammed with passengers, and I was very suspicious that most of them had not paid for a 1st class ticket at all, which meant that my wife and I had to sit separately in cramped conditions. There was no inspector to police this.
On the outbound journey there was a steward,  but he spent the first 1/2 hour cursing and messing around with the computer screen which was obviously malfunctioning.  Eventually I approached him for a coffee (which was complimentary) and it was revolting.  No sign of a code for the complimentary wifi.
The return journey was even worse, and no steward at all.
What a dreadful service Cross Country is.

items.title: Just need to say Phil the host on the…
items.review_text: Just need to say Phil the host on the Manchester to Birmingham New Street service today - 22nd Oct 1.28pm service is a credit to your business. He served us with a smile and a sense of humour. Very rare to see service like this and it was great to experience it.

items.title: Consistently late and overfilled
items.review_text: Consistently late and overfilled. Once an hour trains between main cities makes changeovers a nightmare, with missed connections approximately half the time I get a Cross Country train.

items.title: Very poor service 🥶🥶🥶
items.review_text:
I got on train at Stanstead to Peterborough (final Birmingham). The display sign was showing that the train was going to Leicester. Thankfully voice info said is going to Birmingham. Hopefully the right destination. When mentioned to ticket man, his reaction was “oh yes..” and wrong display of the destination continued.

Additionally the train was FREEZING cold, blowing extra cold air at us!

I was charged nearly £30 for the most POOR service. Just returned from Europe, where, somehow, everything works well and satisfactory to clients.
Something to learn from… 🤔

items.title: Bought a first class ticket
items.review_text: Bought a first class ticket - got on board- no catering - guard didnt give a sh it - train was late - no one give a shi t - board of directors- dont give a sh it

items.title: Bad journey, non-existent customer service
items.review_text: Wish I could give a minus score!  The trains are horrible and not very clean, but the worst thing is they say they will refund your whole fare if you are delayed by two hours or more.  After a horrendous journey where I was delayed by nearly four hours, information about what to do was chaos.  I am still waiting for even a response!  I have raised this as a complaint and all I have had is a standard email acknowledging my contact.  Saying they have a high level of complaints and it may take time is not a good look - do they even realise this?  I am not waiting any longer, I am going to the Ombudsman.  How is this company allowed a franchise?

items.title: I remember the Intercity 125's
items.review_text: I remember the Intercity 125's! Wow have we gone backwards. No luggage space, luggage racks too shallow for anything short of a skinny rucksack and 4 carriages on a long distance service from Bristol to Edinburgh what's going on! And I love railways:(

items.title: One star is one star too many.
items.review_text:
One star is one star too many.
As a special treat my wife and I booked a first class return between Dundee and Sheffield departing on 22 October and returning on 27th. 
I am over 6’6” tall and am approaching my 79th birthday. The length of my femurs prevent me from sitting on a standard seat. I have been known to break the back of the seat in front in an attempt to fit. So I always book priority seats which accommodate me easily……IF ONLY…
I had hoped I would be allocated one and not have to seat surf when on board. 
It was with trepidation that I received our reservations. I would have expected adjoining seats-but no..
On boarding it transpired we were located in front of each other and directly in front of (thankfully) unreserved priority seats on the other side of the aisle. So we moved.
Shortly afterwards a lady who had an LNER booking but no seat reservation boarded and tentatively approached my original seat showing a Dundee to Sheffield reservation. To help out I suggested she took the seat as I had reserved it but would not be using it. She could transfer to my seat at Sheffield as it remained un booked if anyone had the seat she was using reserved beyond Sheffield.
Sounded ok to us BUT when the tickets were inspected all hell let loose with both of us being told that was not how the system worked…As she was not a XCountry client she could not have priority over a XCountry one should one turn up with a ticket for the seat….I pointed out one had turned up and was sitting in a priority seat which was not reserved and would be mine until Sheffield when if need be she could swap. At which point the screaming of the three staff reached a crescendo so I had to turn my hearing aids off and she moved on to another (unbooked) seat which she occupied to Sheffield and beyond…
So not a good start but the seats were comfortable. Complimentary service was ok but limited…

RETURN was XCountry to York. As expected we had separate non priority seats with a vacant unbooked pair of Priority seats opposite - to which we transferred, Thankful to leave at York. Carriage had been old and dirty .
There we transferred to an LNER Azuma train. It was immaculate and although we were placed on table seats there was leg room for me.
Staff were plentiful and well trained. Service was prompt and the lunch (note XCountry) was superb. Complimentary wine appreciated. Only problem here was a detachable head rest located between shoulder blades - which was detached..


SO I will never ever travel first class again.   It is just a waste of money £650 for that experience.
I will use LNER for future trips to Sheffield and hope their booking system allows for priority seats to be both identified and delivered.

items.title: Sadly, I have a return ticket
items.review_text:
I am currently traveling from York to Truro (7 and a half hours) and, through no fault of our team, we are now over 10 minutes late.
The seats are uncomfortable, the buffet car closed some time ago, there is no leg room and not enough luggage storage. I've spent the majority of the journey with my nose pressed up against my holdall because the only place to put it was on the table.
Staff seem lovely, trains are terrible.

items.title: NO TICKET in my email
items.review_text:
I bought an e-ticket today, it has been more than 15 hours, but there is NO TICKET in my email. 
The team tells me that they are trying to solve the problem, they repeatedly ask to send me all the details, but they do not send me a ticket. 
This is outrageous!

items.title: Disgustingly dirty and overpriced
items.review_text: Disgustingly dirty and overpriced. "Ohhh yeah global warming is a problem and we should all take public transport... But lets make it unaffordable so people want to drive in their own cars alone all over the country, spitting out emissions all over the place". Our railway is nothing to be proud of anymore and is an afront to human decency and pride.

items.title: Utterly shocking
items.review_text: Utterly shocking. Old, dirty, cramped, usually overcrowded, sometimes faulty and rarely on time. Will willingly take a longer more expensive route with more changes if I can at all avoid using this service. One star is given simply because there is no zero star option.

items.title: Not that there are any good train…
items.review_text: Not that there are any good train companies in the UK. However cross country are amongst the worst.

items.title: Not Cross Country At All !
items.review_text: This company should be called cross county as their so called through services have been cut to bits or don’t even exist . Today trying to get from Oxford to Winchester should be covered by their through to Bournemouth service but it stops at 4pm and then it requires one or two changes and long waits for connecting trains , making a one hour journey into a one hour 45 min journey . Their route map shows through lines when in fact there are very few if any fast through services . They are a disgrace!

items.title: The most uncomfortable seats I have ever sat in will take the car next time
items.review_text: Travelled on the Leeds to Edinburgh service having not travelled on a train for many years. They tell us to take the train and let it take the strain. Never again... Most uncomfortable seats I have ever sat on, they left me in a lot of pain as you cannot relax in them. No leg room either. Stale stinky recirculated air from the air con. Wouldn't ever do this again will drive next time in my car it would be cheaper as well. I cannot believe companies think this is an acceptable way to travel. Who designs these seats and passes it as acceptable. I complained the conductor and he told me the new trains are even worse!

items.title: WORST UK TRAIN SERVICE
items.review_text:
WORST UK TRAIN SERVICE 
I use the UK rail network every day and have experienced all the different rail companies. Cross Country is the worst by a far. 
They are dirty, rarely can you charge your phone, they are the most expensive and 70 percent of the time I have to stand as there are no seats.

items.title: Appalling service
items.review_text: Appalling service. Still awaiting a Delay Repay claim on an hours delay over 6 weeks ago. GWR recently did a repay for a similar delay on another day within 3 days....... shocking.

items.title: Appalling customer service
items.review_text: Appalling customer service.  No refreshments offered at all on First Class travel

items.title: Driving is cheaper, and you are less likely to have someone vomit on you
items.review_text: Unilaterally poor experience, staff on the train ambivalent, customer services actively useless ("we can only reiterate what is on the website, we don't have access to any other information" - so of no use at all unless you want someone to read out loud to you), and the actual trains are filthy and run to a timetable someone imagined. Awful.

items.title: Absolute amazing service from the staff…
items.review_text: Absolute amazing service from the staff on the train from stafford to Manchester. In particular a man named Des could not do enough for us. Thanks very much for a fantastic experience!

items.title: Wrong date entered when buying ticket
items.review_text: Wrong date entered when buying ticket. No refunds even if in a short time. Can't change the date unless it's the next day in the morning. What a waste of money.

items.title: NEVER AGAIN
items.review_text:
Firstly we had reserved seats and the first train we got on someone was in the seats and refused to move, that train was cancelled due to fault which I can’t complain about, better to be safe than sorry. Had to wait an hour for the next available train, good thing I had nothing to be on time for when I arrived :)
Train arrives, platform is absolutely packed (as there were about 3 other train cancellations so 3 trains worth of people including the people already on) we all get on. Seats full, every single carriage entrance full but not overly full, was bare-able for the time being, second stop a small number got off, more piled in this meant 0 room at all this carried on the whole 2 hour 30 minutes I was on the train. 10 people squished in the toilet is how bad it was :). As you can imagine it was boiling. Peoples bags, people pressed against you wasn’t nice. More people proceeded to get on, even though there was absolutely no room! Surely this should be a health and safety issue? Was absolutely disgusting it honestly felt like I was on the tube. Also a man decided he couldn't wait 2 minutes for the toilet so proceeded to wee with the door open surrounded by people, was shouting, also asking underage girls their age :) 
Will NEVER go with this service again

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text: We were on the train and due to delays looking to miss our connecting train.  We asked the conductor for advice and he reassured us that the current train would now be stopping at our stop too, as did the Twitter handler on Cross Country's account.  Very happy.  Stayed on train at our connecting station and further reassured by an announcement including our destination station.  2 minutes later another conductor checked our tickets and told us we weren't stopping there and the announcer had made a mistake, so we were stuck on the train for a further hour.  After politely complaining to the conductor and showing them the Twitter messages they contacted the announcer for confirmation.  He then decided to try and humiliate us by announcing to the train that we had got on the wrong train (we'd been on it for 4 hours) and that it was our fault we were stuck.  I wrote to their customer services to complain and have received nothing back.  Actively avoiding travelling on their trains as a result, what a shower.....

items.title: No complaints here
items.review_text: I don't know if I have ever travelled on a CrossCountry train because I never really pay much attention - but, for some reason, I always buy my train tickets through their website or app. I can't fault either. They're easy to navigate, they don't charge a booking fee (like some other sites do) and on the occasional time that I have needed to contact them, they have been super friendly and helpful.

items.title: INCOMPETENCE
items.review_text: I reserved seats for the 11.12 Birmingham New Street to Plymouth service over a month ago. On boarding, the cancellation of an earlier service and the removal of two carriages meant that the reservations were voided. Although the train manager announced that reservations were valid no staff were available to enforce them. In carriage C there were over 30 people standing, making it impossible to access staff  toilets and catering. Thete was absolutely no attempt to observe basic health and safety issues or the needs of elderly passengers left standing while younger passengers retained their seats throughout the journey. No one between New Street and Newton Abbot checked the tickets and in future I will not bother to buy one because even as a free ride it was unacceptable. I already have a claim for a refund pending due,supposedly, to the high number of claims. Correction. It is not caused by the high number of vlaims but the rubbish offered as a service.

items.title: Useless
items.review_text: I have been waiting 2 months for a refund for a train that was delayed by over an hour on both journeys. I rang up today as was getting no closer communicating via email only to find out that there is still another 4-5 weeks for me to wait before i get a refund. Clowns.

items.title: Cross Country 12.15 today from…
items.review_text: Cross Country 12.15 today from Southampton to Manchester.  Standing Room only. Passengers Packed in like Sardines. This route has on many occasions been overbooked but this time it was most unpleasant. The excuse given was the amount of additional passengers joining the train after the weekends Festival at Winchester, all with extra large rucksacks and  additional equipment. My experience is that this is Always a busy route often with some standing but this journey was exceptional. The service often has 10 carriages but today it was 5.  As I was in an aisle seat I was constantly being bumped into.  Awful journey, hot, sweaty, noisy and unsafe due the  number standing and cases blocking aisles. No refreshments available.  Passengers with booked seats unable to get seats this included 1st class.

items.title: I used Cross country trains with some…
items.review_text:
I used Cross country trains with some of my fellow guide dog puppy raisers and our puppies.  It was their 1st trip on a train and part of their guide dog training.  We travelled from Narborough to Leicester and back.
I cannot praise this railway service enough for helping make us and our puppies so welcome

items.title: No trolley service during lockdown
items.review_text: I remember travelling from Birmingham to the north of england.lt was during covid lockdown in 2021 April so there was no trolley service so l decided to go and look for the shop.l had to pass through first class to look for the shop.and the train conductor asked me .l said madam am looking for the shop am hungry.then she directed me to the shop.it was 2 carriages away.am glad now the trolley service is back so if you want to buy some snacks or some food you don't need to go looking for the shop.

items.title: Cross country trains filthy
items.review_text: , I am on a train that is part of cross country trains, from Bristol to Torquay left Bristol at 8.12 am. I am absolutely disgusted at how filthy this train is !! The tables are sticky and the seats are disgusting. The whole train is filthy. The toilets are like something from a worksite, the worst I have ever seen. My daughter has eczema on her hands and frightened to touch anything for fear of infection and definitely would not use the toilets. I need to put in an official complaint as I am totally shocked to pay fir a expensive ticket and can not bring myself to use the toilet. Bev Neal

items.title: Profit before customer service
items.review_text: Profit before customer service! Absolutely rubbish service between Birmingham and Nuneaton, not enough carriages for the Saturday demand. I would score this train company a zero, If I could. Come back BR, all Is forgiven!

items.title: Money grabbers AVOID AT ALL COSTS
items.review_text: Money grabbers, terrible unexperienced customer service, overall horrible experience. I feel like we've been robbed. For medical reasons, my partner and I tried to amend our train tickets and there was no availability for the whole month of September and October at any date and time. So tickets aren't refundable and they cannot provide a change of dates, so customers are stuck into being robbed. Spent hours over the phone with customers service being bounced from wed support to customers relations, nobody knows anything. Such a shame!

items.title: Absolutely horrendous experience
items.review_text: Absolutely horrendous experience. I got the 0748 from Glasgow to Sheffield yesterday. The train was dirty, smelled like shte, I couldn't reserve a seat, overcrowded and suffocatingly hot...and all that for £150! Never again.

items.title: Awful company
items.review_text: My train from Birmingham New Street was cancelled. I am trying to get a refund and told I need to contact Trainline! Trainline passed me back to this lot. Awful service. I have used train 3 times in past 3 months and each time cancelled!

items.title: Hi i it was my first time booking a…
items.review_text: Hi i it was my first time booking a train with ur service and my first time ever booking a train journey, firstly the help I was seeking for from the people  in the viz jackets(sorry forgotten the term for it) didn't help because when I asked for help she showed her frustration and so I went around for help especially before boarding the train and coming of, Eventually a polite gentleman saw that I was frustrated and helped me out, on top of that my train was delayed and so i would like a refund for that  aswell please, Could this be sorted out it will be much appreciated Thanks

items.title: Appalling
items.review_text: 3 trains cancelled yesterday to Birmingham New Street due to “staff shortages”. The train to Stanstead on Monday from Birmingham stopped at Leicester and everyone told to get off as there was a signal issue, and the train was cancelled. Found out that the signal issue had been going on since 7am but still people were allowed to board a train when it was known this would happen. Staff are not cooperative and customer service is non-existent. I’ve applied for compensation for both days, so we’ll see what happens. Should be stripped of the franchise. Utterly terrible.

items.title: Staff unhelpful and apparently…
items.review_text: Staff unhelpful and apparently completely disinterested in customer care or customer experience from my experience. What a shame. Poor public transport is a huge oversight.

items.title: Another Cancelled Train
items.review_text: Boiling hot day and return train 16:12 Leicester to Peterborough cancelled. No advice or explanation given  although the guard at the station thought it might have been they had no staff! Why this mob are allowed to run a train service is unbelievable - avoid if possible, you are better off walking.

items.title: Just terrible
items.review_text: Just terrible

items.title: No lumbar support on seats or tilt…
items.review_text: No lumbar support on seats or tilt causing Extreme Discomfort and pain very disappointed, seats are also very low that you cannot get up,  your spine bulges with extreme pain and discomfort, they should be fined for cheap quality seats causing inconvenience pain distress and health problems, will never use the trains again, discomfort seats for Long and short journeys

items.title: Don't travel first class
items.review_text: First class is often full of people paying standard class fares and sometimes nothing at all.  The staff don't bother to check tickets, so it is a waste of time to pay the exorbitant first class fare. If you want to share your first class carriage with abusive, rowdy passengers who have paid nothing, then Cross Country is the way to travel.

items.title: Great service from the team
items.review_text: Ive just boarded the 12.15 from Cheltenham Spa to York. Big shout out for the kind care and attention Sharon the cleaning lady gave to me. She went way and above. Fabulous service Thanks Sharon

items.title: All around terrible
items.review_text:
The trains are always late, cancelled, 
and/or over crowded. 

The carriages stink of some cheap cleaning product that's most likely cancerous, and the carriages themselves are shabby with paint chipped off the walls and dirty seats that look like my nan may have travelled on them when she was my age.

Have traveled around the world on public transport as I do not drive, and this is the worst value I've ever received from a transport company. 

I'm sat on the train as I write this, steadily being engulfed by the rancid smell. Roll on Birmingham New Street.

items.title: Absolute shambles of a train company
items.review_text: Absolute shambles of a train company, I boarded the train at 12.05 due to leave at 12.12 yet at 12.24 we're still sat in the station, there's always issues with this cowboy outfit it's about time they post the contract and a decent mob took over, absolute joke

items.title: Absolutely crap
items.review_text: Absolutely crap.  Please replace this service

items.title: Travelled from Oxford to Manchester…
items.review_text: Travelled from Oxford to Manchester Piccadilly 11/06/22. Absolute diabolical journey. Not enough coaches to match the sales of tickets????.  This Company has no regard for their customers well being whilst travelling on their trains. Firstly, apparently there had been a announcement at Southampton that all reserved seats are now unreserved due to a electronic failure. No regard to customers who are travelling from other stations, and have reserved and now there is no where to sit. Seriously who are they trying to fool. More like they sell as many tickets as they can for greed. Reserved tickets is a pot luck game these days. If anybody is sat in your reserved seat, not a chance are they moving for you when they have paid the same standard price. They also give an option to book a quiet coach. Seriously, are you just having a giggle at us. Luggage areas are also jam packed. People are using these trains from the Airport. Therefore people are having to stand in the aisles with there luggage. No chance of getting to the toilet either. People with disabilities are also experiencing a dreadful journey. I dread to think what would happen in case of an emergency. This is only going to get worse. Absolutely disgusting.

items.title: Less than pleasant staff, early leaving train
items.review_text: Only just caught my train, which was leaving 2 minutes early, and when i pressed the first door that i got to i was yelled at, somethinng i couldnt hear. Realised id gotten onto the (completely empty) first class coach by mistake so went to find my right coach, the woman on the train told me to go back the way i had come (wrong way), seemingly just to remove me from first class. She was not polite about it, i tried to clarify with her yet i was met with rudeness and i ended up in a random seat in the wrong carriage as sent to by her. I’ve worked in many hospitality settings so generally dont complain however no matter how over the shift i am, i dont speak to people like that

items.title: Dirty
items.review_text: Dirty, Late, Overcrowded, Expensive. They put on a four  coach train from Plymouth to Aberdeen on 06/06/2022, which WAS full of students going back to Uni and holiday makers going home. A FOUR COACH TRAIN.

items.title: Thank you to the lady that helped me at…
items.review_text:
Thank you to the lady that helped me at Durham st on the 5/6 I took poorly with my breathing she took me and my friend in to the office put the heating on and gave us a cup of tea then they used a chair to put me on the train to Newcastle 
I was then met by another lady Who phoned for an Ambulance 
That took me to the RVI.
I would just like to say a big thank you to Cross-country 
I’m a lot better now had Pneumonia

items.title: Newer again
items.review_text: Newer again, been scammed for over £142 Internet won't work, dirty seats and toilets pleas accept - 5 stars

items.title: Waste of time
items.review_text:
Haven't  been on a train for a while. 
Now I know why. 
People refusing to get out of your seat that you paid for.
Rubbish not collected. 
Everyone complaining so am not the only one. 
Staff couldn't care less about  the customers waste of time.

items.title: Awful Service and Insulting Response from Customer Service
items.review_text:
Just received a response to a complaint I wrote whilst on a train from Cheltenham to York on April 10th.
Train so overcrowded it was frightening. 
So many people standing in aisles and by doors - with huge suitcases and some poor souls with push chairs -  you couldn’t get to the loo and the buffet trolley obviously couldn’t get up and down the train.
Response: You have the option to get off the train and wait for the next one. 
Really? Is that it?
Then I would have no seat reservation and no guarantee the next train would be any less crowded and I would also be late!
Oh and there’s apparently no legal limit to the number of people allowed to stand on a train.
So we just have to put up and shut up according to XCountry!
In an age when we’re supposed to be encouraging the use of public transport, who in their right mind is going to pay to be transported in this manner and to add insult to injury, be charged a premium rate to travel?
I’m afraid I’m back to the car, albeit very reluctantly.
Cross Country Trains have no regard for their customers comfort or welfare.
I’ll find another way to travel.

items.title: Bad Service, Bad Staff and Daylight Robbery...
items.review_text:
Had a terrible experience with this company early this morning. After a 9 Hour overnight flight to Manchester Airport I caught a Transpennine train into Manchester Piccadilly, using my previously bought open return ticket. That train was fine, but I then boarded a Cross Country train to Stoke. Big mistake. The ticket I had was an off peak one, and my 'crime' was to use it during the "peak hour" time of 8.45. Don't know why this is a "peak hour" since there was only 3 other people in the carriage.
I then encountered one of the most obnoxious members of staff who, after being rude to another passenger told me I had to "upgrade" my ticket, which meant I had to pay him again for the entire single journey, including the first train which was not even provided by Cross Country ! Came away feeling like I was robbed, having paid for the same journey twice, and been treated like a criminal despite having a ticket that would have been fully acceptable just 45 minutes later. It had been seen and accepted by other rail company staff and got me through 3 barriers so why this over-officious cross country worker saw fit to question it once the journey was underway and I had no option but to pay makes me think that Cross Country definitely care more about profit than customer satisfaction.
I have complained officially to Cross Country but am less than optimistic about getting a response.... Do they ever respond to complaints on this site either ?
Bad service and had staff. Avoid where possible.

items.title: The web page does not recognise…
items.review_text: The web page does not recognise nationally known train stations. Really frustrating and waste of time. Better of with other apps as this app is done on the cheap and it shows.

items.title: Jordan is beast

items.title: DO NOT TRAVEL WITH THIS COMPANY

Extremelly uncomfortable sseats, too narrow the room for legs, we are all packed like it cannot be worse, and on top of that, they have issued so many tickets that the corridors and exits are packed with standing people who have probably paid a hell of a lot of money for this trip and are standing there for hours like prisoners!! It is impossible to move from one coach to the other, or even go to toilet!! This is ridiculous and this comlany should be restricted from operating!!! You are useless!

Is it a reward nowadays to be a fare dodger  , cross country?

items.title: Please do better - we are not cattle !
items.review_text:
Bournemouth to Manchester Crosscountry Service
Friday 20th May 2022

I had the unfortunate experience to pick up this service at Basingstoke yesterday (Fri 20th May 2022) at 1247; it formed the second part of a journey from Salisbury to Oxford. 

The train arrived in to Basingstoke on time (good start) but thereafter things went downhill rapidly. The service consisted of the usual far-too-small, 5-carriage Pendolino. And as usual, it arrived in to Basingstoke packed full of passengers, many of which were already standing (no surprise for regular users). Perhaps not a "completely usual" circumstance for this type of Crosscountry service in my experience, but certainly very common, and, in my opinion, far too common and completely unnecessary ! 

Why, oh why, does Crosscountry think that busy routes such as that from Bournemouth to Manchester will be well served by such a small train, especially on a Friday ?  In contrast, at Basingstoke, one can often see the SWT services running from Weymouth to Waterloo that consist of 10 or more carriages.

On this occasion, the inadequate size of the service provided was exacerbated by the fact that one of the 5 carriages (coach F at the rear) was inaccessible because of a door failure. Thus, a predictably-busy service, being served by a train of already inadequate capacity, was being run at only 80% capacity. A pity that this situation could not have been highlighted with an announcement at Basingstoke station or perhaps a sign on the outside of carriage F; the rush for the "empty", but wholly inaccessible, seats at the rear of the incoming service might then have been avoided. Announcing this to passengers once they had managed to squeeze on to the train at Basingstoke, and at subsequent stations, was not particularly useful.

Suffice to say that my journey from Basingstoke to Oxford was uncomfortable and involved standing, although I was under the impression that my ticket had purchased the use of a seat !  Vestibules were full of people standing and the aisles within the carriages were likewise often full. I note that the guard made no appearance to help out with problems involving pre-booked seating and comments about moving from the vestibules in to the carriages to take advantage of the air conditioning were not particularly helpful; there was no room inside many of the carriages and the air conditioning inside my carriage was certainly not turned on. One hot, sweaty little boy in a T-shirt and shorts, seated close to where I was standing, repeatedly asked his mother why it was so hot !

I often wonder why Crosscountry aren't obliged to read the veterinary regulations relating to the transport of cattle?   I am no expert, but I'm sure that conveying cattle in cramped, uncomfortable spaces at high speed is regarded as not being good for their well-being, for their individual, personal safety and does not represent good value for the charge of carriage. One wonders then why Crosscountry would choose to treat their human passengers to journeys that veterinarians would not be legally permitted to have cattle endure !

Returning from Oxford later on a busy Friday evening, I braced myself for a repeat performance from Crosscountry. I was pleasantly surprised to see that the service arriving from the north consisted of two Pendolinos coupled together. This then provided adequate seating capacity down to Basingstoke and presumably beyond, accommodating the predictably-large number of passengers using the service at Oxford, Reading and Basingstoke on a Friday evening. So, it would appear that Crosscountry know what is required to provide a good, basic service; perhaps then we might hope that it can be demonstrated more often, if not all of the time !

items.title: Sunday 17 April '22- Southampton to Stoke overcrowding chaos.
items.review_text: Easter Sunday 17 April 2022. Southampton- Stoke on Trent. Overcrowding due to Euston shutdown. 9 carriage train cut 4 carriage. Complaint with photos sent 17 April 2022. Cross Country complaint reference created 20 April. 20 May still no progress. Avoid this company. Southampton to North West is best via London always. South West and Avanti West are ok; Cross Country is dreadful. Zero star rating.

items.title: Good god can it get any worse
items.review_text:
Good god can it get any worse. Honestly, can this company actually run a train on time?
I sadly have to catch the "delayed" (insert any time) train five days a week and it's late easily 80% of the time. Truly an embarrassment as a rail provider.

items.title: Disappointing Experience
items.review_text:
I travelled from Nuneaton to Cambridge this week on Crosscountry (Birmingham to Stansted Service). I had prebooked seats but there was no indication to other travellers that the seats were reserved and I was not able to sit in them. The train was much too small for the number of passengers and there was no food available. The seats were very cramped and uncomfortable, and the space for luggage was quite inadequate, especially as some of the other passengers were using it as an airport service.
I do not often travel by train and I had been looking forward to this as an alternative to driving. I am no longer sure that I want to repeat the experience if it involves a Crosscountry train and I may revert to the car in future.

items.title: Train Sheffield to Edinburgh
items.review_text:
Train Sheffield to Edinburgh. 1st class no catering. No announcement or explanation. Given preprinted card by attendant Apologising for catering and contact for “small gesture of goodwill.” 
Journey from Edinburgh had to reuse their reusable cup. They had no more. 
Spicy sanwoches and bacon roll. Told they had got rid of 90 catering staff. 
Horrible experience. Never again Cross Country

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text: No room for luggage which was blocking aisle. This train goes to Southampton where people go to cruise so have large luggage. Where is it supposed to go? Could not hear any of the announcements. Too hot. Seats uncomfortable. All in all a very unpleasant experience

items.title: On a train on the 11th May 2022

items.title: Train 10.53 from Liskeard to Cheltenham…
items.review_text: Train 10.53 from Liskeard to Cheltenham first class on the 6/5/22.first class   Staff friendly and actually managed to get bacon roll and drinks  so giving 3 stars this time.
