items.title: Unbelievably bad service
items.review_text: Unbelievably bad service. After boarding (at Birmingham) the train, they announced that this train will only go halfway (Leicester) and not to its destination (Stansted). No problems reported on Trainline as also announced that Futher journey may be possible after reaching Leicester. There are so many bad reviews, it seems that senior management is not accountable. Give bad reputation to the country. Just think about tourists, how inconvenient it must be for them.

items.title: Incredibly poor seat reservation service
items.review_text:
At the time of booking three costly tickets from Newcastle to Birmingham far in advance there was no option to make seat reservations. I have just spent 25 minutes on the phone organising seats for the outward journey, and have been told I still cannot reserve seats for the return journey. 

Cross Country, you need to look at LNER - I travel regularly with them and their booking service is far superior - you can easily and reliably reserve seats at the time of booking. 

A big raspberry to Cross Country Trains. I think I’ll drive next time…

items.title: Rubbish train operator
items.review_text:
Rubbish train operator. On the 5th of may 2022 some silly stupid woman and a man got on the train and didn't have a clue between them where to sit, get a seat booked next time and yes you can. 

People sitting on seat's and taking up space where people have to get down the aisle to their booked seat. Other people who have not bothered to book a seat couldn't even be bothered to move and a elderly man had to sit elsewhere. No respect from some silly cow of a woman towards a elderly man. 

The seat's are too cramped and you don't have enough room for anything. Luggage racks are always full even with small bags when they could be put up above the seats where the people could get to them easier. Cross country is not that good of a service and it's a shabby service it needs updating and new trains should be bought they are out of date. You sometimes don't even see any staff who should be there. No one even checked the tickets today which was rather strange.

Cross country more like crap country.

items.title: Huge Variety of Service Offered by Weekend Upgrade to First Class
items.review_text:
I travelled from Stockport to Bournemouth on Good Friday, and back again on Saturday April 30th. I paid for a Weekend Upgrade on both legs of my journey. 

On the way to Bournemouth I was treated like a king, and was given free sandwiches, coffee, crisps and soft drinks. On the return journey I was treated like a peasant: 

The service was jam packed. Quite a few people were standing in my first class carriage - and the rest of the train was packed like sardines. It was impossible to move through the train to where the buffet carriage was, so I politely asked Cross Country's member of staff in Coach A if a sandwich could be brought to me the next time the train stopped? She told that this was not possible, which meant that the only way I could get any food on the train was for me to rush to the carriage with the buffet trolley at the next stop, buy my food, wait until the train stopped again and race back to my first class carriage. I was also told that I would have to pay for my food. 

I have given a 2 star review because of the good service offered on the outward leg of my journey. Clearly my rating would be 1 Star if I based it solely on the return leg of my trip. 

I fully appreciate that some services are quiet and others are extremely busy, and know that this affects the traveling experience. But Cross Country trains should be aware that some of their staff are downright rude, and put those that are on a customer care course.

items.title: We are seasoned travellers by train
items.review_text: We are seasoned travellers by train, and wanted to try and see on a two hour journey. We loved the rate of travel and the ride is very smooth. In the future we will travel from Plymouth to Edinburgh.

items.title: Don't waste money on poor First Class
items.review_text: First Class not worth extra money.  Travelled from Newcastle to Plymouth. Although the food trolley whizzed through coach A on numerous occasions without stopping,  it was Sheffield before I asked if we were going to be offered food!  Although I was told I only had to ask this should not be the case.  The staff were more attentive after changeover further down the track however Coach A seemed to be used as a general staff room with noisy conversations throughout.  Not a First Class experience.

items.title: Terrible - they just don’t care
items.review_text:
Appallingly bad service. They obviously overbook trains on a regular basis. It seems that it’s all about cutting costs at the expense of the passenger. 

I recently used them for the first time in a few years and absolutely nothing had changed. Outward and return trains were both rammed, with people standing and apologies for “overcrowding”. You invariably have to fight your way to your seat. This is the norm. In what way is that acceptable?

Next time I’ll go by coach.

items.title: Absolutely shocking service
items.review_text: Been on a cross country train to Birmingham from York 4 times now and not once have I arrived on time, the one time I decided to get off at an earlier stop and take a different train to near my destination the train was so late I missed the connection that had a 25 minute changeover time. The staff member were also the most unfriendly people you'll ever have the displeasure of meeting with them being directly rude to me for spending 5 seconds to get my ticket out of my wallet.

items.title: 80% 1 star reviews and you’re still…
items.review_text: 80% 1 star reviews and you’re still allowed to run a business? Wow. Train turns up on the middle of the day on a quiet Friday, tiny train, 3 carriages for a rammed platform full of people. Full and standing from the start, can’t even get a seat - or if you do someone comes along and says you’re in their seat despite not one single seat reservation ticket placed on the seats to show passengers which seats are or are not available, lucky you morons have a monopoly on this line or you’d be out of business next week - enjoy your fat bonuses at the end of the year despite failing every aspect of what you’re meant to deliver on 👏

items.title: Not a single smooth journey
items.review_text: I don't think I've had a single smooth journey for the past two years with Cross Country. In the rare case the train isn't rammed to the point of bursting (half the passengers stuck sitting in the hallways), the journey is usually cancelled due to train faults or bad planning. Though on-board staff are usually friendly, the general attitude from the train company about these occurrences is "I guess this is your problem now" with no refunds or offers of compensation despite the relentless inconvenience they cause. Writing this while stranded at Exeter St David's en route to Sheffield after having had to drive backwards back to the station because of a train engine failure. Staff advised us to take a train to Bristol and change there, but this was so full (after also suffering a delay of 73 minutes) that we couldn't get on.

items.title: I regularly travel between Devon and…
items.review_text: I regularly travel between Devon and Birmingham on cross country usual fare is expensive enough £104 but tried to book a ticket today for tomorrow - £248 - this is an outrageous fare, the trains are never particularly clean and I’m lucky if I see the food and drink trolley on the 2 1/2 hour journey. I cancelled my meeting due to the cost of the fare. How does this support encouraging people to use the train - Cross Country you should be ashamed of this blatant rip off. I travelled on GWR from Bodmin to London Paddington 2 weeks ago this fare was under £100, longer journey, substantially better train and I actually managed to get a drink how can there be such disparity between rail providers!

items.title: I regularly travel with Cross Country…
items.review_text:
I regularly travel with Cross Country from Birmingham to York or Newcastle - the trains are always packed full, short formed, the staff aren’t present because of his busy it is.

Often you can’t get down to the buffet to but food because of how busy it is, they’re missing out on revenue massively because of this, and the fact they can’t send trolleys down. Toilets are usually pretty grim as well. 

This is a long distance route and it functions like a commuter service, very poor, combined with massively increased prices it’s just not worth using them. Might as well drive.

items.title: Worst Journey Ever
items.review_text: Never again. Only just got on the Plymouth to Edinburgh train at Sheffield on Saturday 19th March. I had a reserved seat that I was unable to get to as the all the aisles and vestibules were packed with luggage and passengers. Four carriages for a Saturday afternoon train! I had to spend a very claustrophobic journey by a very smelly toilet with most passengers not wearing masks. Covid safe company no chance !

items.title: What a terrible service
items.review_text: What a terrible service, they changed the train service to a bus service, which caused me to be delayed to get to the airport for my flight, had to get a taxi instead which cost me around a 100 pounds, what a terrible company clearly they don’t care about customers, no notification of change of service, as agreed to me by a member of staff at trainline, will never be using services with cross country trains ever again.

items.title: ZERO RATING  FOR £200 TICKET, NO SEAT
items.review_text: ZERO RATING  On Monday 14th March the 9.56 train from Sheffield to Plymouth, journey price **£200**.  There was standing room only for SIX HOURS for that journey and people still piled on at Birmingham.  THREE more carriages were needed.  They want to take our money but won't provide seats.

items.title: First class is a joke
items.review_text:
First class is a joke, uncomfortable seats with little leg room if you are facing a stranger (which you probably will be). Got shouted at by conductor for sitting in the wrong seat because someone was sitting in mine and I didn’t want to evict them.
Definitely not worth the extra money.

items.title: Exemplars of poor service
items.review_text: Exemplars of poor service. Boarded the 0851 from Totnes to Newcastle, travelling to Exeter. Next stop Newton Abbot where they decided to first announce the train was terminating. Thanks Cross Country for your consistently outstandingly poor service and for making me late for work this morning. You can only imagine how gratifying it is to know I pay tax to help deliver this sub standard sh and to enrich your shares and executive pay packets

items.title: Farcical and inexplicable business practices
items.review_text:
I travel regularly with XC and it's getting increasingly difficult to not only buy first class tickets but it's also virtually impossible to reserve seats in trains that I absolutely know are running practically empty. 
Since covid started, my advance ticket prices have more than trebled. These fares are unregulated. Therefore they can be increased without any limitations or restrictions.
I usually book around 4 weeks in advance, by which time all journeys and train times are confirmed. More often than not there are zero tickets available to buy in advance. The last time a traveled i did manage to buy advance tickets.
When I traveled a few weeks ago I checked a day before if any advance tickets were available only to be told there were none. When this train arrived the first class had 3 other passengers. When I got off there were zero passengers in my 1st class carriage. But there arent any seats available are there!!
This is just one example of the bizarre business practices at XC.
What is going on with them? Why are they telling passengers there are no seats available when the reality is that there are plenty of seats available. Why can't I book advance fares on trains in virtually empty 1st class carriages?
Please don't believe XC assertions that they have a shortage of rolling stock for at present XC are refusing to run their fleet of HST(class 254) trains.These trains are currently rotting away in sidings. I have seen some of them at Neville Hill Leeds depot. At least 8 diagrams have been withdrawn for no reason. XC have replaced 7 carriage HST with 4 carriage Voyagers, thus reducing availability of seats etc. In 1st class there has been a reduction of around 66% of seats. On occasion they do operate the odd HST service. I check this on realtimetrains. Why are these trains rotting in sidings when they are clearly fully operational.
It has become a total nightmare to book tickets with XC. Please don't let them blame covid for this as its just not true.
XC are telling passengers there are zero seats available when there are plenty of empty seats in reality.
They appear to be going out of their way to stop people traveling. And its working.
I cannot begin to fathom their logic and peculiar business practices.
Every other operator has resumed a full timetable apart from XC. Their hourly Newcastle to Reading Service(via Doncaster) has been discontinued. Only 2 trains per day now run from Newcastle to Birmingham via Doncaster instead of 1 train every hour. Oh yes theres no rolling stock. None apart from those rotting in sidings.
I am traveling today, but not on my chosen service as zero advance seats were once again available. That means the service is either sold out or they dont want passengers traveling. My chosen return service has had zero seats available every time I have traveled since November 2021
Cross country are an absolute disgrace. They seem to be going out of their way in stopping people from traveling. 
Thats the one thing they are very good at.
In the absence of a proper independent government ombudsman, XC can get away with all of this with complete impunity. 
Its time something was done about them!!

items.title: why not put more carriages on the train?
items.review_text: Appalling. not enough carriages. people squashed in everywhere and they continued to let more people on. people squashed into each other through all the gangways and in vestibules. only 4 carriages for what was clearly a busy train. Especially disgusting as covid is still circulating.

items.title: Passenger assistance review
items.review_text:
We have just used your passenger assistance for my elderly mother who has today travelled up from Taunton to melton mowbray. 
We would like to thank all of the customer relation team (chris) who initially helped us over the phone organise the arrangements. The station staff, either on the train or on the platform, in particularly the passenger assistance associate who assisted us at Birmingham New Street who was incredibly patient polite and helpful.
From the beginning of the journey to the end destination, all of the staff have been so helpful ensuring our transfer, seating and time with cross country trains was a pleasant experience. 
Thank you once again

items.title: Packed trains
items.review_text:
Packed trains. Stoke to Manchester.
Appalling service.

items.title: Not happy with service
items.review_text: Not happy with service. Shop was for 1st class only and wouldn't serve me. And no trolly was walked threw.

items.title: Absolutely the worst trains and crew…
items.review_text: Absolutely the worst trains and crew there is... Cancellation of the trains is probably what drives this joke company.....disgraceful.......

items.title: I decided to use the train
items.review_text:
I decided to use the train, notably Avanti...what a massive blunder that was. Potential massive delay because of broken trains, broken promises, shattered dreams etc...but in steps Cross Country. All the guys on the train have been magnificent. 
I am travelling from Inverness to Birmingham. 
Scotrail...thumbs up, Cross country...double thumbs up, Avanti..quadruple thumbs down. Up your game Avanti.. And big respecks to Cross Country...innit. Love from a delighted passenger aged 53 and 3/4

items.title: Onboard Catering Making a Difference
items.review_text: Today early 7:00 departure from Darby to Reading made my morning as the onboard catering team really brought so much energy, humor and such a positive sprit to otherwise very sleepy morning. The people could really make a huge difference and I a would like to make a huge show out to the crew today! Thank you Cross-country for such a nice start of the day!

items.title: As a treat went 1st class
items.review_text: As a treat went 1st class, paid plenty extra for the pleasure but it couldn’t have been further away from first class if it tried. One sandwich and a bottle of water between Nottingham and Exeter. If you want a first class train service try LNER.

items.title: 3 hours on a Cross Country train that…
items.review_text: 3 hours on a Cross Country train that absolutely stank of raw sewage, revolting and stomach churning. I googled this and it is a common problem for many years, surely there must be something they can do! Horrible.

items.title: Why do they put a lot of useless…
items.review_text: Why do they put a lot of useless information on the electronic boards I.e. “no smoking” but no information about the destinations of the train etc. also, announcements can be too quiet.

items.title: Slow train
items.review_text:
I took the train from Stansted to Peterborough and it was very slow. 

The seats were scruffy.

The lady who came to serve drinks was friendly and polite.

The train was on time.

items.title: I had a very good experience travelling…
items.review_text:
I had a very good experience travelling from Stansted Airport to Peterborough yesterday.
Train fully cleaned before setting off so very covid aware. Driver very friendly and polite. 
Train left and arrived in time.
All together was a pleasant end to my journey from France.

items.title: I had an awful experience travelling…
items.review_text: I had an awful experience travelling from Sheffield to Leeds today. The train was massively overcrowded and I was stuck near the door with lots of standing passengers. It wasn't a cheap ticket and there was no apology from the train staff. No wonder German state railways (Arriva trains) like running trains in the UK when they are ripping off the public in this way.

items.title: Catastrophic prices for very unpleasant journeys.
items.review_text:
I rarely travel by train and the last journey I had certainly reassured me why. I have never seen so many people crammed onto one train, people not being able to get off and missing stops because they couldn’t get past. People sat on the floor in the isles - absolutely catastrophic. How on earth can they justify the prices for one journey when this is the way in which we have to travel during a 4 hour journey. 

Something really needs to be done to improve this service.

items.title: Appalling Customer Service
items.review_text: Had to cancel trip to Oxford due to Covid positive test. Emailed proof and assured a refund by Jawad (who was very helpful and professional). Refund didn't come so I chased it up, only to be told I couldn't have one by Manager (who wasn't helpful or professional). Haven't named him but you know who you are. Have had to accept travel vouchers but it's unprofessional to be told different things by different people, and reflects poor management and training. Had I known they would have gone back on their word I could have given the tickets to someone else so they didn't go to waste but too late once the travel date has passed.  Thoroughly bad service and I won't risk booking with them again.

user_profile.name: Dr David Oram and Ashleigh Adams

items.title: itinerary for 7th dec
items.review_text: itinerary for 7th dec. train 10 -26am newton abbot to swindon  cancelled.Sat 4th Dec. 10-06 train cancelled advived to catch 9-54 am cancelled coach to Exeter st.Davids .sat on Newcastle train for ages driver shortage being taxied from Plymouth to cut along story short had  to be at a 90th birthday party at 3pm arrived in farrigdon at 5-30pm.Let the train train take the strain!!!!

items.title: Always not a good experience when it…

Always not a good experience when it only 2 carriages it such busy do with better drivers they don't wave

items.title: Absolutely shocking
items.review_text: Absolutely shocking. Always overcrowded and overpriced.

items.title: garbage
items.review_text: garbage. trains always full, too expensive by far, late and unreliable. terrible company. have probably had to sit on the floor 9 out of 10 times i’ve been on their trains

items.title: Greedy company
items.review_text: Asked compensation for a cancelled service. resulting in a 2h delay. Did not received compensation that I was entitled to. Greedy company. Not listening to passengers. Slow in responding as well.

items.title: I had an awful experience with…
items.review_text: I had an awful experience with CrossCountry trains coming from London to Peterborough. When I went to get my training to March I found the all the trains have been cancelled without any warning or any notice or announcement. I emailed cross-country immediately when I got home after taking a taxi from Peterborough which cost me £64. Surprise surprise I'm still waiting for somebody to contact me. I was told by more than one person that the drivers did not want to work. Maybe they need to let somebody else take their £50,000 plus a year job!!

items.title: Trains are always overcrowded
items.review_text: Trains are always overcrowded, dirty and seriously lagging behind GWR for comfort and service

items.title: 11.44 from York to Birmingham…
items.review_text: 11.44 from York to Birmingham 04/12/2021 poor very poor service 4 carriages over booked over crowded then have to change trains at Derby because faulty train, staff gave a free for all on seats so for all those passengers that paid for a reserve seat where basically told tough, poor customer service, staff couldn't give a damn sub standard

items.title: Worst train journeys I have ever experienced
items.review_text:
Worst train journeys I have ever experience between Torquay and Wakefield last Saturday and today (4/12/2021)
Certainly not COVID safe. Train only 4 carriages and  packed on both journeys could not walk down aisles. Today 40mins trapped in small space between exit doors for approx 40mins. with 12 other people, one passenger was unwell her husband was holding on to her, he was sweating and getting redder and redder in the face I was worried he would have an heart attack.
We were so tightly packed I couldn’t even move my arms! I could go on and on about not be able to get refreshments, not being able to use toilets as people travelling in them, not easy on a 5hour journey people sat in luggage racks and bike storage. I did not think something like this could happen especially with COVID restrictions 
We had booked seats but could not get to them for first part of journey when we did we found they had been double booked.
We are an elderly couple, we did not see any staff.
I would like to say a thank you to the young person  who gave up a seat for me.
If we have not contracted COVID it will be a miracle.

items.title: Amazing Customer Service
items.review_text: I have been on the phone with one of the most efficient customer service agents I have ever come across. His name is Abhinav. He is professional, kind, understanding, and knows his job inside and out. We had to deal with a lot of tickets, so it took a while, but it was actually a really nice experience, I mean, who can say that about phoning a call centre 😂😂 keep up the good work Abhinav, if there is a promotion coming up, you definitely deserve it!!

items.title: Liars
items.review_text:
Liars. THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE IN THE WORLD.
Cancelled the 6.48 train I have been getting for the past 5 years. Sold me my renewal season ticket but did not advise the service was cancelled. 
When I called up to complain. Was lied to by customer services. Said it was down to Industrial action by the train drivers. Poor drivers given a bad name by Head office.  Apparently found out from a Guard this morning . HQ knew there this was a issue with drivers shortages back in March.

items.title: Missed connection and hardly any refund
items.review_text: Missed a connection at Bristol and no help from onboard crew! I complained online and was led to believe I was getting a full refund except now I am not going to after waiting for 5 months and i’m hardly getting anything back. It was their fault I missed my train and they refused my taxi refund. Disgusting Customer service. Think I’ll fly to Cornwall than take the train.

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text: Trains dirty, smelly, and always packed. Shocked by the level of service.

items.title: What a joke of an organisation
items.review_text: What a joke of an organisation, went to Birmingham, booked seats, train was full including our seats, corridors and walkway full, we ended up standing, fair enough other trains had been cancelled, so it was busy. So return journey was the same absolutely rammed, so we sat in 1st class cos it was empty, we had a fallout with the conductor, she was adamant we needed to pay £10 extra just to sit down in 1st class, how can a company sell seats on a train that don't exist, it's fraud????????????????? Clowns

items.title: Passengers packed onto the train like sardines
items.review_text: My husband and I travelled on Saturday the 20.11.21 from Leicester to Birmingham. The train had far too many passengers on it. Not enough carriages were added to this known popular route which resulted that the passengers were squeezed onto the train like sardines. Hardly anyone was wearing a face mask. No wonder Covid infections are on the rise. The safety of the passengers were knowingly ignored.

items.title: Still owe me money. Radio silence.
items.review_text:
Customer service is absolutely terrible. They STILL owe me money from September.
Bought a ticket from Brighton to Crawley through their app, their app malfunctioned, charged my account and then gave me no ticket leaving me to have to buy a physical ticket anyway.
Messaged them on Facebook, had a whole conversation only to be told I had to call up another team. I did, she told me I’d be refunded within a few days. Never was (surprise surprise), then messaged again on FB saying I was still waiting (gave them a good two weeks just in case), the case was then raised with another team over email, they got back to me finally after a couple of weeks, said they’d processed the refund after a lot of needless interaction. I think “great!” At least the 46 hours I spent communicating with this company wasn’t all for nothing. I then checked my bank to see the refund, turns out they’ve only refunded me £3.10 (wow) of the £11.40 they owe me (the amount I’d recounted countless times on the phone and over email). Still waiting for this money after having emailed them about 10 times. 
Shameful. Maybe I should invoice them for the amount of time I’ve wasted trying to contact their measly company. 
Do your self a favour and don’t bother with this one.

items.title: Wow amazing service by lady in booking…
items.review_text: Wow amazing service by lady in booking and Emma in Customer Relations. We had booked for my parents to travel to see us and I had to do this by phone as never booked train before and needed travel assistance for mum and the lady who helped me book was fantastic (so sorry I did not get your name) but due to illness and covid risk my mum was unable to travel so I called again and spoke to Emma. Emma was so helpful and understanding and advised me what to do and within a few days of returning tickets I had a letter back with vouchers. Thank you so much Cross Country admin service for all your help.

items.title: The cost to get me to Birmingham New…
items.review_text: The cost to get me to Birmingham New Street from Hinckley (my nearest Station) is 3 times the price on Cross Country compared to what it would cost on West Midlands going to the same station from Coventry - very nearly the same distance.  Looking at Trainline its £16.20 vs £4.  Its the difference between me deciding to go to an event or not - ridiculous and I can't understand how they can be allowed such a hike.

items.title: Having not used the train for sowhy can't you give zero starsme…
items.review_text: Having not used the train for some years because of over crowding (not to mention corvus) it's good to see that the same poor quality of travel is being maintained

items.title: No social distancing especially during…
items.review_text: No social distancing especially during covid times standing room only thats 2 trains now I’ve used cross country and both are rammed

items.title: Comfortable & great food
items.review_text: Comfortable seats in 1st class. Lovely to be on an HST instead of a Voyager. Carriage decor was superb. Meals were delicious. We had chilli and vegetable curry options.

items.title: birmingham to gloucester
items.review_text: was a bit stressed out when i got to birmingham new street this evening as my train to hereford was too late for me so had to get the plymouth service to gloucester to change over onto another service. such a nice conductor on this train this evening about 1812 we departed, he helped me with the times and my ticket, and said anything i needed just ask him. was so relaxed after that so 5 star.

items.title: No seats, no masks and a long way to go…
items.review_text: Rammed train no standing space left - hands up who has Covid? Seats double booked, nearly everyone at wits end. Don’t use if you can avoid. Notoriously short on carriages, covid breeding ground how can you possibly go to/from Scotland to  Plymouth standing?

items.title: Train on time but no seats available…
items.review_text:
Train on time but no seats available despite having been allocated one. The carriage is packed yet about a third, mainly younger adults are not wearing masks. I have tried to upgrade to 1st class, no chance.
Deplorable service

items.title: BEWARE
items.review_text: BEWARE! COVID HOTSPOT. People coughing, train rammed. A disgrace!!!!!!!

items.title: The worst customer service on the UK trains
items.review_text:
I would rate it negative number of stars if possible. This company is a complete chaotic mess about customer relationship. Customer service gave us incorrect information about table seats availability in one leg of our trip, and on another we arrived on the coach and or seats are occupied and the employees just say they can not do anything about it. So we have to walk up and down to look for available seats to try to keep the family close each other.
And that is NOT first time it happened. It really seems that the company still working using only hand written notes instead of computers.

items.title: Appalling conditions, uncaring dismissive response to complaint.
items.review_text:
If I could leave no stars I would! We paid in advance for reserved seats on an almost 3 hr journey from Birmingham to Exeter. Forced to stand all the way in dangerously and severely overcrowded conditions, hardly able to even move. With a pandemic still raging  passengers were absolutely rammed in including into the toilet so no one was able to use these either. No air, no one able to wear a mask as it was completely stifling. They could at least have got some water to us! I have asthma, much worsened by the conditions and felt panicky. My friend, pinned against the train wall all the way,  suffered an angina attack and was very unwell on finally getting off this utter nightmare of a journey. 
Their response to my reporting this had caused potentially serious and life threatening illness, 3 weeks after emailing a complaint, was to say sorry about the 'uncomfortable' journey and I may be eligible for a small reduction off another rail journey.
I'm totally disgusted.

items.title: Rubbish service
items.review_text: Rubbish service

items.title: Don’t buy a first class ticket and…
items.review_text: Don’t buy a first class ticket and expect any food even when they have just stocked up because it’s complimentary and not guaranteed as part of the ticket apparently it’s the experience you pay for and if you raise a complaint to ask why you weren’t offered any food despite requesting a sandwich customer services aren’t even prepared to refund the difference in the cost of 1st class and a normal ticket so all the advertising regarding food is not true as terms and conditions apply the fact you can’t find them anywhere is irrelevant

items.title: Dirty tables and poor service
items.review_text: Train from Cheltenham to Birmingham. Dirty tables and rubbish not cleared. Trolly lady lacked customer service skills. No please or thank you. No mask either!

items.title: I am writing this as i'm so frustrated
items.review_text: I am writing this as i'm so frustrated. The website will take my money no problem but if i try to request a refund or change journey times the website doesn't work and when i chat to someone on messenger they just say to e-mail customer services. Which doesn't work.

items.title: Sorted
items.review_text:
I booked to go to Leicester then realised I needed an open return, I spoke to customer services via the messenger app and was sorted out within 15 minutes, and the money I paid for the original tickets I'd booked was refunded into my account within 5 days.
The journey itself was a pleasant experience with no delays on the inbound or outbound journey. 
I looking forward to travelling with Cross Country Trains again in the very near future.

items.title: Absolutely disgusting trains
items.review_text: Absolutely disgusting trains - cold, old and miserable which at the top of that are extremely expensive! This is what my direct personal experience shows!

items.title: Many years going north and south…
items.review_text: Many years going north and south through Leeds and service gets worse not better, overcrowded dirty trains. Absolute no care for customers

items.title: An absolute joke
items.review_text: Firstly, we Booked Forward Facing Window Seats And Got rearward facing isle seats. Secondly our seats had people sitting in them as there was no indication the seats were ours other than our tickets. Then there was uncomfortable seats in the hot and stuffy carriage. In the end, we booked more tickets with Southwestern Railway Because we couldn't bare it for the return journey.

items.title: Birmingham to Manchester first class not so funny joke.
items.review_text:
Birmingham to Manchester first class.Not worth one star. Seat booking a joke.Only soft drinks and small snacks although they are happy to charge  10 pounds for drinks.
Virgin always gave a very good service.First class lounges closed.
I will definitely be travelling by car in future.

items.title: Utter Chaos
items.review_text: booked seats in advance for trip to Edinburgh.  Train was crammed both ways so didn't feel comfortable at all. Face masks were not being worn by lots of passengers and on a table seat felt very unsafe as other two passengers did not wear face coverings.  Train staff did not police it even though message throughout journeys said masks must be worn unless exempt. Train back was very disorganised, it arrived on time but the coach numbers were changed while we waited to get on board so there was a mad dash to go to the altered coaches to take up our reserved seats. Such a mix up as people were getting in the wrong coaches and trying to take the seats we were rightly sitting on.  Won't be in a hurry to travel on cross country trains again any time soon. Staff should be telling people to wear face masks at all times. When staff were walking through the carriages taking orders wearing their masks, they should have been reminding passengers to do the same.

items.title: Utterly miserable
items.review_text: Utterly miserable - always overbooked, minimal staff, the intercarriage doors always close on you as you’re trying to get through them, they’re usually late and you have to pay through the nose for the privilege. It’s been like this for as long as I can remember and the company has displayed an almost arrogant unwillingness to improve. Woe betide you if you have to take one of their services, which considering they have several busy train routes monopolised under this country’s pitiful railway system, is all but a certainty. Just awful. Look at GWR at take notes, Cross Country, and either improve your services or cede them (and your staff) to a train company who actually care about delivering them well.

items.title: First Class travel a farce!!
items.review_text: Apparently first class travel does not include refreshments - they are only offered if available - 3.30 hours without anything, grubby seats and not much extra legroom - train was so crowded had to climb over people and suitcases to get to the buffet car to be told I had to pay for anything other than tea/coffee or hot chocolate - would have to pay for water !!! No biscuits available either. Oh and toilet out of order.  Well done Cross Country Trains - disgraceful, what must visitors from Europe think. Shame on you! Will think twice about travelling with you again, just disappointed I have a return ticket !

items.title: Filthy disgusting train
items.review_text: Filthy disgusting train. Newcastle to Leeds. Toilets were not cleaned. We were in first class and it was filthy. No offer of refreshments Conductor and staff very rude. Stay with LNER

items.title: Sardine train
items.review_text: Reserved seats on the 9.11am  Leeds to Newton abbot on Monday 9th August, 1 adult and 2 children, the train was running late got on the train no signs on reserved seats, our seats were not next to each other and 1 was in another carriage, as the journey progressed the train got fuller and fuller it came over the speaker, We are rather busy today the train is 7 carriages long with over 500 seats, people were packed into gangways and doorways, the same thing happened on the way back on Monday 16th Aug the 1.06pm Newton abbot to Leeds, gangways full, doorways full, reserved seats not labelled people refusing to move for reserved seats, no chance of social distance and many without a mask, some passengers departed the train well before their designated stop to wait for the next train as the train was so dangerously full and no air circulating a COVID VIRUS HOTSPOT

items.title: The train was in a disgusting state…
items.review_text: The train was in a disgusting state with rubbish all over floors, seats and tables. There had clearly been no effort to keep it clean and tidy during the journey.

items.title: Absolutely horrible experience
items.review_text: Absolutely horrible experience. Me and my family had reserved tickets on the train from Birmingham new street to Newton Abbot. We couldn't get in our reserved seats. The reserved seats were scattered all over the train. The train was really packed and we at to spend most of our journey sat on the floor or standing in the wheelchair area of the train. I did not see one conductor for the whole journey checking tickets. What made matters worse was that the return journey was just as bad. I brought my train tickets 6 weeks in advance and spent alot of money on them. If they knew how busy the train was going be they should have put more coaches on. I would put 0 stars or even minus stars if I could. Really poor

items.title: Should be fined
items.review_text: Social distancing? Not a chance. Seat reservations? They didn’t even both putting reservation tickets in the seats, making reservations useless.

items.title: No appropriate food on the train.
items.review_text:
No appropriate food on the train.
Travelled in first from alnmouth to Birmingham with 2 grandchildren aged 12 and 10. When lunch time came round the only food on the train was a slice of cake or a packet of crisps. This being mid week and August, there is no excuse for this situation, and the kids were famished. 
On making a formal complaint the response is that “due to COVID…..”
This despite the shops such as M&S being full of sandwiches which I would have bought had any warning being given.
Basically they don’t give a damn. And don’t intend to do anything about it as they are too idle and have a captive clientele who cannot go any other way. Is this different from the old British Rail I wonder? Except for the extortionate ticket prices I don’t think so.

items.title: I would have given 0 star such bad…
items.review_text: I would have given 0 star such bad service extremely dirty train even seats and staff is not that polite

items.title: Seat Reservation
items.review_text:
Purchased a ticket which came with a seat reservation, on the day of travel, Travelled from Redruth to Chesterfield where I was able to reach my seat, but as the train was travelling up the service got busy. But to busy, the train was full and standing with people sitting on the floor in the middle of the train, can't walk through to go to the toilet or to go and get some refreshments, like Cross Country & other operators, you pay your money and instead you get and overfilled train with people who haven't got a seat reservation making everybody's life not very pleasant. Was looking at hiring a car while browsing and maybe in future I be hiring a car or flying more than using train services.
Also with the current Pandemic, I thought Seat Reservations are mandatory on Cross Country with little seat reservations on the day. well it seems that isn't the case.

items.title: Uncompassionate staff who ruined…
items.review_text: Uncompassionate staff who ruined birthday and anniversary weekend. Company use the #bekind perhaps they need to do the same.

items.title: Worst train company in the country in…
items.review_text: Worst train company in the country in my experience. Cancel trains 2 days before they are meant to go and then try to weasel out of giving you a refund.

items.title: The ac is always on
items.review_text: The ac is always on, it's cold and mess on the floor all around. For the price is awful. Do something.

items.title: 3h delay but they brush off responsibility for compensation
items.review_text: Unfortunately our initial train was cancelled and we were advised to board a CrossCountry train. This happened in the May bank holiday. If I knew the result of this experience I would have taken a later train! So we were stopped at a station called march, close to Peterborough, because a train further down the line broke down. We were sat there for some 3h waiting for the line to be cleared. Needless to say when we finally moved on we had missed all of the remaining connecting trains and eventually to get to our destination we had to take a taxi. Very unpleasant, but it happens. Following this, we contacted the company, sending all of the information and our tickets for a refund. It has been 2 months and all we hear from them are lame excuses saying that it's not their responsibility because our original train had been cancelled, and that they are putting us into contact with the other company but the email they give us does not work and so far we haven't heard from the other company. Basically they are trying to avoid paying a £40 compensation. Avoid.

items.title: Nothing first class about this experience for my 83 year old mum
items.review_text:
Nothing first class about this company.

My 83 year old mother travelled with Cross Country trains from Aberdeen to Chesterfield last Sunday.  We had paid for her to travel first class, on a weekend service with no changes to ensure that she had as stress free and comfortable a journey as possible.

She travelled 7 hours, and was only offered a cup of tea and a packet of crisps to eat.  There was no food available on the train.  Toilets were described by her as 'unsavoury'.  She came off the train absolutely ravenous and upset by the whole experience.  I wonder, what did we pay the extra for??

To make matters worse, speaking to the customer care team was awful.  Clearly Kelly had been trained to give the corporate response, that the service was 'as advertised'.  If it was advertised, it certainly wasn't easy for me to find, as I had looked prior to travel.  there was no apology, no recognition of the discomfort and distress experienced by my elderly mother.  I asked if she would have been happy for this to be the experience of her own mother and she declined to answer.  I asked her to give me a human rather than corporate response and she would not.  I did not feel heard.

The money is one thing, I have no idea how the company can justify the expense of the ticket operating as it was on a minimal service, but the customer care was the thing that took the biscuit.  I was left feeling that the company couldn't care less, and that nothing would be taken from my complaint.
  I will await the corporate response, and if it arrives, as I expect it will, will be going straight to the railway ombudsman.

items.title: Unspeakably bad.
items.review_text: We have several times travelled on Crosscountry from the Southwest to Derby and the experience has almost always been dreadful.  Generally the staff are friendly and try to be helpful but the poor facilities, crowding and condition of the carriages are bad.  On a recent journey we decided to 'treat' ourselves to a first class fare, thinking that maybe the crowding would be less and we would get some decent refreshments - as would be the case with some other operating companies.  As often happens, the train was a short formation and many passengers had to stand in the aisles and in between carriages, also in first class.  It was bedlam, with Covid recommendations impossible to observe.  The first class catering was pathetic - still water, tea/coffee and biscuits - that's it.  Eventually crisps were available, about 2.5 hours into the journey. The seats and carpets are worse than standard class on other trains. The toilet by first class was out of order and so was another on the train. The train did arrive on time - but that is the only good thing that can be said about the journey.  Lessons: Crosscountry is dire, with crowded trains (why so often short formations?); travelling first class (which is expensive compared to some other companies) is a total rip-off and should be avoided; their captive market for some journeys, with no competition, might be good for the shareholders but it seems to encourage shameful indifference to the comfort of passengers, despite the high ticket costs.  I do hope that they lose the franchise.

items.title: 3 traumatised pensioners
items.review_text:
3 of us travelled on the 10 08 train from bradford to
Edinborough on Thursday 15th July we wanted to get off at berick on tweed as a freind was meeting us when we got to our station we got up and colected our things we are 3 pensioners so we aren't as quick as we used to be when we got to the doors they shut on us we were traumatised as we could see our freind on the station the train only gave us a short time to get off which in my opinion wasn't long enough we were upset, so we told the guard and he took our tickets and was very good he rang head office and relayed the problem and they agreed the train could do an unscheduled drop at dunbar as that's where our freind lived we were extremely grae ful for this as we would have had to go to Edinborough which would have been another 3 hours yor staff were excellent and full marks for sorting it out for us also offering us 3 complymenty drinks on return journey great journey from begining to end the seats ect were comfy, so grateful despite our trauma many thanks
Dianne brewster

items.title: Lucky to get one star
items.review_text: Lucky to get one star. CC rail are the over charging scumbags. I am more fortunate than 80% of travellers and occasionally treat myself to 1st class but what is the point ? All you get is a slightly bigger seat and one free bottle of water on a three hour trip; god forbid if you ask for a small mixer can sized coke you get told to pay£1.50. Avoid this shower at all costs, GWR rule.

items.title: I was on 19.03 From Birmingham to…
items.review_text:
I was on 19.03 From Birmingham to Leeds.
Met a lovely member of staff called Jo in first class. 
She looked after me with tea and biscuits.
Jo was very good at her job, friendly and chatty and most of all a big smile ☺
The best customer host I've seen in along time. Fiona👍

items.title: Oxford to Southampton
items.review_text: Southampton to Oxford - the guard was really helpful and pointed me in the right direction for carriage C. Oxford to Southampton, the guards sent me from one end of the train to the other. There were several blank carriages and some lettered ones but no carriage C. The guards didn't know where carriage C was. I was told to take a seat in unassigned carriage H. Like I said to the guard, good thing the train wasn't busy. Who knows what it's going to be like after July 19th.

items.title: First class ticket but 3rd class service
items.review_text:
Paid for a first class ticket between York and Edinburgh, in part as easier with my disabled partner. The train itself was shabby and the toilets smelly. 

The attendant in first class was really in the wrong job. She was disinterested and just short of rude!

There were absolutely no refreshments on board and when I questioned this I was told I could go to the back of the train for a coffee. So I left my partner in search of breakfast, passed through every carriage to the rear of the train where I was met with a man with some flasks and a microwave. I managed to get 2 coffees but they had no snacks left. 

On return to our seats I told the attendant that this was poor service, especially when we had paid for first class. I was told very rudely that the fare was for the journey, not refreshments. 

Returned today from Edinburgh by GNER and was a totally different experience. Cross country really need to get their act together. We will certainly never use them again!

items.title: Absolutely useless
items.review_text: Absolutely useless, booked tickets online. never got the email with the E-ticket. Tried for days to get through to someone on the phone and I just got the horrendous music for hours on end. Tried to use the online chat, and that was pointless, they just tell you to call up. 50 quid down the drain as I had to just get the tickets at the station.

items.title: I booked my ticket £7 train that went…
items.review_text:
I booked my ticket £7 train that went outbound at 19:39 
I don’t expect trains to be cancelled and I didn’t look as I was in a rush untill I got to the station , when I looked and checked they said my train was cancelled so I asked a member of staff if I could get the next one with the same ticket , the staff at the train station said yes no hesitation so I got onto the next train at 20:09 and started my journey 3 stops down they start asking for tickets and I showed them mine and I told them my train was cancelled the ticket inspector then says “ it’s not my fault the management team is coming down in a minute so you have to explain that to them “ I was furious if I wasn’t allowed to go onto that train why did the staff tell me I could, I’m disgusted I payed for my train to my destination and it’s your fault it’s cancelled you guys really need sorting out

items.title: Covid does it exist? And what the point on reserve??!
items.review_text: First time on this service, book a seat and could not seat there due to it being occupied. The while journey was never checked, the whole journey asked to wear a mask to have a group of roughly ten just shouting and dancing up the ailse with no masks, fair some can not, but the whole group can not ?!

items.title: Said they'd take me to court over me…
items.review_text: Said they'd take me to court over me not having a Railcard when I did and the person on the train said it was fine. Emailed all evidence they totally ignored it and still insisted I pay or go to court. Absolute c u n t s who care about nothing but money. Stay away!

items.title: Covid Safety concerns?!
items.review_text:
Covid Safety concerns?!
Journey/18.45 from Bournemouth - Southhampton /8.6.21./  
A group three healthy looking young passengers were travelling without masks throughout our journey; two ticket conductors passed through the carriage without challenging the group whether they were exempt from wearing masks or not ………..  what’s the point!. …….. fobbed off with a standard ‘customer relation’ response “ ..we can’t police it”

items.title: Great Service from Shiva
items.review_text:
Had to book and reserve some seats from Barrow in Furness to Penzance for my neice.
Spoke with the call centre. Mr Shiva Mamindla helped me. He was excellent very helpful and informative and so very polite. Thank you Shiva.
He made it all so easy!

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: Got on a train from from Birmingham. Sat in 1st class and when asked for tickets we asked to pay  to upgrade. Extremely rude Train Manager would not allow us to upgrade and said it would not be fair to other passengers to upgrade from Birmingham to Stafford (although no other passengers in the carriage!!!) No reason to not allow upgrade at all. 6 of us in a group and wanted to sit together on our return journey. Jobs worth.

items.title: No cash accepted
items.review_text: Cross Country trains don't accept cash as a form of payment the last time l checked notes and coins are legal tender and they should not refuse cash as a form of payment. I experienced this problem of cash being refused as a form of payment in many places not just cross country trains even hotels and some shops and train stations.all Cross Country need to do is accept cash as a form of payment and if they are scared of covid 19 then wipe the notes and coins with dettol wipes. I don't know why cash is being refused its very frustrating

items.title: Hats off to the gent who walked through…
items.review_text:

Absolute legend
Sorry I couldn't get his name but he was an older gent on the 14:12 from Birmingham New Street to Chelt spa on 31-05-2021 (hot day!) 

Hope someone gets this to him and tells him he was a legend

items.title: Poor service

items.review_text: Slow Internet that can't run YouTube anymore and regularly delayed. The Internet used to be fine before the pandemic, so to entice back customers they downgraded the WiFi and reduced them to one an hour I guess?

items.title: Travelled from Birmingham to York on…
items.review_text: Travelled from Birmingham to York on First class, I just wanted to write about Martin who looked after me, I had broken my wrist and he couldn’t be more helpful onboard and helping me off the train with my luggage, very attentive, well done on your service.

items.title: Racially targeted
items.review_text: DO NOT BOOK THROUGH THIS COMPANY! The train inspector Racially targeted the black family in the carriage next to me implying that they didn’t have a ticket when they all did as well as booking proof- also were extremely rude to them but the guy was nice to the rest of us (white) people in the carriage. The mother was clearly visibly uncomfortable and upset but was unwilling to make a scene in front of her young children so I tried to file a complaint afterwards but due to lack of evidence the matter couldn’t be taken any further. Absolutely disgusting company - we are in the 21st century there’s no need at all to embarrass humiliate and target minority groups !!!

items.title: No concerns of enforcing social distancing
items.review_text: We are constantly being warned to not use public transport,I decided to train up from Basingstoke to Leamington coach F had a group of  7 teens not one wearing PPE as per announcement! they were smoking under the table, not once did any inspections take place there were 2 staff members in the next coach, with an average of 5 to 7 passengers in each coach the staff must be bored doing nothing the staff need re training on the values of PPE and the next covid lockdown

items.title: Just Awful
items.review_text: I dropped my ticket whilst changing trains, I had email proof, a receipt, and a seat reservation coupon. I was on a business and working. The ticket inspector straight away said I  had to purchase a new, full single for the remainder of the journey, no comprise, no discretion. a very patronising inspector indeed! I've seen so many people waived through with much less. I've paid twice, absolute jobsworth!

items.title: if I could rate the journey I had today…
items.review_text: if I could rate the journey I had today I would give it 0. very subpart normally but guy taking my ticket was being horrible to me.

items.title: They literally think they're the law, lol
items.review_text: A few months ago I was travelling home from work (that could not be done from home) and a CrossCountry employee announced over the tannoy that only KEY workers, in possession of written documentation proving their key-ness, would be permitted to travel and that we would be required to present this as they passed through the train. I was terrified of being fined or even arrested, because I thought this actually might be the law and I'd just not noticed it before now. In the event, I hid in the toilets like a stowaway and queried this policy when I got home. It turns out, the policy is total nonsense, no such legal requirement exists or ever has, and I was wrong to believe the announcer. Everyone I spoke to at CrossCountry about this problem lied and lied and lied. They flatly denied that anyone had said anything of the sort, then they told me it was a BTP policy (it isn't, as I checked), then they told me it was the government guidelines (it isn't, as I checked), then they told me that statements made by CrossCountry employees were not CrossCountry's responsibility... and at no point did anyone ever offer me the ghost of an apology for having lied to an entire train full of people about what is, and is not, the law. Shameful.

items.title: Season ticket holder
items.review_text: Season ticket holder. Key worker. No social distancing on my commute. Went to first class, was empty. Would have sit there for 15 min travel time. Immediately reprimanded by staff. (I would like to see such overzealous staff telling passengers to put their feet off the seat btw). Very rude. Swearing. Allowed apparently. Customer service gone.

items.title: I would like to give a big thank you to…
items.review_text: I would like to give a big thank you to the assistance team that helped me on my journey from Leicester to Brockenhurst on the 21st December 2020 which involved changing trains twice. They were most efficient and made my journey stress free.

items.title: Do not apply for a job with this…
items.review_text: Do not apply for a job with this company!?

items.title: Poor staff, no social distancing
items.review_text:
Booked ticket on Cross Country train, as I was advised to do so.
Someone was in my seat. They were with a large party of people with no social distancing. The person just moved over. I said I am not sitting next to you, with no social distancing. The group just looked at me then laughed.
I went to find a member of staff, gentleman was in 1stClass. I explained situation but was just told to get out of 1st class.
I had to stand by the toilet for journey as could not access other part of train to try n sit down.
What is the point of booking a seat? Are cross country only concerned about 1stclass passengers?
No wonder the country is in dire with Covid19 - no social distancing at all.
Unlike east midlands trains. Will not use cross country again especially at this time with Covid19 going around - far too dangerous

items.title: Absolute rubbish. Avoid
items.review_text: Absolute rubbish. No customer service and very I'll mannered staff. Avoid if you can

items.title: Singled out by staff
items.review_text: As a frequent user of the train service I was appalled that for the first time I felt singled out by a member of staff. I had booked tickets for a birthday surprise (hadn't reserved seats as it was only a short 30 minute journey). We sat in a carriage, followed social distancing and well away from any other passenger, the seat wasn't booked. Numerous people also got into this carriage, which wasn't first class, and sat down. We were seated for all but 30 seconds, the train hasn't even left the station, before a conductor marched her way over to us and demanded whether we had the right ticket. I explained that yes I had booked tickets to which she again repeated her question, in a quite patronising manner. It was at this point that my partner realised she was asking whether we had reserved these exact seats. I said no but this seat isn't booked (as the display above said so). The conductor then told us that we would have to leave this carriage and go find seats elsewhere, resulting in us having to walk through multiple carriages (which isn't ideal considering covid). I was mortified and had to embarrassing walk passed all the other passengers carrying suitcases. The unusual thing about this experience was that she specifically came straight to us, despite being in the middle of the carriage. I felt singled out based on our appearances even though we were following all the usual measures and being a paying customer. I suppose the lesson is to book a specific seat but regardless this experience ruined my weekend and I wouldn't use this service again.

items.title: Draconian tactics
items.review_text: Well what can I say. Missed train due to a road closure with no diversions in place, asked for a credit note as I use trains frequently and was basically told that because of the Corona virus they had been told to "play it by the book" and had it not been during the pandemic they may have done something. Very classy cross country keep up the good work. And please enjoy my £42.50 to which I received no value. Maybe it can go to your Christmas party. Have a drink on me 🤣🤣🤣🤣🤣

items.title: I used this service for the first time…
items.review_text:
I used this service for the first time Thursday from Bristol parkway to Birmingham new street, decor is a bit out dated but the cleaner I think her name was Chanel was really helpful, she showed me to the catering area and the toilet which to my surprise was clean and smelt nice (that’s surprise for train toilets) 

Decor - 1/5 
Cleanliness 5/5
Staff 5/5

items.title: Abysmal system for booking Bicycles on…
items.review_text: Abysmal system for booking Bicycles on trains coupled to awful use of space in carriages and an apparent total unwillingness to make improvements.

items.title: Disgruntled worker
items.review_text: I have worked out of reading station for x-country as a on board cleaner through an agency for the last 5-6 months,while most people where at home self isolating putting my self at risk and my family,frontline worker,key worker so to speake. All reports of my work had been excellent from train managers to rsm's to catering supervisors until a new csm came along as a graduate from uni. She did not like that I speake as is and was not happy with my work,she was always looking over your shoulder every 5 seconds and checking your work. You can not work under those conditions. She check my work one morning and found a couple of bits of rubbish in the bins,she was not happy I had not done as she had "instructed" also I changed setts a station to early that she had instructed. She had a informal meeting in between my 20 minutes of break, so I had no break.  The up shot of conversation was my employment was terminated. Yet all reports of my work was excellent. Way da go x-country for treating your workers that risked theire life for others. If you are looking to work for them at reading or Bournemouth think wisely, Bournemouth csm I here is a bully.

items.title: Worst customer service ever
items.review_text: Worst customer service ever. Train was cancelled due to a landslide on track but company keep making excuses why they will not refund me. They refuse to give address to send tickets to and after 28 days say to late to claim.

items.title: Fed up traveller
items.review_text: Been trying to obtain a refund since March . Unable to travel due to covid 19 government lockdown. No problems with LNER , however Crosscountry keep coming up with things so that a refund cannot be obtained . Worst train company ever , I’ve been stuck at Stansted , Peterborough and Cambridge previously when they cancel trains with a minutes notice . Time to revoke their licence as a train operator.

items.title: Horrible attitude of the train manager
items.review_text:
Horrible attitude! After paying a little fortune for a train ticket, I was asked twice by staff to move my seat, because of Covid rules. They actually made me sit closer to the other passengers, breaking the social distancing rules.
When I expressed my opinion about ridiculousness of the situation to the train manager, he said, that if I find it ridiculous I shouldn’t be using a public transport and I can feel free to jump off the train at the nearest station. He acted like he was deliberately trying to provoke a conflict. I wasn’t aggressive of offensive in any way, so I don’t think I deserved to be treated like a yob, like the Cross Country staff was doing me a favour letting me using their service. The train manager was extremely rude and offensive and I never experienced this kind of behaviour before. Very disappointing.

items.title: Rip off!
items.review_text: Booked first class to go up to Edinburgh and I have to say I was so disappointed. The seats, carpet, and tables were tatty. No one even came round with any refreshments. Now you would think despite social distancing that they would have given us a least a bottle of water? but no. I think I'll stick to standard if this is the best Crosscountrycan do. And people wonder why Britain's railways are seen as inferior compared with continental Europe.

items.title: Disappointing
items.review_text: I bought a first class ticket and didn’t buy food or water for the journey. I knew there wasn’t service in the carriage but I was told passengers would get a complimentary pack from the snack bar. I went to collect my ‘pack’ and it consisted of a cup of tea and a tiny Genoa slice. Given my journey spanned the lunch period I thought I’d get a sandwich at least and a bottle of water. I contacted them via twitter and they just said ‘thanks for the feedback’. I paid £150 for the ticket! Absolutely appalling. Virgin used to provide free water in first class, free drinks and even on weekends you got a proper snack box. They’re just using covid as an excuse.

items.title: Terrible Customer Service - No Covid Refunds
items.review_text: I was unable to use the train tickets I'd purchased due to being in an area which had been put on local lockdown. I had only purchased them the day before. All other trains I had booked with other train services for the same week gave me a full refund apart from Cross Country Trains who refused. They said that I should book new tickets which have to be from the same train station that I had previously booked from and the ticket price needed to be the same or higher and that this would be my 'refund'. That is not a refund, that's just poor customer service. It shows a willingness to allow people to travel who shouldn't be, putting others in danger. Will not be booking with or traveling with Cross Country again unless they can rectify this.

items.title: I enjoy travelling by cross country…
items.review_text:
I enjoy travelling by cross country trains because they are very reliable and very cheap.
They always get me to my destination early. 
I highly recommend them.

items.title: Very poor service
items.review_text:
Very poor customer service, recently travelled 1st class from Manchester to Bournemouth, before we travelled (6.7.20) there was nothing on website about lack of refreshments but did have menus for 1st class food and a map showing that our route had catering service. Due to this we didn't take any food and drink. When we boarded we were told that there was no catering at all! Not even water, we had a 4 hour 45min trip with nothing!
Customer service not interested and do not accept they have a duty of care to their customers. Having, at very least, water should be available, especially for passengers travelling such a distance. There is now a limited service available but on our return this was available at the other end of the train from 1st class.
We have been offered £30 in vouchers, against a £235 each ticket (£470 total). Told them it was an insult but not interested, a bit like the rude staff on the train.
Will never travel with them again.

items.title: Travelled on the 1818 from cheltenham…
items.review_text: Travelled on the 1818 from cheltenham to cardiff 13.6.20.conductor very helpful,well done.

items.title: Extremely dissatisfied with the service…
items.review_text:
Extremely dissatisfied with the service and their customer care. I have booked a season ticket and with the booking confirmation, they have shared a customer care number. I was waiting for more than 1 hour 15 min for talking with a customer care representative and after that time, one lady(Ms Churni Khasnobis) picked up the call.

I have two points: 1. I have requested for a partial cancellation on 05 Mar to my booking from Leicester to Chesterfield which was planned on 06 Mar over a telephone. The representative confirmed my cancellation. Even after so many days they haven't processed my refund. I came to know today that the payment was rejected as I have activated my ticket before cancelling it. 

As far I know in UK you can't activate a ticket before the travel day. So I think technically it is not possible. Finally after lot of discussion she has connected me to her manager who has verbally confirmed me that she will be reprocessing my cancellation. I am not sure what will happen next.

Point 2: I had to request cancelling my current season ticket for rest of the days as my Office is not allowing working from office anymore due to current situation. The number I dialled as I have received with my season ticket booking from Cross country. Now she has provided me with another no: 03445561344 and told me that this is the number for season ticket department. The question here is if they are not suppose to answer for season tickets then why a other department numbers were given for contacting further on season ticket and harassing and wasting customers time?

Do you think that after waiting for more than 1 and half hour, you will l just answer with a alternative phone number and will say "sorry for the inconvenience caused" is sufficient for the customer?

I am highly dissatisfied with cross-country and will definitely not going to use it for any of my future bookings.

items.title: Cross country trains, hang your head in shame.
items.review_text: Have bought an advance ticket, the government advises us not to travel. These crooks will not refund tickets, absolutely disgraceful. Why have I got to give them one star when really it should be zero.

items.title: Total Con
items.review_text: After traveling with them on 28/02/20 from Exmouth to Frome with the connecting train in Exeter being over an hour late after service was cancelled, with not a hint of compensation for being over an hour late. They now send me a email late on a Saturday afternoon about traveling on Monday 16/03/20 knowing full well that the number they give you is not being in opperation on the Sunday. CON TOTAL CON

items.title: Show got Cancelled coronavirus no refund on ticket
items.review_text:
The Photography Show got Cancelled in Birmingham due to CoronaVirus and I had an Advanced Ticket on Tuesday 17th March at the last day of the Show to Plymouth. 

Won't refund me even though I won't be using the service. The show cancellation was out of my hands but I'm still paying for an empty seat on the XC train regardless. Quick to take money from me but refuse to give it back even when these things are beyond my control. Very poor service and will do my best to avoid XC in future.

items.title: Get some 125's!!!
items.review_text: Good that tickets aren't really expensive, but need more carriages on their 220's. Should either operate 2 coupled trains as one, or get some InterCity 125 sets, as they are way more roomy and pleasant than the 220. Trains often overcrowded, the one I'm on is full to the brim and all seats reserved.

items.title: 'Customer Service'???: charged twice for one journey due to download failure. !!
items.review_text:
Yet again the rubbish app isn't working. I've tried to book my journey above for the last hour. The same old thing showing: invalid user credentials and then a retry button. I've had to complete journey info 12 times, log in more that 6 times and retry in access of 40 times. 

I was charged twice for one journey when the app wouldn't download my ticket. Officious staff at New Street failed to provide me with a ticket even though I had proof of purchase and the download failure was not my fault. Customer Service have refused to refund and compensate me quoting 'policy' (ignoring their duty in law and as per the Customer Charter!!!). I've spent hours on this and have been really inconvenienced (I missed my connecting  train due to being marched off to buy a second ticket!). 

I'm disgusted with my experience:officious staff, and especially 'Customer Service' (that's a laugh!!) who are appalling. This is how this company value a frequent traveller!

items.title: Very unhappy with the service, standing up for hours!!!.
items.review_text: Very unhappy with the service!!! from Southampton to Derby I was left standing all the way cramped in-between carriages with loads of other people shoulder to shoulder by the toilets because there was no seats!!. I lost my reserve seat because the trains were delayed due to a derailment. I also had the same issue coming back and had to get another train because it didn't go to Southampton Central had to change at Leamington Spa. I complained and filled out their form to get compensation and have received NO REPLY!!!. They caused me back pain having to stand and I demand money back. Not happy. I noticed now they have had to get more carriages.

items.title: 1 star is too generous
items.review_text:
1 star is too generous. Outside of offpeak times, these services are very crowded on all areas I've experienced over the years. Cardiff to Nottingham, Exeter-Leeds and Birmingham-Leicester. The tickets have gotten more expensive and the crowding has got worse.

Why oh why does the team who plan the Rolling stock allocations think that a 2 carriage Turbo star is acceptable on the rush hour services from Birmingham to Cardiff. Surely the volume of seat reservations on the service is an indication of use. 

It is no longer acceptable. I have seen 1980s and 2000s rolling stock attached together to form longer trains for west Midlands trains, so why not do similar for cross country rush hour trains. You could couple them up at New street, then couple them at Gloucester. Is that really so difficult to do? Or is it simply about the money. If it is. The cross country execs should receive no bonus and should be held responsible. It's an embarrassment for UK railways.

items.title: Long journey. Short trains
items.review_text: Can you imagine one of the longest train journeys in the UK and only FOUR carriages. For much of the journey it felt like the London Underground. This does no credit to our international reputation. Really? 2020.

items.title: Charged for a full price ticket only to…
items.review_text:
Charged for a full price ticket only to stand in the isle, whilst 1st Class had plenty of empty seats. 

Ridiculously over priced too

items.title: Would honestly give lower if i could
items.review_text:
Would honestly give lower if i could. 
Pros: staff is friendly enough

Cons: everything else, trains are constantly delayed, late and short. Miserable experience to commute daily from Nottingham to Birmingham daily, their delay compensation system is garbage as they only refund over 30 minute delays when their delays mean i frequently miss connecting trains and buses. Seats when you can get to them are often old and broken. All in all, absolute misery.

items.title: Consistently appalling
items.review_text: Only six standing in vestibule today on 16.12 from Birmingham.

items.title: The worst train service in the UK
items.review_text: The worst train service in the UK. So uncomfortable, like a cattle truck. trying to find alternative train companies to get from Nottingham to Southampton. Alternative means I have to get across London on the underground - I am sight impaired and this will be tricky and lengthy. There is a law that protects people when ‘it’s not what it says on the tin’.

items.title: Cross country trains awful
items.review_text:
Expensive at £300 standard and £600 first class Manchester to Dorchester open return, when you consider I have recently booked BA return flights Manchester to San Diego for £400.

Crammed to point of having to stand for large part of the journey with awful WiFi signal making work during travel very difficult.

Would avoid cross country trains Manchester to Southampton at all costs. Would rather drive next time.

Only plus host checking tickets and doing food trolley really friendly and helpful. And leg of journey Southampton to Dorchester with south western much better.

items.title: 10th Feb - very helpful team
items.review_text: Travelled yesterday (10th Feb) in the aftermath of the high winds. Diversions were in effect and Cross Country Trains staff were exceptionally helpful throughout both journeys ensuring everyone knew when and where to change trains.

items.title: Like many people
items.review_text: Like many people, I was stranded in Leeds. I had tried since yesterday afternoon to return home. Our trains were cancelled due to the weather. The Northern Railway staff were not very sympathetic. Thank you very much to the manager of the Leeds to Glasgow train (Cross Country Line) this morning. She welcomed a few of us to her train without extra costs. This is truly the best customer care I received for a long time. Thanks to her, I finally made it back home.

items.title: TMW Cross Country journey to York
items.review_text:
I am on a Cross Country train travelling Bham to York. Due to weather conditions most trains cancelled including my original booking. This is 8.48 Bham to York. It is a delight to be on the train and most grateful to all working on this train today. Very helpful and informative announcements in a clear , professional voice. 
Excellent! Refreshments served by a polite and again most helpful person. Also thank you to the driver for safely carrying passengers, despite such dreadful weather conditions. Well done Cross Country. This is excellent service considering adverse weather and difficulties. Thank you.

items.title: There should be a rating of zero- late…
items.review_text: There should be a rating of zero- late again. What really annoys me is that we all sit here in silence until a staff member  from cross country decides to tell us why we are late - well after the time of departure. Then the train driver talks incessantly about why he is late. Had we known in advance of the late departure we could have changed trains. Public transport is a joke.
